title: Create "quickstart list" on jbrowse-desktop which users can add to
body:
Concepts

1) Downloads https://jbrowse.org/genomes/sessions.json at electron app startup, using code in electron.ts
2) Splits the sessions.json file (containing multiple assemblies, etc) into separate files in ~/.config/@jbrowse/desktop/quickstarts/hg19.json, hg38.json, etc.
3) Users can add their own files to the quickstart list by using a star icon on the recent session panel
4) Users can delete and rename quickstarts
5) Deleted quickstarts get a '.deleted' file added e.g. hg19.json.deleted which means, they can delete things that would come from the sessions.json
6) The quickstart list is updated in the GUI every 500ms. This is easier and maybe even better than designing an observable/reactive system because it is hard to design a reactive system based on the filesystem, and often polling is the best way here (even typescript does polling on a large scale).

Screenshot
![Screenshot from 2021-10-07 12-53-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/136429780-8ad8526a-6bf2-4adc-bc35-08974417edaa.png)

title: Visiting a share link with authenticated resources may activate pop-up blocker
body:
Step 1: Add a google share track
Step 2: Create share link
Step 3: Paste into chrome or firefox
Step 4: Observe pop-up blocker is activated

This can be remedied by manually disabling the popup blocker

One approach to fix would be to create a button in the track area or similar so the user can create the popup (normally popups are allowed if there is a specific user action to trigger the popup like clicking a button)

title: Bump typescript to 4.4.3
body:
This is a major version bump of typescript from 3->4. Typescript doesn't really follow semver, so it's not really much of a thing, but notable changes include: more monitoring of using `delete` operator, more bug fixes and improvements as usual, and caught exception type is set to `unknown` (previously typescript was type `any`). The catch type unknown is the most visible change, and this unknown type is  propagated throughout the code (setError et al are set to receive an unknown, and in the end, normally just stringifies it)

Also bumps storybook version, and hard requires webpack to a specific version in root of the app (otherwise it gets bumped by storybook, making CRA complain)

title: Save desktop sessions as a single user-placed file
body:
There was discussion of this in previous issue, but I thought I'd bring it up in its own issue to make discussion easier.

One idea for desktop that has been discussed is to make desktop sessions be contained in a single file, and the user chooses where that file is saved. That differs from the current model where sessions are auto-saved in a hidden user config directory.

The user choosing where the file was saved would be similar to them choosing where a Word document they were working on was saved. This way they could know where their sessions are and e.g. easily be able to find and attach them for debugging purposes.

This would also allow us to open JBrowse by double-clicking the session file in the file system.

body:
This PR has several small changes I wanted to propose after working with the desktop app:

- Reduce size of saved session thumbnail image. Now saves at a width of 250 (the size of the preview image in the card) instead of full window width.
- Fix bug in mm10 preloaded config where it would not open by itself because it didn't have a defaultSession
- Fix bug where if you checked and then un-checked an assembly, it would still be in the session (also disable "Go" button while no assemblies are checked)
- Move tooltip on toggle button from the contents to the toggle button itself, so that the tooltip will show up even if hovering over the edges of the button.
- Rename "table view" to "list view" in start screen. Small survey (at least my OS's file explorer and Google Drive) shows this to be the commonly used term.

title: Update typescript to 4.x
body:
This is a general housekeeping thing. To avoid going stale, i thought upgrading typescript could be useful, and catch more errors.

It actually works well and I was able to upgrade it except that the final build of the codebase runs tsdx, which uses typescript 3.x and does not like the type annotation on try/catch which is added in typescript 4.x

In order to fix, we could make a workaround for this or try to perhaps remove references to tsdx in our own codebase

Initial attempt at upgrading typescript, which works until the final building of the codebase https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/tree/bump_typescript (run log https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/runs/3779737118?check_suite_focus=true#step:5:448)

title: Add auto update functionality for jbrowse-desktop
body:
This method will create a method for auto-updating on desktop. I tested this on a mac

Notes

- There are now many more release artifacts, the blockmap files, the latest-*.yml files are needed for auto-update

- The mac needs both a dmg and a zip because without the zip it gives an error to the auto-updater (https://github.com/electron-userland/electron-builder/issues/2199). Zip could also be used separate from dmg e.g. like a non-installer

- Bumps requirement for the monorepo to node 14 because electron-builder needs it. I could revert this particular change but it seems best to stay updated, and this just requires node 14 via the engines field

- Adds snap and appimage options for linux. AppImage was what previously was only available, but snap might help a subset of users

- The workflow for the updater doesn't have any status for it updating, but it updates on restart

on v1.4.5, with a popup that automatically pops up on startup
![Screen Shot 2021-10-02 at 7 09 27 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/135734511-23fda846-b50a-48f3-9fcf-d1d094f5abb4.png)

on v1.4.6 after restarting app
![Screen Shot 2021-10-02 at 7 11 47 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/135734513-527cb1a5-73fb-41a6-b941-6d1988b46d44.png)

fixes #1922 

there are some improvements on this that could possibly be made, e.g. tying this into the App UI rather than using system dialog boxes from electron.ts, but this seems like it may be an ok first pass on things

title: New LGV opens with unexpected track if text search index is present
body:
**Describe the bug**

When you open a new Linear Genome View for an assembly that has a text search index configured, there is a track that automatically opens. It doesn't seem clear why this track is opened, and prevents the users from seeing the "Open track selector" prompt.

**To Reproduce**

1. Go to https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/main/index.html?config=test_data%2Fvolvox%2Fconfig.json&session=share-jRHwHCUbTG&password=uo73a
2. Click "Launch view"
3. Click "Open"
4. See that there is a track already open

**Expected behavior**

There shouldn't be any tracks already opened

**Version:**

Currently on `main`, does not appear to be present in v1.4.4 release.

title: Add tooltip with track description to track selector
body:
When looking at https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/discussions/2367 and thinking about how people can differentiate their tracks, I realized there is no tooltip on the current track selector entries (there were on previous iterations of the track selector). This adds such a tooltip. I think this can be a useful way for people to keep information about their tracks easily accessible.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/135668026-e7ce016b-6c83-4616-8684-922c8f6e5cce.png)

title: authenticate files through spreadsheet view ;; skips stat() if it fails
body:
reason for change:

GDC does not support stat(). when putting a GDC resource through the spreadsheet view, stat() cannot retrieve the size of the file and then errors and aborts the operation ;; spreadsheet view is required to visualize BEDPE files.

additional changes enable authentication to go through the spreadsheet component

title: Add ability to open plain-text GTF files
body: Similar to opening plain-text GFF files.

title: Move desktop beta to main releases for github workflows
Add some typescripting of some jbrowse classes
body:
This is a small PR to typescriptify jbrowseModel.js and JBrowse.js in jbrowse-web

It is always nice to have a little more "type" coverage of the codebase

Uncovered an interesting thing where the postProcessor of jbrowseModel was not really doing it's job (of removing the baseUri attribute) because it wasn't getting the attr passed

https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/compare/tsx_jbrowse?expand=1&w=1#diff-edd77609d1a93193117475df3a391d96c5f4fdb64bd56676f59e7665f40ae638R219

This then required, after fixing that, that we actually clone the snapshot object before delete'ing attributes off it (mst gets unhappy if you delete attributes from the raw snapshot)

This also allows us to delete a duplicate logic for deleting baseUri in the admin-server

title: master and child config.json files
body:
First of all, thanks a lot for jbrowse: I've been using it quite extensively, and it runs flawlessly.

I've been including a lot of data sets in the same environment, causing my json.config file to be pretty large (>2000 lines) and unorganized. Once you have 3, 4, ... subcategories per feature track, it make more sense to manually edit the config files (copy/paste + edit) rather than use the build in jbrowse functions. It would be nice to have one 'master' config file, where you can link several 'child' config files. This would enable structured data to be organized better, and is especially interesting when working with multiple researchers/bioinformaticians on the same jbrowse environment. Upon research, I don't think such a feature exist?

Thanks, Lennart

title: Add more unit testing for embedded and desktop
body: Currently most test suites run against jbrowse-web. It may be useful to run more tests against embedded and desktop

title: while running jbrowse text-index: events.js:174, unhandled error
body:
Whenever I run `jbrowse text-index --out path/to/jbrowse2`, I get following error:

```
root@ea95d858738a:/jbrowse2# jbrowse text-index --out /jbrowse2                                      
Indexing assembly Aspergillus oryzae RIB40...
░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░ NCBI-AspOry-RIB40 0% | ETA: 0sevents.js:174
      throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
      ^

TypeError: Object.fromEntries is not a function
    at Object.indexGff3_1 (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/@jbrowse/cli/lib/types/gff3Adapter.js:60:46)
    at indexGff3_1.next (<anonymous>)
    at resume (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/@jbrowse/cli/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:208:48)
    at fulfill (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/@jbrowse/cli/node_modules/tslib/tslib.js:210:35)
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:68:7)
Emitted 'error' event at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:91:8)
    at emitErrorAndCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:59:3)
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:63:19)
```

Some additional info
- I'm running jbrowse/cli/1.4.4 (upgraded using `jbrowse upgrade`) inside a Docker container.
- I have 4 different gff files in my config.json file.
- Specifying a gff with the `--tracks` option results in the same error for each gff.
- My gff files have both Name and ID attributes in the gene rows.
- There is a symbolic link within the jbrowse folder that links a mounted data folder (containing all fna, gff, bam, wig, ... files), which has worked fine.

Any idea what triggers this error and how it might be fixed?

Thanks! Lennart

title: Make file chooser more configurable by internet accounts
body:
This is a proposal for more adjustments to the file selector UI. I wanted to make the UI easier for the most common cases. I think that the large majority of users will have either no internet accounts configured (default for web) or Google Drive and Dropbox configured (possible future default for desktop). There does need to be some way to handle many configured accounts in the UI, but since that's an uncommon case, in this branch that particular UI does not show up until three or more accounts are configured. By default with two accounts configured, the UI looks like this (all four possible states):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/134997408-3d3199af-e049-4f12-b4af-0236283a046a.png)

With more accounts, there is a "More" button, and selecting an account from that menu moves it to be the last displayed account.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/134998797-1795e22f-f0e3-43e2-8ef0-6c3ff779f436.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/134998828-aaf07c61-ce7e-4f3b-ba38-af1c651b3942.png)

In discussion earlier with @peterkxie and @carolinebridge-oicr, it came up that using text instead of icons might be more clear, but I think that because this is designed to be a compact UI, the ability to use icons makes it cleaner and easier for the user to understand. There are tooltips on the icons:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/134999220-a1ca4924-e5b8-4070-a989-4cbeefe1d60d.png)

The icons and the label text (e.g. "Enter Dropbox share link") are now optional parts of the account model, so each account can define them. It also allows internet accounts to provide their own component for selecting a location, so it could use something besides the URL input box. No accounts currently use this, but it allows for adding things like a custom file picker for some resource.

This PR also splits the file selector components up into multiple files since it was getting large.

Also missing is the "Add account for authentication" button. I think this will be necessary in the future, but not for the first release. Users can add an HTTP Basic account by entering the URL in the normal URL field, and the account will get added when the track tries to access the resource. We don't have a UI for configuring the other account types, so we can't add them in the track selector for now. I think once we have an internet account manager UI, there should be a button in the file selector that opens that UI where users can add or manage any type of account.

Also removes the external token account from the volvox config since it doesn't have a usable example.

title: adding additional msging, truncate long names in ui, spacing
body: ### Changes - changed messaging for index file, to be more clear for the user what will happen - spacing changes to the informational message when the user is on an internet account (i.e. the icon is centered now) - condition for extra-long internet account names that they will be truncated if they exceed 12 characters (not in the dropdown menu, only on the ui display) - added a label to the URL field, it really needs something there otherwise it looks completely empty, and I can see a user missing the field entirely - moved the url field down below the grid containing the button group and add account button to make it consistent if the window is resized **Here's what the UI would look like without term truncation:** **And with truncation:** **Full name preserved in the dropdown menu:** **IMO, the add account button looks weird attached to the button group and I wish it was justified to the end but I can't accomplish that if we want to maintain the use of Grid on this component. It is a minor visual thing, but I think we should consider using flex for this entire component if this is troublesome.** Also shows what shorter names look like.

title: Better keyboard navigations on text search autocomplete component
body:
Alternative to #2346 

Number of changes here

* Streamlines the logic in the handleSearchResult
* Removes LocStringResult, instead checking on option.locString existing
* Makes autocomplete a controlled component that goes back to the previously displayed value using onBlur
* Removes blurOnSelect, but still get a similar behavior to blurOnSelect due to the controlled component behavior above

title: Use main "module" field instead of "browser" from dependency package json files electron builds
body:
This restores ability to use localfiles  after regression in https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/2332

This fixes it by actually making the webpack build for electron ignore the "browser" field in package.json

Also upgrades generic-filehandle (after https://github.com/GMOD/generic-filehandle/pull/88)

title: Bug related to search results, the first time it loads
body:
I see this issue consistently, but I cant quite track it down. I'm happy to do debugging on my end if you can provide some guidance. I can also give access to my lab's site to attempt to repro:

- We have an embedded react-linear-genome-view, where some of the tracks have per-track search indexes
- When you load the session, it gives you the dialog to pick a location and tracks
- When you type into the search box, it loads indexed features, as expected.
- if you type something, like 'tnf', it loads genes, as expected. I'll point out this is the first time this store loaded and you generally see a 'loading' text on the combo before results return.
- if you use the arrows and hit enter to pick a gene, it does not select it. The contents of the search box are unchanged.
- if you hit enter, nothing happens
- if you type again, at which point i assume the store backing this search is loaded, you can type 'tnf', use arrows to pick a gene and hit enter. only by this second time do the contents of the search box change, and hitting enter will navigate to the gene of interest.

title: Fix ability to use JB1 backcompat text search adapter
body:
Trix adapter was updated here. https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/2298
Need to update the JB1 text search adapter. AssemblyNames field is used to filter the necessary adapters during a search based on the assemblies those adapters cover.

title: Add `http-range-fetcher` back
body:
This adds `http-range-fetcher` back due to concerns described in [this comment](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/2279#issuecomment-921322346).

To handle various authentication models needing to use their own `fetch`es with auth headers, etc., it adds it back in a different way. It extends `RemoteFile` to `RemoteFileWithRangeCache`, and anything that wants to use the global range cache can use that class instead of `RemoteFile`. This does not require any changes to `http-range-fetcher`

title: Update input text on import form when selecting an option
body:
[In this PR Issue 2345](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/2345)

* Uses display string on select from import form 
* removes the blurOnSelect option from the autocomplete component

title: selecting an option from the import form does not update the value on the textbox
body:
<!-- Please fill out as much of the template as you can. -->

Selecting an option from the import form (before opening the LGV or pressing enter) does not update the value of the input box with the correct display string or label that was chosen.

<!-- Put a clear and concise description of the bug here. -->
To reproduce:
1) main branch
2) human sample data
3) open LGV
4) search for brca
5) click on BRCA1
6) the value of the inputbox does not change


<!--
Describe here the steps to reproduce the behavior, e.g.:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error
-->

The value of the autocomplete should change from brca to BRCA1 when clicking on the first option

<!-- Put a clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->


**Additional context**

Note: the import form does open the LGV with the location/option that was selected, but for clarity the text value should also change.

title: Track ID for per-track indexing
body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/discussions/2339
Originally posted by **bbimber** September 16, 2021 I have a jbrowse 2 session where my config contains a GFF track. This track was indexed standalone using "jbrowse text-search --file xxxx.gff". When I type into the search box i get the expected typeahead. When I pick a feature and the dialog pops up, i get: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7724863/133691981-3dff96d6-2e82-4d25-971c-9e22fbd35213.png) The results are valid, but is there a reason track is "N/A"? I'm guessing maybe this has something to do with aggregate indexes (which need to be aware of track), and per-track indexes? The code must "know" the track for these results though?

title: Make HTTPBasic dialog use a form
body: This is a small change so that the HTTP Basic account dialog uses a `<form>`. This allows the user to be able to submit with the <kbd>Enter</kbd> key as well as enabling the browser's built-in form validations.

title: Workaround for Google Drive not exposing Content-Range
body:
I was able to load a BigWig from Google Drive just fine, but CRAM didn't work. This ended up being because Google Drive doesn't expose the Content-Range header, so whenever the filehandle called `stat` (which it does on CRAM but not BigWig), it errored out.

This workaround provides a custom `openLocation` for Google Drive accounts that uses a custom filehandle that overrides the `stat` method. This `stat` gets the file size by getting the file metadata from the Google Drive API, since it can't get the size from the Content-Range header.

It also switches to using a different endpoint for the file contents so that v3 of the Google Drive API is used instead of v2. @peterkxie this will probably need to be fixed to restore `fetchFile` like you fixed my Dropbox code in 36ab6f59b578b63fb538d0d6c7cebd1a4f27631d.

This has been tested by logging in with the file owner's account and logging in with a different account when the file is shared and both scenarios work.

title: `jbrowse upgrade` does not clean up old worker files
body:
I don't know if this is expected behaviour, but when `jbrowse upgrade` is run, many copies of the following three files are produced, while the old set of many files remains with the different hashes.

```
worker.js
worker.js.LICENSE.txt
worker.js.map 
```


**To Reproduce**

Run `jbrowse upgrade`

**Screenshots**

here is what the files are:

```
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu  175644 Sep 16 13:10 0.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu     173 Sep 16 13:10 0.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.LICENSE.txt
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu  398593 Sep 16 13:10 0.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.map
...
...
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu    1682 Sep 16 13:10 50.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu    2914 Sep 16 13:10 50.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.map
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu    2701 Sep 16 13:10 51.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu    5480 Sep 16 13:10 51.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.map
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu    6181 Sep 16 13:10 52.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu   17346 Sep 16 13:10 52.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.map
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu    1784 Sep 16 13:10 53.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu    5239 Sep 16 13:10 53.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.map
```

And only some has the copy of the .LICENSE.txt
```
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu     173 Sep 16 13:10 0.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.LICENSE.txt
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu     173 Sep 16 13:10 1.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.LICENSE.txt
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu     173 Sep 16 13:10 26.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.LICENSE.txt
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu     173 Sep 16 13:10 27.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.LICENSE.txt
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu     120 Sep 16 13:10 3.ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.LICENSE.txt
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu    6548 Sep 16 13:10 ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.LICENSE.txt
```

When following command is ran to remove the copies:
`rm *.ff8da6869c2040672276.*`
`npx serve .` command works as it's intended with the remaining files:

```
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu 2469983 Sep 16 13:10 ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu    6548 Sep 16 13:10 ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.LICENSE.txt
-rw-rw-r--    1 ubuntu ubuntu 8747310 Sep 16 13:10 ff8da6869c2040672276.worker.js.map
```


**Version:**
```
@jbrowse/cli/1.0.4 linux-x64 node-v13.14.0
```

```

VERSION="18.04.5 LTS (Bionic Beaver)"
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS"
VERSION_ID="18.04"

Ilayda

title: Add jbrowse-img to monorepo
body: This is a proposal to add jbrowse-img to the monorepo. Benefits would be better testing, less likely to experience random breakage, etc.

title: Implicit displayId identifier
body:
This changes the displayId to an implicit identifier, so that users who might be configuring a display by hand do not have to specify an arbitrary displayId

Can see in the diff that displayId's are by default removed

title: Rearrange ordering of dropdown options
body:
Would like to display options that more closely match query towards the top of the dropdown list.

It can be confusing to have to scroll down the dropdown to find the exact match.

We can modify the ranking of options that match the option label or display string, so that the manager knows how to sort them. 

e.g  searching for Notch in autocomplete (hg19 example)

Notch1 should be displayed towards the top of the dropdown list vs the options that were matched due to its description.

title: Add method to ensure @jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view has proper package.json dependencies
body:
Release of v1.4.0 had two issues with package.json's not having proper dependencies ...it would be good to ensure that these are installed properly

Possible methods

0) Try eslint-plugin-import again but as far as I could tell this was inadequate
1) Manually try installing and using @jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view after publish
2) Try some automated version of (1), either after publish, right before publish, or on every push

title: Fix ability to use LocalFile on nodejs-based apps e.g. @jbrowse/img
body:
Currently jb2export is broken on local files because a check for allowing local files, around the time electron was changed to use normal webworker instead of electron windowworkers (79e799fece)


This PR makes it so that LocalFile is allowed anytime the environment detects isNode===true, not just if it is electron (e.g. jb2export is a plain nodejs process)

title: Don't sort sequences in FromConfigSequenceAdapter
body: A user using the FromConfigSequenceAdapter and the React Circular Genome View noted that it was unexpected that the regions around the circle were not in the same order specified in the adapter config. I agree that this seems unexpected and propose that we don't sort and instead keep the sequences in the same order they are specified.

title: Fix bugs preventing embedded circular genome view from rendering in some circumstances
body:
- Handle feature.get('ALT') being undefined so that non-VCF features can be used
- Set stroke width back to 1 when chord is no longer being hovered over
- Make renderProps not a getter to match recent changes

title: Use ../ for all doc links and use trailing slash to fix links
body:
Currently I found there are links that can end up broken if you click through the docs

Especially if you follow a link someone gives you e.g. https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/quickstart_cli#indexing-feature-names-for-searching

And then you go on to click the link to the CLI docs

This fails with a 404

There is a subtle behavior where the browser or server automatically adds a slash


So if you copy and paste https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/quickstart_cli into the browser, then it becomes
https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/quickstart_cli/
and then navigating to
./cli
is
https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/quickstart_cli/cli
when it should be
https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/cli

However it is subtle also because currently, clicking on
https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/
Then clicking quickstart_cli, gives you
https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/quickstart_cli 
No slash is added


This PR takes an approach that is kind of weird

It turns on a setting for trailingSlash, so that a trailingSlash is always added

Then it makes all docs use ../ to refer to each other

This is not a great outcome for doc usability, it is just unclear why the ../ is needed. We could also use absolute paths with / if interested

However, this would fix our issues on the website

I created https://github.com/cmdcolin/docusaurus-nav-issue/blob/master/README.md to demo the issue in docusaurus and a follow up here https://github.com/slorber/trailing-slash-guide/pull/6#issuecomment-919263203

title: docs - quick start link broken
body:
This link is broken

https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/blob/v1.4.4/docs/quickstart_cli#indexing-feature-names-for-searching

Source page:
https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/releases/tag/v1.4.4

title: Publish @jbrowse/plugin-trix and add as dependency to @jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view
body: Would probably want to re-release as v1.4.1

title: Fix blogpost url formats
body:
The current blogpost url format got a little weird in https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/commit/41b9f3e460dddb9a292986736e71b3ffe8e196de#diff-1bba00e5aca52286a667c09eff92ba2ca8e3ca77e0d31b0599cc829ab0173389

This was unintentional, it was thought this would just be a datestamp in the blogpost itself

Now the filename is containing date only, blogpost can have datetime

title: Remove unused wrapForRpc functionality
body: I think in the current code, there is some unneeded ritual around the RPC calls that is probably unneeded. With this change, the only thing wrapForRpc does is initialize the statusCallback on the call properly

title: Remove session related menu items from jbrowse-desktop
body:
The menus plugin adds some menu items by default but it was recognized by @garrettjstevens that maybe the logic doesn't necessarily apply the same way for desktop now that a session on desktop is more like a full config

This removes the session options in the File menu on desktop, and for jbrowse-web, moves the code for adding those menu items to the products/jbrowse-web/ app

title: Fix install plugin workflow and error handling on desktop, update to electron 15
body:
The code in #2247 fails to automatically reload the page to the right session after the user has exited

This adds code in the Loader of jbrowse-desktop that allows specifying a "query parameter" to the electron session that let's it restore a particular config

This query parameters on desktop could also be used for automating desktop via the CLI

Also adds text searching to desktop...random add on but just found it in the process

title: Add show descriptions toggle box to most feature tracks
body:
There is currently a "Show labels" toggle box that hides both label and description

This adds a "Show description" toggle box that just hides the description part of the feature label

title: Fix issue where add track widget doesn't infer adapters on second usage
body:
The add track model improperly "clears" the trackData and indexTrackData state and this makes it so that the second time you use the form, the inference doesn't work

This fixes that

It also trims whitespace from the filename which fixes when you copy and paste with a string that has a space at the end or similar

title: What happened to version version 1.3.4?
body:
JBrowse versions **appear** to jump from version 1.3.3 to 1.3.5. My installed version (installed using the CLI) reports that it is 1.3.4 but an upgrade to 1.3.5 appears to do absolutely nothing.

I'm a newby and I'm confused.

title: Multi-word search returns empty
body:
Searching e.g.

"protein kinase" in volvox returns empty

There is some code in trix to return results from multiple words but I think it's not well tested

To properly handle, it may be that the trix search adapter would receive e.g. a record for

protein

And another for

kinase

And then would have to observe that these are the same "protein kinase" entry, and then combine and prioritize them over other kinase or protein search results

title: Highlight a search result feature in track
body:
Currently if a search result is hit, it may be outside the current scroll view, requiring the user to scroll down to see it

It may be useful to autoscroll or force that feature to the top of the layout

It may also be useful to highlight that feature as a feature selection or similar automatically

title: Make a new displayMode that collapsed transcript isoforms
body:
In many cases, the large number of transcript isoforms is a bit overwhelming. The reducedRepresentation displayMode is nice but it just draws a block instead of any exon-intron structure

A nice reference point for this could be the biodalliance default gene track https://www.biodalliance.org/

Clicking the plus icon on the track label expands out the transcript isoforms

title: Add --incremental text-index flag
body: It can be useful to incrementally update a text index. Ideally the text index is fast enough that a full re-generation is possible but it may be useful to get the --incremental flag. It would basically involve indexing the new files into an ix file, then concatenate the old ix file to that ix file, and then re-sort it, and then generate new ixx

We think this would be OK license wise- UCSC has this http://genome.ucsc.edu/cgi-bin/hgTrackUi?hgsid=1162703649_15PX2cT5Q4PVYA4naUjtd0AaZHLZ&db=hg38&c=chr1&g=cosmicRegions

As opposed to the code in that PR the meta.json is unmodified also, it uses the pseudoconfigs in the tracks column instead

title: make metadata's "dateCreated" more easily parseable  and update demos
body:
* Changes the way we create the timestamp for dateCreated in the meta.json to be more compatible 
* Updates all the demos for text searching

title: trix index metadata's "dateCreated" isn't always easily parseable
body: The `dateCreated` field of the trix metadata uses `String(new Date())`, so it looks something like `'Tue Sep 07 2021 13:50:40 GMT-0600 (Mountain Daylight Time)'`. You can parse this string back into a date easily with JavaScript, but it wouldn't be so easy with another language. I'd suggest using `Date.now()` instead for maximum compatibility.

title: Add new pluggable element type and properties to adapter type for registering adapter association with 'add track' workflow
body:
Resolves #2135 

These changes are dependent on #2279 merging into main first, as these changes synergize with the auth changes and are a part of that need/workflow.

Changes:

- adds a new pluggable element type `AdapterGuessType` that allows a plugin to register:
<t>1. a name coordinating with the adpater the guess is for
<t>2. a regex expression to guess the adapter given a string with a suffix
<t>3. a coordinating track type to suggest for the user given the adapter type
<t>4. a function to fetch the configuration for a given track with that adapter
- adds two new optional properties to `AdapterType`:
<t>1. `externalPluginName: string` which allows an adapter type to identify its external plugin name to sort it with a header in the adapter selector dropdown menu in the Add Track workflow
<t>2. `excludeFromTrackSelector: boolean` which allows an adapter type to identify if it would like to be excluded from the adapter selector dropdown menu in the Add Track workflow (e.g. `SNPCoverageAdapter`)
- adds code infrastructure to eliminate adapters with the `excludeFromTrackSelector: true` property from the UI
- adds code infrastructure to add headers over a set of given plugin adapters if they share the `externalPluginName` property within the Adapter Selector dropdown menu

Example:

If I have a new Adapter for my plugin, I might register it as,

```js
    pluginManager.addAdapterType(
      () =>
        new AdapterType({
          name: 'MafAdapter',
          configSchema: mafConfigSchema,
          AdapterClass: MafAdapter,
          externalPluginName: 'GDC Plugin Adapters',
        }),
    )
    pluginManager.registerAdapterGuess(
      () =>
        new AdapterGuessType({
          name: 'MafAdapter',
          regexGuess: /\.maf$/i,
          trackGuess: 'VariantTrack',
          fetchConfig: (file: FileLocation) => {
            return {
              type: 'MafAdapter',
              mafLocation: file,
            }
          },
        }),
    )
```

which will register my adapter and my adapter's associated guess properties for the Add Track workflow. In the above example, my adapter will appear under a header in the Adapter Selector dropdown that reads "GDC Plugin Adapters". The adapter will also be able to be guessed via its provided regexGuess if given a file directive that ends with `.maf` and return the proper configuration by running the file provided through the Add Track workflow to its configured `fetchConfig` function.

title: Use encodeURIComponent for trix encoding instead of base64
body: This makes the trix index files about 25% smaller but also, more human readable

title: Don't rely on SVTYPE=BND for breakend split view options and thicker mouseover chords on circular views
body:
This PR works in tandem with a major version bump to @gmod/vcf
https://github.com/GMOD/vcf-js/pull/69

The reason I found this is because there were breakends in the COLO829 dataset (on config_demo.json, hg19) that I wanted to check out. They are actually representing an SVTYPE=DEL using breakend representation, and it was not possible to do breakend split view on this example.

To fix, my strategy was to have basically "point-of-use" breakend parsing: most usages of the breakends should know when they need it parsed out, and can do so at that point by importing parseBreakend from @gmod/vcf


Also, some notable other things:


FromConfigAdapter does not need to have logic for parsing out mate/bnd/chr2, it does not respond to getFeatures requests with data about those mates, and ref renaming for those entities actually has to be done on the client side (see https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/1911#issuecomment-821243233)

title: Use a less greedy file watcher for lower dev CPU usage
body:
This proposes using a less greedy file watcher for our default yarn start setup

It also removes the max header size because we now use session sharing rather than huge url sizes

The less greedy file watcher helps reduce CPU usage considerably from ~6% CPU (what i see pretty much constantly while `yarn start` is idling, similar to the ~7% reported in the issue) to nothing (in issue it is reported as ~0.2%) 

https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/31048


e.g. this is pretty much what my computer looks like 100% of the time developing jbrowse
![Screenshot from 2021-09-05 14-06-37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/132137410-821f6435-16a4-4216-9f26-a860bfbfb3be.png)

The reason why this PR is in question is that Typescript decided not to make it their default at the time being due to some rare caveats but IMO it is rare enough that we could make it default

Laptop temp cooler===happy

title: Updates user guide docs to show text searching example
body: Adds section under user guide, and updates statement to reflect name searching is now available in JBrowse2

title: Update trix to return the matched search term if it is not part of the label
body:
This proposes an update to trix to take advantage of https://github.com/GMOD/trix-js/pull/8

This let's trix return the search term that it matched with

So now, we receive [kinase, base64([locstring,trackId,EDEN,EDEN])] as a search hit

And then the search manager changes it to display a "displayString" by default. The displayString is the label, unless the trix search term is not in the label, in which case it is the label + ' ('+trix search term+')'

This is because label is used for re-performing the search in exact mode on the user hitting enter, so I do not want to re-perform the search as "EDEN (kinase)"

title: Add extra re-exports for default modules
body:
There are some inconsistencies in the way things are re-exported from core. For example, most of the pluggable element types look something like this:

```js
import TrackType from '../pluggableElementTypes/TrackType'
const libs = { '@jbrowse/core/pluggableElementTypes/TrackType': TrackType, /* ...all the other libs */ }
```

But the render type looks like this:

```js
import * as RendererType from '../pluggableElementTypes/renderers/RendererType'
const libs = { '@jbrowse/core/pluggableElementTypes/renderers/RendererType': RendererType, /* ...all the other libs */ }
```

Most of the renderers are like that, but the chord renderer is different:

https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/blob/67a19b3d04f72f576ddbbf4f48ca67cb29965b3d/packages/core/ReExports/modules.ts#L63-L67

This has some implications for how these are used at runtime. To properly get the TrackType at runtime, you have to do:

```js
const TrackType = JBrowseExports['@jbrowse/core/pluggableElementTypes/TrackType']
```

But for RendererType you have to add a `.default`

```js
const RendererType = JBrowseExports['@jbrowse/core/pluggableElementTypes/renderers/RendererType'].default
```

The real problem gets to be when a build system is trying to compile a plugin. These two imports looks similar:

```
import TrackType from '@jbrowse/core/pluggableElementTypes/TrackType'
import RendererType from '@jbrowse/core/pluggableElementTypes/renderers/RendererType'
```

but have to get compiled differently to use the global JBrowseExports properly. Our current UMD plugin build does some things to try to smooth this out, which work most of the time, but building to other targets doesn't work as well. Also, if core were ever used directly as a module running in Node, you'd have to worry about putting `.default`s in the right places as well.

The change in this PR doesn't change any of this behavior, since I didn't want to break anything, but it does add some exports for the renderers so there is a consistent and named (not default) way of importing them that build systems can understand more easily.

title: Use react-popper to reduce tooltip lag on pages with many elements
body:
This uses react-popper library manually to create a tooltip

It is a second approach to  https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/2284

This can now display it's tooltip outside the bounds of the track

See snpcoverage for example here, displaying over the track panel


![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fvolvox%2Fconfig json session=local-1W7VU8L7u](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/132031022-41e21640-2b3d-4e1c-ad1c-2391e43503c2.png)


The calculation of the width of the tooltip is done manually with getBoundingClientRect. It doesn't appear to perfectly track the coordinates of where you want to display it

I think that overcoming the limitations in #2284 will be good, and while it takes a fair amount more code to do it this way, it helps greatly with the users perceived speed on the page.

I think it is either this or we get rid of some tooltips by default

title: Add ability for jbrowse-desktop to open a config file
body:
It could be useful to allow jbrowse-desktop users to open a config that is preloaded with tracks, assemblies, plugins, etc.

This was previously called "Open jbrowse web config" as a button in jb2 preliminary PR but was removed

Also similar to "Open data directory" in jb1 jbrowse desktop

Issues:

Make it easy to understand what it does for the user
If opening from a URL, create a local copy of it probably?

title: Faster tooltip method for feature tracks and wiggle tracks
body:
Currently our code for doing tooltips makes a fake div at a particular position and then wraps that div with a MUITooltip

This ends up getting pretty slow when the page gets busy, and can strongly affect perceived performance of the page getting bogged down, when really it's mostly the tooltip getting bogged down and the various popper.js calculations to try to keep it on the page.

If we don't have strong need for all the popper.js calculations that are done, we can adopt a PR like this

A fairly "busy" page is like this http://localhost:3000/?config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo.json&session=share-bh9n1V64we&password=IRpTf

Both the feature tooltips and wiggle tooltips are a bit improved on this complex page

mousing over the bigwig and feature tracks is quite painful on v1.3.5/main branch here

https://jbrowse.org/code/jb2/v1.3.5/index.html?config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo.json&session=share-bh9n1V64we&password=IRpTf

much faster here (once build gets uploaded)
https://jbrowse.org/code/jb2/faster_tooltips/index.html?config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo.json&session=share-bh9n1V64we&password=IRpTf


there are "nice things that popper does" e.g. trying to keep the tooltip on the page if it overflows but I think the benefits of speed strongly outweigh these extra calculations right now

title: Fix ability for the variant detail panel to create breakpoint split view for <TRA> elements
body:
This adds the feature.get('type') for some variant symbolic allele types

The VariantDetailWidget  actually needs (in some form, or it has to change itself) because it checks for feature.type==='breakend' and feature.type==='translocation' but the translocation one wasn't working

title: Create a text-index CLI mode for embedded use cases
body:
concept: embedded  indexing of per-track and aggregate text search adapters. justification: embedded doesn't really have a config.json that the jbrowse-web uses

```
jbrowse text-index --file myfile.gff
```

outputs
```
myfile.ix
myfile.ixx
```

if --file specified multiple times it outputs an aggregate

```
aggregate.ix
aggregate.ixx
```

Add docs for embedded. I'd add this to storybook probably, and maybe interlink from config_guide

title: Make a demo with the gene description indexed + update autocomplete dropdown results
body:
Currently if we have description indexed, a gene might have a keyword like kinase associated with it

If I search kinase the gene name EDEN comes back from the textsearchmanager

The search result that is displayed in the autocomplete dropdown should probably say EDEN (kinase) or something like this if possible

We should add this functionality and a demo of it on volvox

title: Split up/restructure core
body:
It can be hard to keep up with making sure that what is in core is re-exported in `packages/core/ReExports/modules.ts`. For example, I just recently realized the `util/range` utils were not re-exported. Anything that's not re-exported can't be used by plugins.

It would be a pretty breaking change, but I'd like to at least explore the possibility of re-organizing core to be easier to use and maintain. Specifically I'd like to explore:
- Is the sub-package importing (e.g. everything is imported from `@jbrowse/core/<something>` actually helping with code splitting? If we could export everything at the top level, it would make the re-exports much easier to maintain
- Could we split core up into multiple packages? Specifically I think "core" for things that plugins use and "app-core" for things that probably only jbrowse-web and jbrowse-desktop would use could be good. Maybe a third "ui" package for various React components as well.

title: Add Internet Accounts and Authentication Capabilities to JBrowse 2
body:
This feature adds internet accounts to JBrowse 2 for use with authentication. This initially comes with support for 4 methods

1. OAuth
   - Dropbox
   - Google Drive
2. External Tokens (enter a token from an external resource to use in an Auth Header)
3. HTTPBasic

title: New text-index command is not showing results in search box
body:
Hi folks! 👋

First off, thanks for the great components & tools!

My issue is, I have a Jbrowse 1.3.5 React component running [here](https://smm-data.herokuapp.com/dna) which shows a GRCh37 assembly with a Variant Track of my SNPs originally from 23AndMe.  It seems to work great, however I've run into problems trying to make it searchable.

For some reason I couldn't find  `jbrowse text-index` as a command in 1.3.5 (this seemed strange since I thought it was an existing feature), so I pulled latest `main` and built the CLI.  I was then able to run `jbrowse text-index` which produced the various trix files, about 50Mb which seems to list all my variants by `rs________` Reference SNP.  I pushed these to S3 where they are [world-readable](https://bucketeer-b2ec4285-3f6c-49c8-9753-fe99a1df2ac6.s3.amazonaws.com/public/raw/dna/trix/GRCh37.ix) and added them into my config file per the [instructions](https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/config_guide#text-searching).

The component compiles fine, however nothing seems to show up in the search box.  It's possible I'm misunderstanding something but I was expecting to be able to type in something like `rs4747667` and jump to that variant's location.  Is it possible the new text-index isn't backwards-compat with 1.3.5?  Any help is appreciated.  Thanks!

**To Reproduce**
A copy of the config file I'm using is [here](https://bucketeer-b2ec4285-3f6c-49c8-9753-fe99a1df2ac6.s3.amazonaws.com/public/raw/dna/config.json) which contains public URLs to all relevant files.  This is passed to a React component via the normal means:
```
const textSearchConfig = {
    assembly,
    aggregateTextSearchAdapters,
    tracks,
    defaultSession,
    location
  }

    const state = createViewState(textSearchConfig);
    return <JBrowseLinearGenomeView viewState={state} />;
```
**Expected behavior**
Entering a Reference SNP code e.g. `rs4747667` would jump to that location.

**Version:**
1.3.5 of React component with latest `main` of JBrowse2 CLI tools.

Browser is latest Chrome

title: Bug with BgzipFastaAdapter and small files
body:
<!-- Please fill out as much of the template as you can. -->

**Describe the bug**

Compressed and indexed fasta files that are small in size throw an `Error: unable to determine size of file at {url}` error in react linear view with with `BgzipFastaAdapter`.

**To Reproduce**
The error seems to happen with any relatively small file, as an example: [small file](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/nuccore/34577062?report=fasta)

Fasta, compressed and indexed files have the following sizes:
fasta.gz: 1.1 KB
fasta.gz.fai: 26 B
fasta.gz.gzi: 8 B

Adapter: `BgzipFastaAdapter`. Doesn't seem to happen with `IndexedFastaAdapter`

**Screenshots**

![Screenshot from 2021-08-30 17-00-38](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35040129/131405522-5583ce3c-9a4f-4423-9864-bcbfebf791f1.jpg)

jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view: 1.3.5

1. Select something from dropdown box
1. Realize maybe it's the wrong thing I clicked
1. Click field again

title: Create prop for paper depth in react-linear-genome-view
body:
Currently, we automatically wrap the `react-linear-genome-view` component in a MUI paper div. This provides a nice styling default. However, there are times where it has caused problems, where the "depth/shadowing" effect clashes with the existing styles on the page. Examples are Nextstrain, and Jupyter so far.

I'm proposed to make a prop to control the depth of the paper, even setting to 0. The default could remain the same, but exposing it is a prop would give more control to users who might not want that styling choice imposed on them.

title: Update text search
Update text search
Force publish all packages on release
body:
This attempts to force publish all packages on each release, despite if they have not changed

This could be considered overkill and a reaction to the v1.3.4 to v1.3.5 release thing but it seemed to have resulted in a fair bit of confusion. It may be best to publish all every time. The only downside may be taking up a bit more npmjs.com server space

https://lerna.js.org/#command-publish

title: Make copy button on sequence feature details have a plaintext copy option
body:
PR to fix #2257 

Instead of using copy-to-clipboard package, this use the native clipboard API to make the copy to clipboard.
If not available, it will fall back to the deprecated execCommand API.

While this fix the issue, it loses the ability to copy a sequence with color.
So at the request of @cmdcolin  I have also added a `Copy HTML` button. It still uses copy-to-clipboard for this, as the clipboard API is too recent to be used with HTML (usage with HTML is experimental with Firefox and was added to Chrome less than a year ago) and I wasn't able to make it work with execCommand.

Note before merge, test on Safari is needed, as I have seen people having problem with it concerning clipboard, and I don't own a mac to test.

Before:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24433720/130996305-71c6dfb2-2899-41dc-a67e-474787568df1.png)

After:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24433720/131007231-d1395040-0e0d-4de0-892d-2a8d1786a9fd.png)

title: Update admin-server to accept value from ?config= so that multiple configs could be edited
body:
Possible fix for #2139 

This would let the admin-server receive a config path from a client and write to it

Note that with the current admin-server, something like this is possible: you setup --out to a specific config.json, and then you navigate to that specific config using &config=

However, if you wanted e.g. to edit multiple configs in the same admin-server session, this PR would help

title: New jbrowse-desktop start screen design
body:
This is a proposal for the jbrowse desktop start screen redesign
- It includes a predefined datasets e.g. hg19 and hg38 on the start screen that user can easily launch. This is a simple preconfigured config.json for those assemblies
- Config+session are wrapped up into single file on desktop (e.g. session is dynamically put into defaultSession on a config, and the "sessions" are full configs that are serialized into the userdata e.g. ~/.config/@jbrowse/desktop/sessions)
- Ability to open e.g. the pre-existing config.json's made for web locally on desktop (e.g. open the volvox config.json, it converts uri into localPaths on loading to make this work, and also it does not write over this config.json, but instead just reads it and writes data to the ~/.config/@jbrowse/desktop/sessions directory. this is less of a decision that was made and more of a "it just worked out" to do it like that, but could try to change if needed)
- Ability to open a new assembly directly from the start screen similar to the "Assembly manager" form
- Refactors loader on desktop so that it does not load any initial config or pluginmanager. This could be somewhat be reconsidered but I think it helps to think of it this way because there helps especially with achieving goals around toggling between entire config.jsons at the start screen.
- Converts electron.js into electron.ts to get a little type safety assurance, and updates some of the "session" concepts to deal with configs instead


Table of recent sessions (togglable in UI)
![Screenshot from 2021-08-23 16-26-14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/130514682-e7e7e997-85d8-4fb9-a592-f17c6c627e37.png)


Cards view of recent sessions (togglable in UI)
![Screenshot from 2021-08-23 16-25-09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/130514518-edc69683-3d58-4438-ac8c-25d18550023f.png)

View launcher
![Screenshot from 2021-08-23 16-17-22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/130513557-78a25378-0ef9-4bc7-bafe-735dccfec15f.png)


Open sequence file dialog
![Screenshot from 2021-08-23 16-33-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/130515634-5bf01174-064c-4882-ac66-80f3ebe0e2ab.png)


Open pre-existing config dialog
![Screenshot from 2021-08-23 16-34-34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/130515680-546c044e-4586-4f73-840e-d8d624fb9462.png)


Note for view launcher: Currently disappears if view.length>0 but we could instead have the view launcher available too

Note also: this was sort of a blazing-the-trail type thing, and uncovered interesting technical hurdles like merging the session and config together into one file. I am open to design updates too for this but I think this PR does manage to take care of a number of issues that have come up during UI review

title: Fix missing regenerator runtime dependency in core
body: According to the [babel docs](https://babeljs.io/docs/en/babel-plugin-transform-runtime), if you use `@babel/plugin-transform-runtime`, you need to have `@babel/runtime` as a dependency for the package. This adds that missing dependency to our `@jbrowse/core` package. It also makes the "regenerator" option for that plugin be `true`, the default, because I was still seeing errors while troubleshooting #2244 unless I made that change.

title: Module not found: Can't resolve 'fs' in Jbrowse 1.3.3 with Next.js
body:
<!-- Please fill out as much of the template as you can. -->

**Describe the bug**

Hi,
I have tried to upgrade to Jbrowse 1.3.3, but since this update, I can't build my Next.js project, as I got the following error:

In dev mode:

```bash
./node_modules/@jbrowse/core/util/io/LocalFile.js:42:0
Module not found: Can't resolve 'fs'

Import trace for requested module:
./node_modules/@jbrowse/core/util/io/index.js

./pages/index.js
```

And this one when trying to build the production version:
```bash
Failed to compile.

ModuleNotFoundError: Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'fs' in '/export/home1/users/mpb/zweig/Desktop/projects/nextjs-jbrowse/node_modules/@jbrowse/core/util/io'


> Build error occurred
Error: > Build failed because of webpack errors
    at /export/home1/users/mpb/zweig/Desktop/projects/nextjs-jbrowse/node_modules/next/dist/build/index.js:390:19

**To Reproduce**

Step to clone and launch it:

cd nextjs-jbrowse
# Dev environnement 
yarn dev

yarn build && yarn start
```  


**Version:**
Next.js: 11.1.0
Jbrowse: 1.3.3
React & React-Dom: 17.0.2

title: Import bookmarks functionality for grid bookmark widget
body:
I had a quick interest in getting a import bookmarks function implemented

This let's a user quickly import a BED formatted file. The name column 4 is stored in the "label" field

It also has a couple more add-ons

* replaces the NA default export with a . which is the standard not available data description for BED
* makes it so duplicates in bookmarks are allowed, as this may come from data files, and rather than filtering on import, it retains them (note that if this was not done, then strange errors would occur on editing fields)
* makes the hover style on links in the grid bookmark widget cursor:pointer

Some motivation to this includes my feeling that you can easily loose track of your session 

During development especially, I cycle through tons of sessions and I imagine a user may also, and if we're not careful, we would loose our bookmarks (since bookmarks are currently tied to session...). So if we can at least re-import them, it seems useful

Just an idea I picked up and ran with :)

title: Restore previous window location when re-opening on desktop
body:
I've been using this change to make working on desktop easier, so I thought I'd put it in as a separate PR.

This adds `electron-window-state`, which keeps track of the size and location of the window is in when it closes in JBrowse Desktop. When you re-open JBrowse Desktop, it restores the window to the same size and position.

title: Fix some backcompat for view menuItems
body:
The change to make menuItems into a function makes it somewhat challenging for previous plugins who used menuItems as a getter

This attempts to add a little backcompat

Minor cleanup of unused styles also

title: Detect assembly loading error and encapsulate error instead of failing at app level
body:
This PR allows detecting that an assembly failed to load for either the case of 

(a) a defaultSession loads a view who has a displayedRegion assembly that fails e.g. 404
(b) browsing the import form and selecting an assembly gives an error e.g. 404

See #2235 

The volvox demo data has a "volvox404" assembly added that is always a 404. To test, you can also generate other errors by turning off network in chrome or inserting a throw into the sequence adapter's getRegions function or similar.

This results in a couple places where we have to be careful to clear the error state. There is the view model's error state, and there is the import form components error state. The import form components error state is initialized with the model's error state, and import form onSubmit clears the model's error state

This is also for the LGV only, and if we want to put it into other parts of the app, we may need to perform more effort, or create some better abstractions.


![Screenshot from 2021-08-19 18-02-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/130150657-b92a08e6-b553-446b-8a6d-1caed270c42c.png)
screenshot showing the 404 from volvox

title: Improve assemblyManager error handling
body:
Currently if a single assembly fails to load it errors out the whole app e.g. rootModel.setError, as seen in #2234  and #1316 

It may be useful to have a "single assembly failed to load" state since, if for example, you have a larger list of assemblies and one failed to load, that will make the whole config hard to debug (you would not, as currently implemented, be able to enter the app at all)

title: Use extendPluggableElement for context menu items

This removes the need for there to be an autorun that watches for new displays and adds "additionalContextMenuItems" to them. Instead, it extends the display state model itself so all instances of the display already have the additional context menu items.

title: Text searching VCF driver and ixixx-js update for scalability
body:
This adds a text-indexing driver for VCF, and the updated scalability improvement to ixixx-js (which uses a disk based external sort, xref https://github.com/GMOD/ixixx-js/pull/4)

The reason for the external sort change is there are hard limits with the in memory data structures we attempted to use, specifically that more than 8.3M records in a Object (e.g. {}) that causes 100% cpu and 16.7M records in a Map which is a known chrome limit https://bugs.chromium.org/p/v8/issues/detail?id=11852

There are some packages that try to work around this, but it will put a lot of pressure on nodejs heap, so instead of pushing the limits of in-memory sort, this changes to a disk-based external sort

With this change, 37M records from dbSNP (https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/snp/organisms/human_9606/VCF/00-common_all.vcf.gz from https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/variation/docs/human_variation_vcf/) can be indexed in 40minutes on my machine with 16GB memory, though it never exceeds any large amount of memory consumption

title: Text indexing check against volvox instance
body:
This performs a text-index command on the volvox data directory itself, and then compares the results of running the text with what was already there

If it fails then there are multiple things that could be happening

1) volvox needs to be re-indexed
2) the format of meta json or trix indexes has changed, implying (1) in the case of a bugfix, or a unexpected bug resulting in mismatch

Pretty much a snapshot test but where we can use the results in the volvox instance

title: Fix issue where collapsed categories were not remembered after toggling a track
body:
The title of this PR somewhat underestimates the issue scope but it is what the end user experiences

The collapsed category state was not stored in the widget model properly, and it was causing the code to forget the collapsed categories after a track is toggled (which causes the tree to get rerendered)

Note: Technically it might be somewhat expensive/not the best way to do things for for the tree to get recalculated after things like a track toggle or category collapse, but it seems to work fine afaik

This change is also good because it is nice for the collapsed categories to also be remembered in state e.g. across page refreshes

Fixes #2207

title: Collapsed categories don't stay collapsed when selecting a track
body:
<!-- Please fill out as much of the template as you can. -->

With a config that has many tracks (several hundred) it is important to be able to collapse categories of tracks to make the list usable. When I collapse categories or subcategories and then click to select a track in another category, the collapsed category pops back open. 

<!-- Put a clear and concise description of the bug here. -->

**To Reproduce**
1. Open a linear genome view with many tracks and categories.
2. Collapse one or more categories by clicking on the triangle next to the the category name
3. Click on the checkbox for a track in another category.
4. Observe that the previously collapsed category pops back open

2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error

Collapsed categories should stay collapsed until manually opened.

title: Hide reads with unmapped flag by default in alignments tracks
body:
This is a small change to have "unmapped reads" included in the default set of flags hidden on alignments tracks

Unmapped reads can be weird in that they can exist at a given coordinate but be shown still

1540 can be seen here https://broadinstitute.github.io/picard/explain-flags.html

   read unmapped
   read fails platform/vendor quality checks
   read is PCR or optical duplicate


This is true in jbrowse 1 and igv by default. Had run into this with a hand crafted sam file that had unmapped reads that displayed in jbrowse but not in igv by default.

title: Make the BED parser not interpret general tab delimited data as BED12
body:
The current @gmod/bed parser makes I think too  assumptions about what a BED file is if no info is specified e.g. as with BED tabix files. 

For example, currently the inversion BED tabix files in #2198 are displayed incorrectly (it thinks it is an intron because it thinks it's like a BED12 file)

This proposes using an "unassuming" BED parser that will use the strand/score fields if it makes sense to, otherwise it just stores the fieldnames, and only tries to use @gmod/bed if the code is actually a BED12 file or has autoSql attached

With this change added, the BED tabix files in #2198 display properly e.g. just as boxes indicating the region of the inversion, and some fields that don't have any description are called field5,field6,field7... in the feature details panel

title: Add better inversion visualization to read vs reference visualizations
body:
In the past PR #2024 the strand got ignored in read vs ref because after drawing negative strand alignments was added to the renderer, it was realized that strand was not specified correctly at that time of loading the data for read vs ref visualizations

This change makes the read vs reference strand become relative to the "original strand" the feature was on.

Intuitively if a read is on the forward strand, switches to the reverse, and back to forward

```
----->   <------ ----->
```

And the left most is the "primary" alignment (the rest are supplementary/split read alignments) then the strands are 1 for primary, -1 and then 1 for supp

But also the data can come in like


```
<------ -------> <------
```

This is fundamentally equivalent but the data is just from a reverse strand template. Therefore we flip the read orientation relative to the original strand when we plot it

Example showing inversion
![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json session=local-6er93LMsa](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/128688622-fa973fe6-38b9-4918-8a87-ee4badd0aff9.png)


In this case the supplementary alignments do not store their cigar strings in the SA tag, so they are not plotted, but the data should otherwise be accurate. The overhand of the inverted polygon with the left side is also I believe expected. We can look at the SA tag and see that it says 5002 bases soft clipped for the inverted part, and this directly corresponds to it starting at position 5002 on the bottom panel (since the bottom panel is the literal sequence, it is just starting at position 5002 because thats how many bases are clipped off)

title: Fix handle leak for killed worker checker
body:
The current code for checking if a worker was killed would progressively create more watchers over time because the resolve was never called. I mistakenly thought that Promise.race might kill the watcher promise

This was found because I saw the code freeze, and clicking the pause tab in the source debugger always ended up at the worker=='killed' line which seemed odd, and console.logging around this line indicated that it could be called thousands of times a second

body:
This could apply to color by settings on alignments or general feature tracks

It could be displayed in the "blurb" area (seen when sorting a pileup track)  so that it is always seen (and exported in svg exports perhaps) and/or it could be in an "About track" menu or similar.

title: Create assembly "displayName" field?
body:
Many assemblies have highly coded assembly "IDs"

We are probably too far gone to rename the assembly "name" field to be "id", but we could add an additional field like assembly "displayName" that allows a more human readable name?

Example:

displayName: "Apis mellifera (Amel_4.5)"
displayName: "Homo sapiens (hg38)"

etc.

Makes it more difficult to find info about the plugins you are running.

title: Increase number of results returned by @gmod/trix by default
body:
This PR makes the trix search adapter return more results by default. This has some implications with duplicated results, because sometimes a query can return many duplicates and then you don't get that many autocompletes. For example in the volvox example, there are many features named seg02, but there are features named from seg01-seg15. It would be nice to list many of them, but if you search "seg", the autocomplete only has seg01 and seg02 in the dropdown. With this change, we get more seg results


Before:
![Screenshot from 2021-07-30 12-23-47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/127682769-8227cef7-69f4-4612-afca-62bbaf310d30.png)

After:
![Screenshot from 2021-07-30 12-21-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/127682586-901c0083-dcd3-4c52-bb7d-15099f5b4bd7.png)

title: Text searching streamline 2
body:
This is a proposal to use a modified stream-based approach for text indexing

Using this approach, we can go from 20+min (hard to tell, errored out) on gencode gff to 30s 

This performs several simplifications. We could consider whether this meets all the requirements after applying those simplifications, but I think it can be workable


1. No use of @gmod/gff- Instead it loops through the GFF line by line with no reconstruction of feature hierarchy
1. Indexes all types that have a Name/ID except CDS/exon (could add extra userfilterable include/exclude filters)
1. Adds configurable --attributes command line flag so that user can choose what attributes to index
1. Does not do description parsing of Note field in GFF by default now, it could be optionally added but jbrowse 1 did not do it by default and i think it may be better to make it a user-supplied option (note that the gencode still errored out even if Note/description were not used)
1. Removes usage of meta.json
1. Accepts a --force flag to overwrite a previous index
1. Uses simply the assembly name as the textAdapterId. This is a little different from the hash-based implementation currently on text_searching branch. My feeling is that we should encourage one aggregateSearchIndex per assembly, and more than that may be, perhaps, per-track adapters. At least as a general guideline. Therefore, instead of allowing them to create a new aggregate search index adapter just with a new set of tracks, we check just for whether a particular assembly has already been indexed and logs a message if so (unless --force is supplied, it won't try to re-index it or overwrite it)
1. Removes usage of createFilterOptions. The default usage of createFilterOptions actually removes returned results that have no overlap with the search string that we entered, however, this currently can happen in this branch. While we can think about this, I think the easiest thing to do is use our own filtering criteria. For example, searching "kinase" returns EDEN, m10, m12, m14 but just their names, not the string kinase. Since it doesn't return the string with any substring containing kinase, it filters them out. Ideally we would say (a) what gene ID/gene Name the search result hit and (b) why, e.g. that it hit in the description of that gene ID. I'm a little concerned this will bloat search index size but we could add a fifth field to our results e.g. the context in which it was found in a feature


Just for context format for the trix input looks like a list like this 

```
/* for each feature */
base64([locstring,trackId,name,id]) ....terms to associate with the base 64 string e.g. the name and id
base64([locstring,trackId,name,id]) ....terms to associate with the base 64 string e.g. the name and id
base64([locstring,trackId,name,id]) ....terms to associate with the base 64 string e.g. the name and id
```

and then the output in the ix file, e.g. the sorted terms to associate all mapped to that base64 string

```
64 base64([locstring,trackId,name,id])
and base64([locstring,trackId,name,id])
associate base64([locstring,trackId,name,id])
base base64([locstring,trackId,name,id])
e.g. base64([locstring,trackId,name,id])
id base64([locstring,trackId,name,id])
name base64([locstring,trackId,name,id])
string base64([locstring,trackId,name,id])
terms base64([locstring,trackId,name,id])
the base64([locstring,trackId,name,id])
to base64([locstring,trackId,name,id])
with base64([locstring,trackId,name,id])
```

title: Updates to bookmark widget
body:
These are a couple proposals for the bookmark widget


1) Uses a method for "auto-calculating" the width of a particular column that is used in the base feature details
2) Makes it so DeleteBookmark is just a dialog and not also a button. If it is a Button with a Dialog state inside it, it will render that dialog many times, even if in a hidden state. I propose extracting the Dialog as such
3) Makes a compact mode. I personally prefer the look of compact data displays, but could understand if this is not what all users want. I add it as an option here
4) Adds a note that lets users know that they can edit the label field by double clicking


Main thing I wanted to do this PR is (1)

The reason is we presupply a pixel width for each column. DataGrid does not have a method to change column widths. It would probably be ideal to have that, but even still, auto-calculating the width of a column is somewhat nice

Example screenshots
![localhost_3001__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json session=local-DCWuY7uMV](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/127578794-a37ff6ff-8b3b-4978-bbe2-8259afc83997.png)
Thin right panel with a long label, can side scroll the widget to see more
![localhost_3001__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json session=local-DCWuY7uMV (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/127578798-2efed02d-b38d-4b62-96a9-0636d28d230e.png)
Expanded right panel with long label, showing the whole label is visible
![localhost_3001__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json session=local-DCWuY7uMV (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/127578802-b06f61aa-6269-4ae0-9d3c-b98f6b673efe.png)
On current bookmark branch, whole label not visible

Curly that points at the middle or top of a view

Or maybe an "aura" around that view

title: Make the Fab component always visible
body:
Currently the Fab (floating action button) component is only visible when the tracklist is open

This can make the discover ability of the Add track workflow a little tricky

We could make this always visible (e.g. always having a yellow circular button at the bottom right of screen) to make it easier to discover

Note that this would not necessarily be associated with a specific view so it is unclear "which view" would get added to when you add a track from here (but this is similar to the menu bar's Add track)

Could possibly have an "Add view" item too

title: Create a special screen for users that might have multiple configs and merging them together
body:
This is a jbrowse-1-ism where we have a datasets screen

@scottcain also mentioned recently how he might be creating multiple config files

We could make a landing page where people could choose from a specific dataset in a list, or combine multiple configs together

We think we could use the term dataset to refer to a config.json essentially, similar to jbrowse 1

title: Create a special case for HTTP 404 config.json not found
body:
Try to avoid a "error bar" or "scary" settings for this case

It is a classic jbrowse 1 type screen where a blank instance looks kind of "erroneous", and we want to make them feel success after a blank jbrowse create rather than red error bar with the raw HTTP 404 error message

title: Text searching streamline
body:
This is a proposal for #1881 

It outputs always to a trix subdirectory and makes sure to perform mkdir on the directory if it does not exist

It also tries to streamline the stream logic a little bit, so instead of branching into different functions, its all contained inline. The ascii diagram while great no longer matches what it does though, so removed!

It also doesn't try adding an adapter for assemblies that were not covered by an indexing task

title: Fix mouseover after force load
body:
Fixes #2130 

This is a surprise where I thought the layout data structure was causing issues and resulted in some layout code restructuring (converting to rbush)

I still think converting to rbush was a good change, but the proximal issue for #2130 is that the code for getting the feature calls

```
       getFeatureOverlapping(blockKey: string, x: number, y: number) {
+        console.log(self.blockState.get(blockKey), blockKey, [
+          ...self.blockState.keys(),
+        ])
         return self.blockState.get(blockKey)?.layout?.getByCoord(x, y)
       },
```

We could even consider this to be a little too low level for BaseLinearDisplay but when you console.log this the blockKey that is received has -reload appended, an earlier way we used to force a rerender, while the blockKeys in self.blockState.keys() do not have the -reload appended. I did not fully map why that is the case, but this PR provides an alternative way to force a re-render where it has a reload tag on the block state, and fixes the issue
