title: Add new embeddable React Circular Genome View
body:
This adds a React circular genome view component that is very similar to the React linear genome view component. It also includes a UMD build for plain-js embedding. See the [README](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/blob/1e8ac57e6b7084d3235f9665fa5773c96351e180/products/jbrowse-react-circular-genome-view/README.md) and [example](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/blob/1e8ac57e6b7084d3235f9665fa5773c96351e180/products/jbrowse-react-circular-genome-view/docs/example.md). Storybook is also included.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/127083123-42bf96a2-d2ad-4e0b-a39b-b0e99c409ea5.png)

There is some duplication of components between this and the React LGV that could be factored out into a separate shared package.

title: Rectangular box around circular chord when clicked (Chrome only)
body:
**Describe the bug**

When you click on a chord in a circular chord track, a black box pops up around the whole SVG group. I think it indicates focus since you can <kbd>Tab</kbd> away and it disappears and then <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Tab</kbd> back and it reappears.

Appears to have started happening with https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/1930, and seems to go away if you downgrade to React 16.

Appears to only happen in Chrome.

**To Reproduce**

1. Go here in Chrome: https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/v1.3.2/index.html?config=test_data%2Fvolvox%2Fconfig.json&session=share-_M2xyF9%2FW7&password=HBpGR
2. Click on a chord

title: Fix rendering of negative strand alignment modifications/methylation
body:
There is a subtle part of the MM tag specification which says

"If SAM FLAG 0x10 is set, indicating that SEQ has been reverse complemented from the sequence observed by the sequencing machine, note that these base modification field values will be in the opposite orientation to SEQ and other derived SAM fields."

This means all the calculations have to be done backwards on the reverse complemented read sequence, and then flipped back forward

https://codesandbox.io/s/mjj1q
https://material-ui.com/components/steppers/#non-linear

title: Add UMD build of react-linear-genome-view for plain-js use
body:
This is a proposal to take a different approach to plain-js use of the React LGV from the one proposed in #1028 (which is also what the [embedding course](https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/bcc2020_embedding_jbrowse_01_getting_started) used). Instead of having a plain-js wrapper around the React LGV as a separate package, this adds a UMD build of the React LGV that can then be used in plain-js use cases. This way, we don't have another package to maintain and publish. It takes a bit more code on the user's part, but I think it actually makes it more clear to the user what is going on. Here's a comparison of what a very simple example would be like with the wrapper package and the UMD build of the component. ### Wrapper package ```html
``` ### Use React component UMD directly ```html
``` Using the React component UMD build also allows users to add other React componets around it in the style of [this guide](https://reactjs.org/docs/add-react-to-a-website.html#add-react-in-one-minute). Since people seem to still be using the embedding tutorial, if we make this change we will need to do a new, updated tutorial or some other kind of guide. Resolves #1028

title: Remove storybook symlink workaround
body:
It looks like the bug that necessitated this workaround was fixed and released in [storybook v6.2.2](https://github.com/storybookjs/storybook/blob/next/CHANGELOG.md#622-april-2-2021), and since we've upgraded to a minimum of storybook v6.3.4, this PR removes it.

It also changes the name of the package.json script from `build-storybok` to `build:storybook`. The reason is that the executable is called `build-storybook`, and it's good to avoid having the script name be the same as the executable name. This is because if you want to call the executable with different args than are in the script (e.g. calling it without `--quiet`), you can no longer use `yarn build-storybook` to do that because that calls the script instead of the executable.

title: Raise minimum material-ui/core version everywhere
body: #2141 uses some features that are only in the latest releases of material-ui/core. This updates all our package.json dependency versions to use a higher minimum version where those features are available. This doesn't change anything for web or desktop, since the material-ui/core was already updated in the lockfile, but users of `@jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view` or plugins published to npm could end up with incompatible versions of material-ui/core if the package.json versions aren't updated.

title: Proof of concept for jb1tojb2 CLI tool
body:
This makes a best effort conversion of jbrowse 1 trackList.json to jbrowse 2 config.json

Uses same logic to the jbrowse 1 connection code

It also currently copies this over rather than link to it even from @jbrowse/core, but we could reconsider that and make it depend on core perhaps. There is a long history of tiny packages in js so we could think about this in terms of breaking up core in our monorepo into smaller packages perhaps

This is a thing @scottcain was interested in

Current usage

```
git clone https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components
cd jbrowse-components
yarn
cd packages/jb1tojb2
yarn build && node dist/bin.js trackList.json config.json
```

Idealized usage if published as a package

```
npm install -g @jbrowse/jb1tojb2
jb1tojb2 trackList.json config.json
```

could also use command line flags or even put in @jbrowse/cli but this is a small proof of concept, and note that @jbrowse/cli doesn't depend on core either

title: Assembly specific trix index generation
body:
This is an additional change to #2137 

It proposes only indexing basically a single assembly at a time. I can hypothetically imagine alternatives with multiple assemblies at a time but I think this is an appropriate default. It makes an individual ix and ixx file for each assembly by default, and can accept a selected assembly at a time also

title: Plugin Documentation Refresh
body:
Along with plugin updates (#2046, #2114, or similar), we need to refresh our plugin documentation to help users be able to easily create JBrowse plugins. We need to document examples of the following types of plugin development workflows:

- Simple no-build plugin that is just a single file that does something like add or alter menu items, etc.
- Plugin using the `jbrowse-plugin-template` build system that does more complex things like use TypeScript, bundle in a dependency, etc. This plugin might e.g. add a new display type.
- Plugin using the `jbrowse-plugin-template` build system that does desktop-specific actions like running a CLI tool, parsing the results, and displaying them in JBrowse.

For future discussion: how to arrange these different workflow docs on our website.

title: Update to @material-ui/core@4.12.2
body:
This PR updates to @material-ui/core, lab, and data-grid, presumably getting bugfixes and improvements. I was actually interested in this though because I used jb2export and it printed the message
```
$ jb2export --fasta ~/src/gmod/jbrowse/docs/tutorial/data_files/volvox.fa --configtracks refseq --loc ctgA:1-100

Material-UI: the createMuiTheme function was renamed to createTheme.

You should use `import { createTheme } from '@material-ui/core/styles'`
```

This is somewhat interesting just because it shows we are getting an updated @material-ui/core when installing it with `npm install -g @jbrowse/img`. That makes sense because we don't necessarily pin versions



I tried updating to the latest @material-ui/core just to make sure that generally things work, in case this affects things like @jbrowse/linear-genome-view. 

I did see an issue with upgrading where the accordion panels were transparent so I fixed that and upgraded the deps

title: New core plugin that adds a "bookmarked regions" list widget, new extension points system
body:
This PR is a refactoring of #2080 . The same comments/designs apply here. Closes #157 .

## Major implementation updates

- Refactored the bookmark code out of the `data-management` plugin into a separate new core plugin
- Moved all bookmark state into the model for the bookmark widget (this state still persists throughout session)
- @garrettjstevens implemented an extension system (closes #2032 )
- Refactored the rubberband code in order to make the menu extensible
- Moved the bookmark code updating the LGV model out of the LGV plugin and into this plugin using the new extension system

Now has an editable field for adding a label to be able to keep track of the regions better:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/126363109-b3481b19-4d16-4c73-a191-0886d04e057e.png)

title: admin-server does not respect "config" URL parameter
body:
**Describe the bug**

If you use the `config` URL param to open up a different config from the default `./config.json`, it updates the default config, not the config specified in the URL param.

**To Reproduce**

1.
```
jbrowse create jbrowse2
cd jbrowse2/
jbrowse admin-server
```
2. Open the URL that admin-server provides, but add a config location, e.g. `http://localhost:9090/?adminKey=1ed63244e1&config=test_data_volvox_config.json`
3. Edit the config (e.g. add/remove a track)
4. Instead of `./test_data/volvox/config.json` getting updated, `./config.json` gets overwritten with the new volvox config, losing any configuration that was already in that file. The config file might not be valid, either, as it may depend on relative file URLs that are not valid in that location.

**Expected behavior**

The config specified in the URL should be updated, not the default one

**Version:**

1.3.2

title: Using admin-server to open local files makes config unusable outside admin mode
body:
**Describe the bug**

Discovered by @junjun-zhang [here](https://gitter.im/GMOD/jbrowse?at=60f5ed897b5a415e65f582ec).

If you open an assembly from a local file while using admin-server, it saves that local file configuration to the config. If that config file is then opened in non-admin mode, the user can't edit the config to re-open the file (and in principle might not even have the same file on their system).

**To Reproduce**

1. Open admin-server in new JBrowse Web installation
2. Add an assembly and use a local file
3. Close admin-server and open the app with a normal server (e.g. `serve .`)
4. Try to open a linear genome view

**Expected behavior**

I think the expected behavior is that you shouldn't be allowed to add local file configs from the GUI in admin-server mode. I can't think of a situation where a server admin adding a local file config would be useful.

**Screenshots**

![](https://files.gitter.im/5a678a1ed73408ce4f89c620/kKTK/image.png)

**Version:**

1.3.2

**Additional context**

This also affects tracks as well as assemblies from local files.

title: Update text searching branch to use ixixxjs
body:
This is a PR targetting #1881 

This does a couple things

1) Removes --location. The output of the data should always be the --out directory
2) Makes the text-index command index files with the outDir as the 'baseUri' so that when I use `jbrowse text-index --out ../../test_data/volvox/` then it knows the gff3 files that it is looking for are in `../../test_data/volvox/`
3) Removes --individual, we could reconsider this but I think we are not yet equipped to figure out per-track indexing
4) Changes code to use ixixx-js so we no longer depend on C binary for ixIxx https://github.com/cmdcolin/ixixx-js
5) Removes the multiple instances of aggregate indexers from volvox config, just uses trix
6) Various refactoring to try to streamline the code paths for the streams
7) Automatically output the aggregateTextSearchAdapters config with a TrixAdapter (very basic)
8) Removes the synthesizing a record for gff features that don't have any attributes to index
9) Removes indexing of feature type by default e.g. CDS


We would still want to review this for correctness

title: Make renameRegionsIfNeeded use assemblyName defined on regions themselves
body: This uses the assemblyName defined on a region object to do the renameRegionsIfNeeded operation. It first prepares a map of assemblyName->refNameMap and uses those for the individual renameRegionIfNeeded calls as usual

title: Fix using the "Color by modifications" setting on files that need ref renaming
body:
Fixes #2125 

There is a subtle chain of behaviors where because the ref renaming didn't work, it created the invalid state seen in #2125 

It started with the assemblyName not being defined, so renameRegionsIfNeeded returned the regions back, so then the bamadapter just returned 0 features for requests to the wrong chromosome for getting the 'modification color map' preprocessing step, so then the colors were black

complicated chain of events...it could be interesting if it used the assemblyName on the region object perhaps but this fixes the issue in the current way that things work

title: Add example dataset for COLO829
body:
This is an interesting tumor+normal paired dataset that I stumbled on here https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.07.09.196527v1

The ENA has some BAM files for the data https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/browser/view/PRJEB27698


There is also a plain text "truth set" of breakends in a VCF source data file here https://github.com/UMCUGenetics/COLO829_somaticSV

This adds the VcfAdapter for a plain VCF to both CLI and add-track. It doesn't really try to warn against large VCFs but it should be fine for small VCF that are encountered in the wild. The VcfAdapter was created by @carolinebridge-oicr originally

We could think about also unifying the cli and core codebase, and making it more pluggable perhaps too...but maybe as follow ons :)

However, this type of system could be used in other areas for that PR to remove some of the code updating the LGV plugin.

cc @garrettjstevens

title: Ensure jbrowse-cli README is formatted whenever it's updated
body: It looks like sometimes during the release process, the README for the CLI gets auto-generated, but the pre-commit hook doesn't make sure it gets properly formatted. This adds formatting to the step where the CLI gets auto-generated, so it'll get formatted even if the pre-commit hook doesn't work. It also makes the CLI's package.json more cross-platform by using [`npm-run-all`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/npm-run-all) instead of chained `&&`s and replacing `rm -rf` with [`rimraf`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/rimraf).

title: Create extension point for session model
Fix loading indicator on the reference sequence selector getting stuck
body:
Fixes #2118 

Gets rid of useMemo statement. It could use assembly.regions as the parameter for useMemo but it is more straightforward i think to not useMemo here

title: Infinite loading when switching assemblies
body:
In the linear genome view import form, switching from hg19 to hg38 produces an infinite loading bar inside the refname autocomplete



You can still choose and navigate in the bar even though it says loading, but the loading bar persists

title: Remove the lzutf8 package from cli to fix process hang
body:
I found that removing the lzutf8 package stopped the hanging that was seen in #2116 

I propose removing the lzutf8 package as a result

I think it is probably ok to remove it and I don't believe we need a replacement for it

The current usage of having per-line or per-entry compression is probably not very efficient, it is better to compress larger blocks of text so you can exploit redundancy across lines/entries

It may be worth considering alternative encodings or compression if we see issues but I think removing is ok for now

It is unclear to me why removing lzutf8 fixed the hanging but it was very reproducible to me

This is a PR targetting the text_searching branch

title: Running CLI tool hangs on text_searching branch
body:
When I use

bin/run create jbrowse_folder

It performs the download and unpacks the file

```

Fetching https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/releases/download/v1.3.2/jbrowse-web-v1.3.2.zip...
Unpacked https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/releases/download/v1.3.2/jbrowse-web-v1.3.2.zip at myfolder
```

I have to then ctrl+c the process

Other users have not reported the same thing

If anyone else can confirm let me know

Originally seen with text-index stuff, but applies to other commands

title: Fix bug where sometimes plugin could not be removed from UI
body: This fixes https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/2052 by not using the name at all when removing plugins and instead relying on the plugin URL to identify which plugin to remove.

title: Plugin dynamic import of ES modules
body:
This allows runtime plugins to be ES modules as well as UMD bundles.

It also adds development tools for plugins to use to build the ES modules, as in https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-plugin-template/pull/16.

title: Add ability to open a plain text GFF
body:
I think this will become more important once we have for example JBrowse desktop. Users should be able to open a plain text gff without having to open e.g. tabix, genome tools to sort it, etc (those are i think difficult barriers to entry)

We could either pre-process the file to a more efficient format and write to disk (maybe a desktop only thing, but may also be useful for users of CLI...they would also be relieved of burden of pre-processing their GFFs) or, we do the simple thing and load the whole thing into memory

title: Avoid total clearing of session if just one track not found
Fix "Can't resolve '@jbrowse/plugin-legacy-jbrowse'" in `@jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view`
body:
Removes one reference to the legacy JBrowse plugin from `@jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view`, which is causing the following error:

```
ERROR in ./node_modules/@jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view/dist/react-linear-genome-view.cjs.production.min.js
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@jbrowse/plugin-legacy-jbrowse' in './node_modules/@jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view/dist'
```

title: Auto-diagonalize dotplot/synteny plots
body:
See for example 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/124668371-c5c1f380-de7e-11eb-8bb2-08c03d1859e0.png)

This is a human-to-human alignment loaded as a PAF file

Mummerplot automatically diagonalizes the plot and flips backwards scaffolds to create a by-default better display of the same data
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/124668440-db371d80-de7e-11eb-9837-134652006e43.png)

We may be able to accomplish something similar, would require some computational tricks that probably exist in the mummer codebase

Being able to allow the user to manually flip a region, or re-order the regions, may be interesting as well

title: Make sure to wait for assembly to load before downloading canonical refnames in SV inspector
body:
Fixes #2108 

Historical note:
There has been a tension in the history of the development regarding whether assemblies should be "waited on using promises" or "respond to observability" and this is a move towards "waited on using promises". This can interact with the mobx observability in weird ways e.g. anything after an await likely would not be picked up by the mobx autorun-observer-stuff but that should be ok here

title: Refreshing page with SV inspector can lead to error
Add ability to "collapse" or "turn off" track
body:
Sometimes, for example if a user zooms out, they may want to just disable/collapse/turn off the track just temporarily while they get oriented

Closing a track can cause it to lose state (e.g. color by settings) that the user may have set on it, so "collapsing it" may be preferable


Example UI with "collapsible tracks" (indicated by the arrows)
https://www.ebi.ac.uk/interpro/protein/UniProt/P27410/

title: Use more accurate estimator for feature label widths
body: The code for estimating feature label widths is a heuristic to avoid having to measure them precisely with getBBox or similar. This updates the heuristic to use a slightly better measurement from @jbrowse/core called measureText, and adds a small "padding" too

title: Use ScopedCssBaseline to help style the embedded component
body:
This is a possible alternative or extra to apply to #2094 

The ScopedCssBaseline allows the styles to be applied to children

In this case I apply it to modal widgets and the embedded component itself

This, by itself, greatly reduces the number of bare "Times new roman" style fonts that appear in the usage of embedded components

title: Fix behavior of the end-of-list indicator in refNameAutocomplete to always display as a disabled item
body: Related to [issue 2086](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/2086) Bug came from [pull request 2071](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/2071) * Fix bug with indicator disappearing after user begins to refine search. Now indicator persists when there are more than 100 results in the dropdown. Also added a warning when the user selects the more results option from the dropdown. Thoughts? https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45598764/124316288-3c32be80-db2a-11eb-87b3-aad2065e4130.mov * removes groupings from the dropdown * removes tooltip from magnifying icon

title: Improve descriptions on VCF SVs
body:
Fixes #2089 

After this PR, just the ALT is displayed

![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json session=local-90JJKGkT1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/124300332-756c2e00-db2c-11eb-9df3-a121c115b10e.png)

title: Use rbush data structure for layout of feature tracks
body:
This is a proposal to change the granular rect layout code to use the "rbush" library

The granular rect layout I think got kind of crufty with some stuff where no one really knew the precise behavior of the system

This is an early draft, but I think it has nice results. I think the concept had been thought about before (e.g. "nclist for layout")

The rbush data structure (R-tree) I think essentially achieves this, and the API for the rbush library is easy to use

This PR already is functional but needs a little extra work still

title: Improve speed for laying out features for embedded/mainthreadrpc scenarios
body:
Changes the rectangles data structure for granularrectlayout back to a normal map instead of an observable map. The layout is queried directly for nodes at a given position, and precompute layout uses rbush to do this (previously precompute layout didn't have any function to do this)

Fixes #2038

title: Fix issue with page reload after editing session title
body:
This may have been vestigial or unneeded logic to do "setPluginsUpdated" anytime setSession was called.

Removing it, I can still see plugin install and remove work in the in-app plugin store

title: More usage of typography to improve consistent text styling
body:
In jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view, if there are bare "divs with text", then the font used might be something like "Times new roman" instead of a nice font

This tries to use typographies more thoroughly to make the font's a bit better

title: Add ref name renaming for synteny datasets
body: Currently the PAFAdapter does not return results from getRefNames so is unable to render synteny on ref-name renamed datasets

title: Add help icon and more extensive tooltip text to RefNameAutocomplete
body:
After originally showing the idea in https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/2086 and then our discussion in the weekly meeting, here's a draft for a more extensive tooltip text for the RefNameAutocomplete.

This moves the "search" icon to the beginning of the box and adds a "help" icon to the end of the box that has the tooltip. This way, since it's a large tooltip, it'll only show up if you hover over the help button, and otherwise it won't get in your way. The disadvantage to this approach is it takes up a bit more space it what is already sometimes a cramped text box. We could also consider making that box wider as part of this PR.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/124038422-551e6100-d9be-11eb-9d34-c1385229d816.png)

title: Move RefNameAutocomplete out of LGV
body:
For other view types e.g. dotplot to take advantage of RefNameAutocomplete, it would be useful to move it's functionality out of the LGV plugin

Perhaps it could go into core, or we can try to make a new "package" or "plugin" with just the search components

title: Advanced search utility
body: This should be fleshed out with a design sketch, but we have discussed a couple times making an "Advanced search" dialog or widget that provides extra functionality compared to the RefNameAutocomplete

title: Description text for SV possibly confusing
body:
Entry:

```
2       114359099       3703    N       <DEL/INV>       .       PASS    IMPRECISE;SVMETHOD=Snifflesv1.0.12;CHR2=2;END=114360535;STD_quant_start=216.901360;STD_quant_stop=263.726753;Kurtosis_quant_start=-0.993897;Kurtosis_quant_stop=-1.062957;SVTYPE=DEL/INV;SUPTYPE=NR;SVLEN=-1435;STRANDS=+-;STRANDS2=13,1,13,1;RE=14;REF_strand=185,2;Strandbias_pval=0.195646;AF=0.0696517      GT:DR:DV        0/0:187:14
```

This is called "insertion->DEL/INV"

It's unclear where the "insertion" comes from

title: Changing session name reloads webpage
body: In jbrowse web, if you change the session name (e.g. in appbar) then the page reloads. I believe this is unexpected

title: Search by gene name
body:
It would be useful to be able to search by gene name.   Every one of my users is requesting this feature - they invariably end up using the UCSC genome browser to find their target and then return to enter the chromosome and offsets - which is a clear friction point.

Any update on this would be useful/helpful.

Thank you for the great work.

title: Autocomplete search box usability
body:
I've been trying out the autocomplete search box and have some observations and potential needed fixes. This could possibly be broken into separate issues, but I thought we could do that upon discussing them and making some decisions.

- If you click on the search box and there are more than 100 sequences, it shows "more results...", but if you start typing and then scroll to the bottom, even if there are more than 100 sequences that match what you typed so far, the "more results..." is missing.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/123878625-a9610c80-d8fc-11eb-8261-0ea6490274f5.png)
- If you type something that is both a sequence name and a text search match, sometimes it shows up under "reference sequence," sometimes under "text search results," but never under both. I haven't been able to figure out how to reliably reproduce when it shows up under one or the other, but I feel like it should show up under both categories.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/123878677-ceee1600-d8fc-11eb-836d-9606efbfbd77.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/123878695-d6152400-d8fc-11eb-9076-83399a05c35f.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/123878727-e4634000-d8fc-11eb-8e76-14fd8176208d.png)
- The helper text "Enter a sequence or locstring" might be problematic. I think "locString" is a term we use internally, but isn't something a user should be expected to understand.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/123878931-3e640580-d8fd-11eb-9a63-2c2a6c4954b0.png)
- Similarly, "refName" is also probably an internal term and not something users should have to know about.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/123879071-8be07280-d8fd-11eb-9d43-eab5df8ef129.png)

I've also tried to think about how we could help users know what the search box can do. I thought we could have a more extensive description somehow. One idea I mocked up was having a box that describes what you can do pop up when you click on the search box:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/123880354-b3d0d580-d8ff-11eb-8ace-a61a176fd034.png)

title: Implement grid bookmark widget
body:
This PR implements a bookmark widget for the LGV using the [MUI Data Grid](https://material-ui.com/components/data-grid/) component. Closes #157

## Feature Overview

The main idea is to have a widget that can be used to store interesting regions in a view (this PR adds support for the LGV) that can be returned to later. The widget stores a table of the regions that have been bookmarked.

Currently what has been implemented:

- Option to open the widget from the view menu of the LGV
- Option to bookmark the current region from the view menu of the LGV
- Option to bookmark the selected region from the LGV rubberband menu
- BED or TSV export of the bookmark list from the widget
- Ability to remove individual bookmarks or to clear all bookmarks

Demo with the table displaying chrom, start, end, assembly, link (locstring), trash icon to delete

![2021-07-08 13-18-48 2021-07-08 13_22_53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/124985747-a3031c80-dfef-11eb-9805-e9b9be7d407d.gif)

Screenshot of a more compact design with only the bookmark link and trash icon:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/124986056-09883a80-dff0-11eb-8a7d-d8d4da1426c8.png)

This comes with the advantage of not needing to resize the drawer widget 👍 

## Implementation details

- Currently, this PR extends the session model to contain an array of the bookmarks. Maybe, instead of adding new data to the session, the bookmarks could be kept somewhere else? (local storage, session storage, remote file) The difficulty I see with these alternatives is that you lose the observability of MobX/MST. Backing up a bit, the reason that the bookmarks need to be kept on the session is that widget state is lost when the widget is closed (the bookmarks would be wiped out).
- It also directly adds menu items in the LGV view and rubberband menu. We have talked about whether we want "extension points" (#2032 ) to enable plugins to add menu items to other plugins.
- This widget is currently a part of the `data-management` core plugin. It could potentially be put in its own plugin. (@cmdcolin has suggested the possibility of making that plugin external)

## Additional features

Here are some other things that haven't been implemented but could be:

- file import (probably starting with BED support)
- visual indicator that a region is bookmarked (I think this is hard to get right. If you adjust the view and it now differs even slightly, would no longer be one of the bookmarked regions, etc.)

title: Create integration test for read vs ref workflow
body:
Just something that would be worth implementing as an integration test...just something that #2077 sort of brought up

Synteny workflows could also use this

title: Restore eslint rule for no-unused-vars
body: The eslint rule for unused vars got disabled at some point. This re-enables it and fixes some of the related errors

title: Reorient strands on read vs ref plots
body:
The fix from #2024 caused a knock-on effect of the read-vs-ref displays to display inversions where none existed. Reason being was that the read vs ref code assumed it should provide the strand of the read, but even though the strand of a given BAM read might be given as -1, all the data is actually oriented in the forward direction (e.g. the SEQ field will be read left to right aka 5' to 3' even for negative strand features)

Example: Current main displays inversions on a "volvox SV" example which should not be inversions (it is just a deletion)

![jbrowse org_code_jb2_main__config=test_data%2Fvolvox%2Fconfig json session=local-SfLi55OZW](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/123317787-68cc5200-d4fc-11eb-8ee1-01726f8f986b.png)

title: Provide users with extra docs on-plugin-install and make filters for plugin store
body:
The plugin store currently offers the ability to one-click install all plugins

* There may be some plugins that are not really usable on web if they are desktop specific
* There are also some plugins that may not really be usable in a one-click situation (requires config editing)
* There is also be some detailed procedure needed to find out how to use (e.g. navigating to specific menu to pop up a view)

It may be useful to add filters, so desktop plugins are not shown on web

It may also be useful to popup a little docs, or provide a link to the docs, after install

Metadata would be in the plugin store's plugins.json file

Example json attributes

desktop:true/false
web:true/false
pnp:false // "plug and play" e.g. can be used without hand editing config



example:non-admin filter settings on web
pnp:true
web:true

Therefore, a desktop-only plugin would have web:false and be filtered out

May need version range filtering

Extra: popup a doc location, which helps orient users once they install

docsLocation: "http://mysite.com/plugindocs"

title: Better error message if a file location has an empty string
body: As noted in [this gitter thread](https://gitter.im/GMOD/jbrowse2?at=60d26b3bbef0c66d9d1b9e71), leaving an empty string in the "uri" of a "faiLocation" of an assembly adapter wouldn't trigger a 404 like it would if you put in the URI incorrectly, and you'd get some error about an invalid refName. This is because `fetch('')` is a valid fetch that gets the current page. This adds some error throwing to `openLocation` if the uri (or localPath) is an empty string, so the error message would be at least a bit more sensible.

title: Bump color-string from 1.5.4 to 1.5.5 in /website
body:
Bumps [color-string](https://github.com/Qix-/color-string) from 1.5.4 to 1.5.5.
Release notes

Sourced from color-string's releases.

1.5.5 (Patch/Security Release) - hwb() ReDos patch (low-severity)

Release notes copied verbatim from the commit message, which can be found here: 0789e21284c33d89ebc4ab4ca6f759b9375ac9d3

Discovered by Yeting Li, c/o Colin Ife via Snyk.io.

A ReDos (Regular Expression Denial of Service) vulnerability
was responsibly disclosed to me via email by Colin on
Mar 5 2021 regarding an exponential time complexity for
linearly increasing input lengths for hwb() color strings.


Strings reaching more than 5000 characters would see several
milliseconds of processing time; strings reaching more than
50,000 characters began seeing 1500ms (1.5s) of processing time.


The cause was due to a the regular expression that parses
hwb() strings - specifically, the hue value - where
the integer portion of the hue value used a 0-or-more quantifier
shortly thereafter followed by a 1-or-more quantifier.


This caused excessive backtracking and a cartesian scan,
resulting in exponential time complexity given a linear
increase in input length.


Thank you Yeting Li and Colin Ife for bringing this to my
attention in a secure, responsible and professional manner.


A CVE will not be assigned for this vulnerability.

Commits
  • 966ae4d 1.5.5
  • 0789e21 fix ReDos in hwb() parser (low-severity)
  • See full diff in compare view

title: Added ability to choose label justification for SvgFeatureRenderer.
body:
Hi JBrowse team,

I'm working on a project where there are many closely packed, sometimes overlapping features on the screen at once and so it is beneficial to have the feature labels centered to reduce the labels overlapping on the screen. I have added an option to the SvgFeatureRenderer to allow label to be justified left (default), center, right, start and end (start/end are the opposite of left/right when the view is horizontally flipped). I though maybe this feature would be useful to others using JBrowse so I'm opening this PR for it.

I have included the test config in the the jbrowse-web/public folder. All the options have been tested with different sized features, labels (including the case when labels must be truncated to fit), and when the view is horizontally flipped.

SceneGraph issue:
There appears to be an issue with the SceneGraph class in core/util/layouts. Namely, the nodes associate the left/top bounding box value of their children with their own left/top world space coordinates. This didn't seems to be causing issues previously because these coordinates were always 0 in the parent node. However, when large labels are added to a small feature with centered justification, for example, the child labels can extend the bounding box to have negative left coordinate. To make a long short short, when the absolute coordinates are computed the child's left corrdinate is added to the child twice: once by the child itself and once incorrectly by the parent beause it is using the child's left coordinate as it's own. I have currently hacked around this issue in SvgFeatureRenderer, but I can open a separate issue for it once I have confirmation that this is an actual problem and not my own misunderstanding.

Let me know if anything should be changed or fixed here to be considered for inclusion, or if I need to explain something more clearly. Thanks.

title: Export offscreenCanvasPonyfil from core/util
body:
Two small changes here to help plugins. First, the `__webpack_require__` check was removed from offscreenCanvasPonyfill. Instead, it just checks for `OffscreenCanvas` without checking `__webpack_require__` first. To detect node, it uses [`detect-node`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/detect-node), a popular NPM library.

The second change was to export the offscreenCanvasPonyfill functions from `@jbrowse/core/util`. That way plugins can use them without them being built into the plugin (since offscreenCanvasPonyfill itself isn't in our re-exports). This change fixes https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-plugin-template/issues/15.

title: Create modification to "Show all regions in assembly" to have threshold or similar.
body:
This could apply to dotplot view/synteny view (which often load entire assembly be default) as well as linear genome view (which has the button)

Could avoid loading very fragmented parts of the assembly. While it would be nice to "not worry about this" it does just cause visual noise e.g. ellided blocks in the middle of stuff of a whole genome view in grch38 for example

title: Remove node-sass to avoid some issues installing dev setup with newer node versions
body:
"yarn is wanting to build node-sass since it can't find a prebuilt arch (which is bizarre in itself! - but possibly because node-sass is now deprecated under npm and no-one has maintained the build"

Mentioned in chat for jbrowse 2 https://gitter.im/GMOD/jbrowse2?at=60d0974fbcb3e8060ed7b70e

There is a particular version compatibility chart that is a little hard to follow, I think if we are not using sass though we can remove https://www.npmjs.com/package/node-sass


Note: This issue is also seen in some jbrowse 1 installs possibly too

title: Fix issue with using --force error when no track was previously loaded
body:
If --force was used but no track/file existed there to overwrite, then the script failed

This checks for the file existing

This code is a little tedious and it would be sorta nice if we could "operate at a slightly higher level of abstraction" than the raw fs module, but this does fix the issue :)

title: Improve performance with large numbers of reference sequences by using MST volatiles
body:
This is a possible proposal to help speed up large assemblies

This demo has 200,000 contigs

https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/main/index.html?config=test_data%2Fconfig_many_contigs.json

This can hang the page for as much as 10 seconds on a fast machine, production build

After this change the load time is about 3 seconds, with the code that does this coming from refNameAliases instead of assembly.regions now, so probably can be reduced more

This is an early proof of concept PR but note that types.frozens can also be typescripted 

Possible help for #1847

title: [auth-for-plugin-adjustments] slight adjustments to openLocation changes for plugins
body:
this PR addresses two issues:

1. A CORS rejection when attempting to load the app while also running a plugin
2. The requirement for custom headers to be sent as part of openURL (not just Authorization)

A ternary check for optional headers is performed before attempting to openUrl(), if authHeader and authToken are not defined, then this field will be undefined and avoid the CORS error being thrown when running the app with plugins.

A new field is added to the `UriLocation` model, `authHeader` which needs to be the header required to execute the authorization, this is a string.

For example, if you are creating the 'location' of a request to be made, your object might now look like
```js
{
  uri: metadata.downloadUrl,
  authHeader: 'Authorization',
  authToken: `Bearer ${oauthAccessTokenGoogle}`,
}
```

such that `authHeader` can be anything the user requires when the request is performed (my specific use case is `X-Auth-Header`, GDC's custom authorization header).

title: Missing supercontig in the chromosome selector
Use idMaker for dataAdapterCache key for faster FromConfigAdapter performance
body:
This is a small proposal to use the "idMaker" concept from BaseAdapter for the dataAdapterCache key

The reason is that, potentially, the jsonStableStringify on a large FromConfigAdapter input would be large, and so automatically would take...just trying to estimate but I imagine the stringified version of a JSON object could be at least 2x but probably much more the size of the data (imagine 4byte ints vs 10char sequences...but also think of all the key values being stringified probably being stored more efficiently in memory)

title: Fix infinite recursion in FromConfigAdaptor by avoiding mutating the passed in data when using SimpleFeature
body:
This PR started with trying out copying the data by default here https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/commit/b5810295e6633fae357509ee6184113e23ca67df

I realized this data copying could be reduced if we store the subfeatures array outside of this.data, thereby not mutating it

We could also consider methods to avoid the idMaker crash, or other possible approaches, but this solution seemed nice because it did not necessarily require a full object clone of the inputted simplefeature args (which i tried first here  https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/commit/b5810295e6633fae357509ee6184113e23ca67df before using this alternative solution https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/commit/3ac1218c353c0134ab5d0c604789b9b9619dcfd2)

title: Uninstalling plugin may need a "uninstall" method
body:
Similar to things like closing a connection -> deletes open tracks using that connection

Plugins will have particular configSchema's and such and if they are uninstalled, those entries will need to be removed from the config (or else the tracks and such from that plugin will cause the config/sessions to fail to load)

Alternatively, or maybe as an extra, we may want to find ways to improve loading of malformed sessions/configs(?)

Here is a screenshot of jbrowse desktop after uninstalling CIVIC plugin, which automatically adds a CIVIC track to the users session or config, but as a result, fails to load the browser after uninstalling

![t1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/122253059-d55ea580-ce99-11eb-9f9c-94b915bbc245.png)

This fixes that by adding the logoPath configslot to desktop, plus a couple of items that jbrowse-web has that desktop didn't have  (theme, featureDetails,and ...pluginConfigurationSchemas()) just for good measure

Also makes the Logo a component

title: Can't uninstall plugin in UI due to name inconsistencies
Add missing named exports to shared core modules
body: For a few core files in out re-exports, we were only re-exporting the default export for those file and not the named exports. This adds re-exports of the named exports as well.

title: Configurable app logo for web
Infinite recursion in FromConfigAdapter constructor
body:
<!-- Please fill out as much of the template as you can. -->

Hi Jbrowse devs,

**Description**

I have been using FromConfigAdapter to load data programmatically in JBrowse (config example below). However, when ‘subfeatures’ is specified for a feature in the FromConfigAdapter configuration, the FromConfigAdapter constructor goes into infinite recursion (or seems to at least). It appears that this is being caused by:

- 'new FromConfigAdapter(config)' calls 'new SimpleFeature(config)' on the config. This mutates the config if there are subfeatures (perhaps this is unintended). Because the subfeatures have handles to their parent this results in circular references in the original config object.
- When ‘new FromConfigAdapter(config)’ is called again with the same config object, it calls the superclass constructor, 'new BaseAdapter(config)', which calls 'idMaker(config)'. This goes into infinite regress because it keeps following the circular references in the config.

**To Reproduce**

1. Make sure 'volvox.2bit' from the test data is in the root directory for JBrowse Web.
2. Use this config.json:
```
{
  "configuration": {
    "rpc": {
      "defaultDriver": "MainThreadRpcDriver"
    }
  },
  "assemblies": [
    {
      "name": "volvox",
      "aliases": ["vvx"],
      "sequence": {
        "type": "ReferenceSequenceTrack",
        "trackId": "volvox_refseq",
        "adapter": {
          "type": "TwoBitAdapter",
          "twoBitLocation": {
            "uri": "volvox.2bit"
          }
        }
      },
      "refNameAliases": {
        "adapter": {
          "type": "FromConfigAdapter",
          "features": [
            {
              "refName": "ctgA",
              "uniqueId": "alias1",
              "aliases": ["A", "contigA"]
            },
            {
              "refName": "ctgB",
              "uniqueId": "alias2",
              "aliases": ["B", "contigB"]
            }
          ]
        }
      }
    }
  ],
  "tracks": [
    {
      "type" : "FeatureTrack",
      "trackId" : "track1",
      "name" : "Track1",
      "assemblyNames" : ["volvox"],
      "category" : ["Annotation"],
      "adapter" : {
        "type" : "FromConfigAdapter",
        "features" : [
          {
            "refName" : "ctgA",
            "uniqueId" : "feat1",
            "start" : 200,
            "end" : 750,
            "name" : "Feature1",
            "subfeatures" : [
              {
                "uniqueId" : "feat2",
                "start" : 225,
                "end" : 300,
                "name" : "Feature2"
              },
              {
                "uniqueId": "feat3",
                "start": 400,
                "end": 600,
                "name": "Feature3"
              }
            ]
          }
        ]
      },
      "displays": [
        {
          "type" : "LinearBasicDisplay",
          "displayId" : "track1-display1",
          "configuration" : "track1-display1",
          "renderer" : {
            "type" : "SvgFeatureRenderer"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```
A new track ,'Track1', has been added containing a feature with two subfeatures.

3. Start JBrowse Web, create a linear genome view, and add  'Track1' from the track selector. It should hang at this point for a very long time.

**Expected behavior**

It should not hang.

**Version:**

Versions:

- JBrowse Linear React View 1.3.0
- JBrowse Web, current repository running with 'yarn start'.

OS: Ubuntu 20.04

Browser: Chrome Version 91.0.4472.77 (Official Build) (64-bit)

**Additional Context**

The bug appears to be in the SimpleFeature constructor. Here it stores a reference to the config:

```
if (isSimpleFeatureSerialized(args)) {
  this.data = args
} else {
  this.data = args.data || {}
  // load handle from args.parent (not args.data.parent)
  // this reason is because if args is an object, it likely isn't properly loaded with
  // parent as a Feature reference (probably a raw parent ID or something instead)
  this.parentHandle = args.parent
}
```
Then it mutates the subfeatures array:
```
const { subfeatures } = this.data
if (subfeatures) {
  for (let i = 0; i < subfeatures.length; i += 1) {
    if (typeof subfeatures[i].get !== 'function') {
      subfeatures[i].strand = subfeatures[i].strand || this.data.strand
      subfeatures[i] = new SimpleFeature({
        id: subfeatures[i].uniqueId || `${id}-${i}`,
        // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-explicit-any
        data: subfeatures[i] as Record<string, any>,
        parent: this,
      })
    }
  }
}
```

Also, to observe where the infinte recursion is happening it may be helpful to set a breakpoint in BaseAdaptert.ts:idMaker.

Hope this helps. Let me know if any other information is needed.

title: Add missing BoxRendererType exports
Adding node integration to electron renderer process
body:
This is a draft of a change that adds node integration to the renderer process in the desktop app, in preparation for letting plugins access node. Some main points:

- With node integration, the same web worker bundle that is used in JBrowse Web works for desktop, too. So the ElectronRpcDriver and WindowWorker were removed, and the desktop app now uses web workers the same as the web app.
- `electron` can now be imported directly, it doesn't have to be accessed from `window`.
- Upgraded to the latest version of `electron`
- This PR doesn't use `LocalFile` from `generic-filehandle`, but once https://github.com/GMOD/generic-filehandle/pull/86 or similar is merged it can go back to using that.

title: Add basic architecture for text searching
body:
In this PR:
For discussions and diagrams: [old branch](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/1881)

[issue 1828 JBrowse 1 generate-names.pl Text Search Adapter](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/1828)
_JB1 TextSearchAdapter_
* Adds JBrowse1 implementation of Hash (here as httpMap) 
* Adds JBrowse1 implementation of crc32 to help read names index built by generate-names.pl
* Adapter has searchIndex() which returns list of results of type BaseResult
  - (plugins/legacy-jbrowse/src/JBrowse1TextSeachAdapter/JBrowse1TextSearchAdater.ts)
* Adapter returns list of BaseResults[]
 
[Issue 1830 Text Search Core System ](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/1830)
_Core System_
* Creates new pluggable element type in core called TextSearchAdapterType
* Adds a TextSearch Manager, a plain Typescript class
  - which loads array of text search adapters (BaseTextSearchAdapter[])
  - adds cache of instantiated adapters
  - calls each adapter given search criteria
  - ranks and returns relevant the results
* Adds BaseResult class (packages/core/TextSearch/BaseResults.ts)
* Adds optional textSearch volatile to rootModel that contains TextSearchManager
* Adds an optional text search adapter to all track configurations
* Adds an array of text search adapters TextSearchAdapterType[] to root configuration for aggregated indexes (products/jbrowse-web/src/jbrowseModel.js)
* Text search adapters have optional metadata about what tracks and assemblies they cover, so that searching code can make decisions about what indexes are relevant to use
* Adapters return results of type BaseResult

[Issue 1929 LGV Text Search](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/1829)
_LGV/RefNameAutocomplete_
* Calls TextSearchManager with search scope, search args, and ranking method
* Dropdown displays result with given BaseResult label or rendering component

_ImportForm_ / _Header_
* Navigates to result location or opens SearchResultsDialog

_SearchResultsDialog_
* Table of results from text search adapters
* Each row contains result record. 
   - The "go" button on each row navigates to the specified location.
   - The "show" button navigates to specified location and shows track


![sketch2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45598764/117504778-d82fb780-af37-11eb-936a-211a9e7cb8d9.png)

title: URL encoded characters should be decoded in VCF INFO field
body:
In our code, data in the VCF info field that is URL encoded does not get decoded in our info dialog

The VCF 4.3 spec says https://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/VCFv4.3.pdf
```
Literal semicolon (‘;’) and equals sign (‘=’) characters are not permitted in these values, and literal commas (‘,’) are permitted only as delimiters for lists of values; characters with special meaning can be encoded using percent encoding, see Section 1.2. Space characters are allowed in values.
```

can be seen in the hg002 insertion demo dbvar vcf

https://jbrowse.org/code/jb2/v1.3.0/?config=test_data/config_demo.json&session=share-oTyYRpz9fN&password=fYAbt

title: Text searching index
Alignments layout code slow under MainThreadRpcDriver
body:
The change to make the granular rect layout from a map to an observablemap appears to maybe have taken a toll on making the alignments track slow. This would also affect other types of feature tracks

Each addRect in the embedded version can take ~70ms and having a modest number of features can result in a lot of slowness

![Screenshot from 2021-06-03 19-14-16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/120723522-ebcf2f00-c49f-11eb-83d3-ae2ce2c11da7.png)

Related to #1790 

I think this is basically separate from the general alignments performance issue #969 so I made a new issue here

Noticed and mentioned earlier in a demo @garrettjstevens made https://garrettjstevens.github.io/jbrowse-react-linear-genome-view-demo/ can be seen there

Note that the webworker version takes about 0.93 ms for a single addRect so about 70x faster

![Screenshot from 2021-06-03 19-24-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/120724232-5d5bad00-c4a1-11eb-8090-0d69edd8c00b.png)

This is a possible example of a sample plugin that has zero compilation, uses loadScript with type="module"

This doesn't test that it works on the webworker, but it could be used for adding jexl functions for use in config callbacks

title: add link to JB2 in old JB1 site header
body:
If you Google for something and land in the old JBrowse 1 section of the website, it's not immediately clear that are in "old" land, and that this is for old JB1.

For example, I Googled for "jbrowse-components plugin store" and the first hit was the JB1 plugin guide:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73749/120687655-0d57f880-c457-11eb-81c9-4d13507fabb1.png)

We should add a link in the JB1 header to take people to JB2.

title: "FeatureTrack" breaks jbrowse_linear_view
configs.json to include a popup/mouseover/feature details content location
body:
A lot of users will want to know more information about what they are viewing, right now you have the popups/mouseover/feature details panel which are populated by the source file but is there the possibility that within the configs.json file we could specify the location of the contents of a mouseover/popup/feature details panel if not within the file (and of course, be totally optional).

Some of the tracks we will be using have 10M variants, each one being a row in a VCF and each row will contain information about the variant and where it can be found in other studies etc. Other tracks we plan on implementing (with the frequency distribution histograms) will need to be able to display a breakdown of the number of variants found within a region and from which study they come from, these tracks will be created dynamically via an API as an amalgamation of any number of individual tracks.

The mouseover/popup/feature details content size could become massive pretty quickly for some of our tracks and thus increase loading times drastically, if we could instead point to a URL where the content could be found then that would be ideal, not only would it reduce the size of the track files but it also saves me the hassle of rebuilding the track files whenever there is an update to ensure all of the track cross references are up to date as the URL would handle all of that dynamically.

I am a complete beginner with react, I can make a functioning website but that's about it so what I'm about to propose might not be possible. As JBrowse2 is react based I would propose that the URL serves a react component which is directly displayed on the browser without modification. This would put the browser owner in complete control of how the mouseover/popup/feature details panel looks without having to worry about updates to jbrowse modifying the look or behaviour. I'm not sure if this is something that react can do, it may be that an iframe to the endpoint would be the only way to ensure the styling remains the same between the URL and jbrowse and if that doesn't work well then the URL could just serve the content without the styling and then the styling would need to be handled by modifying the jbrowse components.

title: Add ability to "square" synteny/dotplot views
body: The linear synteny and dotplot views are able to create some odd layouts because each axis can have independent bpPerPx values. While this can be interesting, we may want a way to only allow square selections, or a way to square an existing view with differing bpPerPx values, so that they become matching

title: Flip drawing of negative strand PAF features in linear synteny and dotplot views
body:
It was seen in https://gist.github.com/cmdcolin/f9f0c1c61b7c840475c1815a7a607239 that there were a lot of "inversions" but these may be that we are not actually drawing reverse strand features right. This tries to fix that by flipping the start and end coordinates in the dotplot

We may need to make a similar confirmation for the linear synteny views

title: Fix infinite loop in adding some plugins on desktop
body:
Currently adding some plugins using the plugin store on desktop can run into an error of infinite looping. The CIVIC plugin is an example of this

I don't actually know what the reason was but I tried a couple small rearrangements to try to fix it, which appeared to work

a) making the pluginsUpdated a volatile
b) separate the code that does the window reload out into it's own little useeffect instead of getting debounced

title: Add ability to configure pre-calculated CDS/PEP sequences in sequence feature details
body:
Sometimes a pre-calculated sequence feature details may be more accurate (taking into account any weird biology that goes into translating the sequences) or faster than our on-the-fly computed cds,protein,etc sequences. We could allow the user to configure this

Mentioned by @li153348734

title: Polish desktop builds for release
body:
I'm creating this issue to outline/plan work for the desktop app that needs to be done before release. The work outlined here has a particular focus on builds/installation.

Currently, we create a zip build for all platforms:
https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/blob/d690c35e77bfa23005d9cbd334f0eeaff1100b4a/products/jbrowse-desktop/package.json#L98-L111

It could be an improvement to use some of the **platform specific** build targets supported by [electron-builder](https://www.electron.build/). After a bit of talking with @garrettjstevens and @cmdcolin , it seems like the following targets might make sense:

- MacOS: `dmg`
- Linux: `AppImage`
- Windows: `nsis`

Next, we are probably going to need some CI to do desktop builds, and possible to copy the builds to S3 like the web.

Finally, we need to figure out app signing for MacOS (#664), and Windows (#665)

I'm making this more general issue to track progress on this front.

- [x] Create platform specific builds
- [x] Set up CI for desktop builds
- [x] sign apps (and get working with CI)

title: Fix session import to use blob map for opening local files
body:
Fixes #2017 after updates to blob map

The reason for this was basically related to having raw usage of openLocation and passing in a blob, instead of using fileselector which automatically performs this

We could, potentially, make our file selector's use a dropzone to make things more consistent but this does fix the issue

Uses greater than react 16.8.0  instead of just the 16 version range

title: Deprecate ThemeProvider in `@jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view`
Base color theming does not work in React LGV
Fix or get rid of service worker
body:
Since we upgraded to `react-scripts` (i.e. `create-react-app`) to v4, it seems service workers work a bit differently. They are opt-in instead of opt-out, and that they have changed a bit (use service-worker.js instead of serviceWorker.js?).

Some pros and cons about the service worker are here: https://create-react-app.dev/docs/making-a-progressive-web-app/. If we decide to keep using it, you should be able to create a sample app with a working service worker to compare to by running e.g.

```
yarn create react-app my-pwa-app --template cra-template-pwa-typescript
```

title: Post-v1.3.0 release updates
body:
A couple updates to help make future releases smoother.

- Use node 12 on the CI job that builds JBrowse Web, since our dependencies don't support node 10 anymore
- Make sure the user doesn't have any local file changes when running the release script

title: Proposal: Make FileSelector default to URL instead of File
body: This changes the default of the FileSelector component so that if it's not provided a location, it defaults to prompting for a URL instead of a local file. I think this is the more common use case, especially for JBrowse Web, and so would hopefully save users clicks (and possibly avoid some confusion).

Also adds the current jbrowse version number to the jbrowse2.pdf

title: Allow Custom Tracks/Data Adapters from Plugins to Add Config Options to Track Menu Items
body:
I apologize for the length of this. I have been working on this issue for many weeks, and I have finally been able to describe clearly the problem I'm having. There is a bug in the sense that it seems like JBrowse2 works differently than described in the documentation, but I'm also requesting a more substantial fix than just fixing that specific problem as I do not think it will fix the key issue.

**Background**

I am currently maintaining a simple plugin that calculates custom statistics from the reference sequence information and displays it as a QuantitativeTrack. It is implemented as a DataAdapter. It works well. My users are able to have GC content and a whole host of other simple statistics available without the need for writing lots of separate plugins or creating lots of static BigWig tracks.

I am working on trying to improve usability on this plugin so that I can release it publicly.

**The Basic Problem**

The thing I'm currently having trouble with is that I can't seem to add custom menu items that allow the user to change the settings for the DataAdapter on the track. These things can be customized if the track is copied and then modified, but this is a pretty big hassle for my users. I would like them to be able to change simple options for the data adapter from the track menu similar to how users are allowed to change various display options.

The developer documentation says that custom menu items can be added if a custom track type is created. I have done this, and it compiles. But when I attempt to enable the track I get the error message, "Error: no containing view found." This is due to the way getTrackMenuItems is implemented. It expects to find something that is a "view model" as defined in the core types.

**The Problem's Cause**

I looked through the source code, and it seems like the only things that qualify as "views," are things that descend from BaseViewModel. Track configSchemas do not. They have no width field or setWidth properties. The only things I can find that add menu items in the core components are Displays.

As far as I can tell, it is currently not possible for custom tracks to add menu items at all (despite what the documentation implies). If I want to add menu items for modifying settings for my DataAdapter I have to wrap and then extend the LinearWiggleDisplay, a wholly different kind of component. This would work, but it feels very messy.

**Possible Solutions**

It seems like the most elegant solution is to allow all types associated with a track to add their own menu items, not just limit it to things that extend from BaseViewModel. This would make separation of responsibilities a lot clearer and would make writing plugins much more straightforward. 

People wouldn't have to add things their plugins don't need just to get access to features like adding track menu items. Right now my plugin exists as a DataAdapter. I have no functional need to fork any kind of Display or even add a custom track type. I fear that if I add these things to my plugin that it will become harder to maintain in the future by increasing complexity.

title: Make SNPCoverage independently generate the modifications tag-color mapping
body:
This is a sort of tricky one where the SNPCoverage track, when colorBy modifications is turned on, draws with an uninitialized tag->color mapping

This could be a correctness issue as it could affect first-time rendering

Currently the Alignments track synchronizes the tag -> color mapping from the pileup to the snpcoverage display

One alternative would be to treat the snpcoverage track and pileup track is functionally independent, so they both do their own work to get the color mapping independently

This actually is extra work done, and could result in slowdown, as the getUniqueModifications RPC call is an extra pass through the data. We can count the number of passes through the data like this

So to draw a track, we get something like this

SNPCov - stats estimation
SNPCov - modification tag color mapping
SNPCov - draw pileup, 2-3 blocks, 2-3 passes
Pileup - modification tag color mapping
Pileup - 2-3 blocks=2-3 passes 
~7-9 passes through the data to draw the alignments track.

It could be nice if there was less passes through the data, and this PR technically only adds 1 extra pass to those that are already there.

title: Add @jbrowse/img to homepage

This proposes adding @jbrowse/img to the homepage, helps add some awareness perhaps

It adds a new section called CLI since I'm not sure it fits in the "Embedded" section

title: Make tracks added using the add track widget a session track if not in adminMode
body: Fixes #1991

title: Fix issue with BAM index getting redownloaded after block scroll
body:
Currently, when you side scroll a block, the code makes a new request for a BAI file for example for BAM

Affects v1.1.0 and v1.2.0 and current main

Last working v1.0.4

This upgrades abortable-promise-cache which has a fix for this

It would be ideal if yarn automatically figured this one out, because this upgrade was allowed by semver to get an upgraded abortable-promise-cache

I ran `npx yarn-deduplicate` to achieve this result

I could have also released a new version of @gmod/cram and @gmod/bam specifying a minimum abortable-promise-cache of v1.4.0

This is especially bad for large index files that don't go in the browser cache, so are redownloaded in full

title: Updating the colour scheme through "configuration"
Pass initialDisplay snapshot via separate param to showTrack
body: The showTrack has a "initial snapshot" method that it can use to instantiate track specific state, but it is also useful to be able to initialize display specific state too (in the GDC plugin, we can use this to provide initial min and max scores for wiggle display for dynamically added tracks for example)

title: Make session plugins get transferred to the worker properly
body:
Currently there is a bug where the session plugins are not properly installed in the webworker

This is a little tricky to fix because we need to have a handle on the plugin definitions themselves, and the place where RpcManager is initialized in rootModel doesn't have session.sessionPlugins yet (the model is still initializing so session is undefined)

This takes the approach to store all plugin definitions as plugin metadata, and then adds a getter called PluginManager.pluginDefinitions and this can be used for the workerBootConfiguration

Shown below, I added a track (called "Track added via widget") in JBrowse Web non-admin mode, and it shows up in the top-level "Tracks" category instead of "Session tracks." If I copy the track, it does properly end up in the "Session tracks" category.

title: Fix duplicate requests for BAM file and avoid internal behavior of the data adapters

I change it here to make PileupRenderer responsible for calling getAdapter on adapterConfig.sequenceAdapter

title: Allow custom filtering expressions to be applied to state or configuration of tracks
body: The alignments track implemented a number of bespoke filtering options. It could be useful for our other tracks to have some filtering ability too. The VCF for example, I may want to look for translocations specifically, or I might want to filter out a specific gene in a gene track for demonstration purposes

title: Add ability to customize feature detail fields with configuration expressions
Avoid CPU freeze in dev from react-error-overlay with MST validation errors
body:
When we are in development mode, the react-error-overlay can cause freezing of the app because it runs a regex over the error message, and our error messages can be quite long, so it produces 100% CPU and it's a bad dev experience. This doesn't happen in production, but it causes some freezing of the computer in dev.



This can be mitigated in some cases if you catch the error but we often just let errors go to our top level errorboundary and those messages get shown by both react-error-overlay and the ErrorBoundary

This PR just disables the react-error-overlay effectively (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46589819/disable-error-overlay-in-development-mode) 

Note that this causes hot module reloading to fail https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app/issues/10611

If we like hot module reloading, we could wait for a fix for that but it is useful to avoid 100% CPUs in dev to have some solution at some point

title: Avoid error calculating UTR on features that have no exon subfeatures
body: As title says, UTR prediction is not done if no exon subfeatures are available. Fixes #1983

The base feature details has heuristics and such to make sure sort of arbitrary "json type data" can get a reasonable display

If there is an array of json, it can display a datagrid or a list of elements but currently the list of elements dumps some raw json to the screen

This makes it so array values switch back to using the "attributes" if an object is encountered instead of dumping the stringified json to the screen

title: jbrowse fails to fetch sequence and does not recognize GFF3 correctly
body:
JBrowse does not recognize a GFF3 file correctly (mRNA/CDS) and fails to fetch the sequence by pressing the feature.

Firefox reports several errors in the log ([firefox-console-export-2021-5-17_15-44-38.txt](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/files/6494274/firefox-console-export-2021-5-17_15-44-38.txt)) and prints:
>Failed to fetch sequence for feature: TypeError: u is undefined

while Chromium prints 
> Failed to fetch sequence for feature: TypeError: Cannot read property 'start' of undefined
.

Create a new directory inside the jbrowse like "test", copy [the linked files](https://cloud.online-arts.de/s/xPFsisjLjYoTwJp) and run these commands inside the console:

```bash
samtools faidx sequence
jbrowse add-assembly sequence --out . -l copy -t indexedFasta -n Sequence
jbrowse set-default-session --target config.json  --view LinearGenomeView -n "MOSGA #1"
gt gff3 -sortlines -tidy -retainids genome.gff 2>/dev/null | bgzip > genome.gff.gz && tabix genome.gff.gz
jbrowse add-track genome.gff.gz --out . -l copy --subDir=Genes --force -n MOSGA
```

**Expected behavior**

I expected to see the transcript and the CDS. Additionally, I should be able to retrieve the sequences from the feature.

![Screenshot_2021-05-17 JBrowse](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17415804/118500145-d7610780-b727-11eb-90f0-8d7a205245c9.png)

**Version:**
JBrowse 2 v1.2.0
Firefox 88
Chromium 90
Ubuntu 18.04

title: Allow manually specifying adapter type if filename does not match expected pattern
body: Fixes #1885

title: Make feature detail formatters to allow things like external links
body:
These was fairly common in jbrowse 1 to allow formatting detail panels to have custom link-outs to external DBs, etc.


fmtDetailValue was the way it was done in jbrowse 1

title: Add popup confirmation dialog for unknown session plugins, and use plugins.json as a whitelist
body:
We currently have this behavior in jbrowse-web loader

a) trust plugins in a users config file if loading same-origin config
b) prompt against loading cross-origin configs
c) load plugins from sessions (without any checking)


I propose changing it so

a) same behavior, trust plugins in users config file if loading same-origin config
b) trust cross-origin configs if they have plugins that match our plugins.json file (e.g. matches urls from there), only prompt if not
c) trust session plugins if they have plugins that match our plugins.json file (e.g. matches urls from there), only prompt if not

The motivation here is that (c) is sort of a currently existing security hole, and that (b) is not really a security hole after checking whitelisted plugins and change to jexl, so does not need a prompt

title: Upgrade @material-ui/data-grid
body:
This upgrades @material-ui/data-grid to the latest as well as @material-ui/core. The @material-ui/data-grid requires at least node 12 via the engines field

Enables the editable cells for possible use in apollo

title: reorganize the demo page to emphasize the cancer sv demo more
body: The cancer demo that takes people through the SV features gives grant reviewers a good overview of things without them having to do the work to click around, which I think is important right now.

title: Allow local files on the users computer to be opened as tracks in jbrowse-web
body:
This is an early result but I had an interest in allowing the ability to upload local files as blob files in jbrowse web. This is a longstanding issue #88

The basic methodology is this

0) realize that you can't store a file blob in a mobx-state-tree state, and our other file handles are mobx-state-tree's so then go to step 1
1) create a mapping of a blobId (something I made up) to the actual file blob
2) make the BlobLocation mst object store this blobId
3) making openLocation read the map to access the file blob given the BlobLocation's blobId

In order to make this work on the webworker, we have to send the map of blobId to the blob over the rpc. This PR sends the entire map  instead of trying to select a single blob off the map for example for smaller payload.

Fixes #88

title: Fix loading configuration file defined plugins for RpcManager
body:
Fixes #1973, worked with @elliothershberg 

The procedure of loading off the jbrowseModel.configuration was incorrect (the configuration was not the right place for this but the jbrowseModel.plugins itself) should work properly now

title: Example JB2 config that purely uses remote files?
body:
Hello - we're converting to JB2 and have a question. With JB2 it should be possible to have a config that purely points to resources hosted elsewhere. Do you happen to have an example of such a config that uses relatively stable URLs for a genome and tracks? I'd like to use this for two purposes: 1) automated integration tests would use that, and 2) we have a LabKey modules that wraps JS2. Effectively, we have a server-side API that returns the JSON needed to create the JS2 instance (assembly, tracks, etc.). For demo purposes, I'd like to come up with a dummy config that does not require local flatfiles. 

If you dont easily have this I can figure out my own. We had been using something based on URLs we stole from your JB2 demo page.

title: If session fails to load, give user option to submit it to us
body:
We don't have a lot of visibility into sessions because they contain private data and we encrypt them

However, if a session fails to load, we could make a form that allows the user to submit it to us so we could create a low-friction way to create a "bug report" similar to sending a crash report to windows

title: Omit configurationSchema snapshot when it matches the default
body:
During pairing @teresam856 and I were thinking about the "textSearchAdapter" in her branch. It's an "optional" config sub-schema, but the default value of the sub-schema was still showing up in config snapshots, which we thought might be confusing. This is an option we came up with that will omit the snapshot of a configuration schema if the snapshot matches the snapshot for the default value of that schema. We though this might be good as a separate PR.

This can be a bit odd if the whole config matches the default, since it makes the whole config snapshot be `undefined` instead of `{}`. We also had to change a couple places that used `getConf(self, 'renderer').type` to `getConf(self, ['renderer', 'type'])`.

It does have the advantage of removing unused things from our config snapshot, e.g. renderers with no customization:
```diff
diff --git a/test_data/volvox/config.json b/test_data/volvox/config.json
--- a/test_data/volvox/config.json
+++ b/test_data/volvox/config.json
@@ -663,10 +663,7 @@
       "displays": [
         {
           "type": "LinearFilteringDisplay",
-          "displayId": "filtering_track_linear",
-          "renderer": {
-            "type": "SvgFeatureRenderer"
-          }
+          "displayId": "filtering_track_linear"
         }
       ]
     },
```

There's an unexpected change in one of the snapshots, so keeping as a draft for now.

title: Fix ability to use add-track force on symlink tracks
body:
Possible fix for #1958 

The main thing is that it needs to unlink the destination before trying to symlink it

It is somewhat of a coincidence that copy behavior is to overwrite by default. I changed it to actually use  COPYFILE_EXCL to avoid accidentally overwriting a destination file, and the user can go back and use --force to overwrite it, which matches the behavior of overwriting the symlink added in this PR

It uses a try catch because if the destination symlink doesn't exist it would otherwise throw

Adds some misc refactoring (could be split out) to  try to simplify or deduplicate some repetitive logic in the code and tests with the hope that simpler code==easier to see code paths

https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/compare/fix_symlink_add_track?expand=1#diff-7c20288c5391381db2117575ccf46defd61fd768480ee3af4cc60d2fe1bbde21R315-R318
