title: Fix ability to use DialogComponent (used for svg export, pileup sort, etc) on embedded components
body:
The embedded component was not using the DialogComponent volatile option properly to do things like export svg and other features that use the results of session.setDialogComponent

This also makes the About track dialog use this setDialogComponent method instead of being a special case on the session model

For reference, this feature is pretty similar to widgets on the session, but is more explicitly a dialog box

title: jbrowse-cli ignores the force argument on symlink
body:
Hi,

I appreciate your work and project and love the idea to deal with symlinks instead of redundantly stored files. I'm embedding JBrowse for user-configured genome annotation within a Snakemake pipeline. Sometimes, depending on the changed files, Snakemake calls the "jbrowse add-track" command multiple times during re-run. Unfortunately, jbrowse is not able to deal with already existing symlinks:

> jbrowse add-track /opt/mosga/snakemake/../gui/uploads/25a87c14/repeats/windowmasker/windowmasker.gff.gz --out /opt/mosga/snakemake/../gui/uploads/25a87c14/jbrowse --load symlink --subDir=Repeats --force -n WindowMasker
>Error: EEXIST: file already exists, symlink '/opt/mosga/snakemake/../gui/uploads/25a87c14/repeats/windowmasker/windowmasker.gff.gz' -> '/opt/mosga/gui/uploads/25a87c14/jbrowse/Repeats/windowmasker.gff.gz'
> Code: EEXIST

The arguments "--force", "--overwrite", or "--skipCheck" do not have any effect. By changing the load parameter from symlink to copy it works again. It would be nice if jbrowse could overwrite or delete and set the symlink again.

Cheers
Roman

**Expected behavior**

Should overwrite the existing symlink.

**Version:**

JBrowse 1.2.0
Ubuntu 18.04
Firefox

title: Fix connection behavior
body:
Three connections-related fixes:

* Add key to ToggleConnectionsDialog to fix React warning
* Show connections in ToggleConnectionsDialog and HierarchicalTrackSelector if the connection's "assemblyNames" config slot is an empty array. This preserves prior behavior described here: https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/1660#issuecomment-816281981
* Open connections were not getting preserved on refresh. This PR fixes that by using `Array.isArray` instead of `isObject` to check if the `connectionInstances` should be discarded when loading a session.

title: Add more environments to configSchema create calls to fix ability to use custom jexl commands with main thread rendering
body:
This is a follow up to the #1945 which found that main thread rendering can produce errors if a plugin has added custom jexl functions and the plugin is trying to use them


The reason is explained in #1945 but the summary is that if this is not done, a jexl instance is created automatically and will only contain default commands

The target branch is currently #fix_hic but if that is merged, should be good to go, then this could be an add-on

If there is anything I missed let me know

I basically looked at all instances searching using "ag create\(" in the codebase and looked for instances of this pattern, which generally is the renderProps on a model function dynamically creating a renderer config

title: Add demo for 1000 genomes extended trio dataset to website
body:
This adds a demo for the 1000 genomes extended trio dataset reference paper (https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2021.02.06.430068v1)

I had to do manual data munging to produce a tracklist from this data, and sometimes the NCBI servers where we fetch the data from are a little finicky and return status 200 for range requests, but it is mostly a good demo I think

title: Fix breakpoint split view demo configuration on website
body:
There were a couple of things that happened along the way to breakpoint split view demo being broken. It is basically just the demo, it should work in normal usage of the app. But in the demo, there were some weird things happening


- Integration test for breakpoint split view demo was disabled at some point (07/2020), by me (oh dear) which is sort of a root cause of subsequent failures
- Breakpoint split view demo was using chrom.sizes which had refnames with chr prefix, but it wasn't actually testing refrenaming
- Breakpoint split view displayedRegions were using "6" instead of the "chr6" that was in the assembly, making them pretty much invalid settings
- Breakpoint split view demo did not have refNameAliases configuration to let it adapt between chr6 and 6
- Since it was using invalid settings, the assembly.getCanonicalRefName was not working

title: Bump handlebars from 4.7.6 to 4.7.7
body:
Bumps [handlebars](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js) from 4.7.6 to 4.7.7.
Changelog

Sourced from handlebars's changelog.

v4.7.7 - February 15th, 2021

  • fix weird error in integration tests - eb860c0
  • fix: check prototype property access in strict-mode (#1736) - b6d3de7
  • fix: escape property names in compat mode (#1736) - f058970
  • refactor: In spec tests, use expectTemplate over equals and shouldThrow (#1683) - 77825f8
  • chore: start testing on Node.js 12 and 13 - 3789a30

(POSSIBLY) BREAKING CHANGES:

  • the changes from version 4.6.0 now also apply in when using the compile-option "strict: true". Access to prototype properties is forbidden completely by default, specific properties or methods can be allowed via runtime-options. See #1633 for details. If you are using Handlebars as documented, you should not be accessing prototype properties from your template anyway, so the changes should not be a problem for you. Only the use of undocumented features can break your build.

That is why we only bump the patch version despite mentioning breaking changes.

Commits

Commits
  • a9a8e40 v4.7.7
  • e66aed5 Update release notes
  • 7d4d170 disable IE in Saucelabs tests
  • eb860c0 fix weird error in integration tests
  • b6d3de7 fix: check prototype property access in strict-mode (#1736)
  • f058970 fix: escape property names in compat mode (#1736)
  • 77825f8 refator: In spec tests, use expectTemplate over equals and shouldThrow (#1683)
  • 3789a30 chore: start testing on Node.js 12 and 13
  • See full diff in compare view

This fixes it...something weird with default exports /dynamic imports

We don't currently have a test for hic to help facilitate integration tests, though we could try to make one if there is interest

title: Upgrade pluralize for config plugin to make all versions use 8.0.0
body: Possible fix for #1943

title: Usage with npm instead of yarn
Add group by tag functionality to alignments tracks
body:
This is a proof of concept for "Group by" functionality on alignments tracks, but maybe some unknowns remain

This screenshot shows grouping by the "RG" or read group

![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fvolvox%2Fconfig json session=local-K0UTJB5eA (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/117252291-c1904000-ae13-11eb-9904-3cdc7d8a36c4.png)

![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json session=local-fVJjsV8fe](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/117253326-1b453a00-ae15-11eb-88b1-d24be571a978.png)

It creates an array of subtracks (or subdisplays), which constitutes a pileuptrack that has a filterBy: {tag: 'tag of interest', value: one for each value seen}

Therefore, if there are HP:0 and HP:1 then we create two subdisplays and filterBy HP:0 on one and HP:1 on the other

This is coded up as an "alignments track specific" functionality. If we wanted it to be able to be used on a pileup display on its own, it may require some changes. Some stuff that may be considered also:

how to turn on group by and color by?
any way to optimize? it is a little bit unfortunate that this requires multiple passes through the data, basically N+1 passes through the data if it is split into N subgroup tracks (1 pass to setup the groups, N passes on each group...)
some work on creating scrollable subgroups may be needed
etc.

title: Allow SNPCoverageDisplay to perform coloring and filtering on it's own
body:
The currently model for alignments display is that it is a "parent" and coordinates some updates for the pileup/snpcoverage displays. For some settings though, namely filterBy, the alignments display explicitly copies any updates to the LinearPileupDisplay.filterBy state to the LinearSNPCoverageDisplay.filterBy. This means that SNPCoverage tracks cannot perform filtering or coloring on their own 

This PR proposes making the filterBy setting part of the alignments parent LinearAlignmentsDisplay state, and then propagating it into the LinearPileupDisplay and LinearSNPCoverageDisplay sub-displays


This is also done for colorBy setting which may help standalone LinearSNPCoverageDisplay to be used with DNA modifications/methylation coloring e.g. #1865


One concern may be that most "Color by" options settings don't really apply to SNPCoverage when it's on it's own, but it might be better to reorganize the code architecture this way anyways

title: Create v1.2.0.md, draft of release announcements
body: We are planning on releasing in ~30 minutes, check it out and let us know any feedback or additional features worth highlighting 👍

title: Disable rasterize layer option for browsers without offscreen canvas
body:
The Export SVG feature has to option to "rasterize layers" so that e.g. a very information dense wiggle or pileup visualization can just be an embedded PNG inside the SVG

This  doesn't work on Firefox and Safari where OffscreenCanvas based rasterizing doesn't exist, so we can try to avoid allowing that option to be used on these browsers

title: Update analytics and share API URLs to refer to more stable locations
body:
closes #1927 
endpoints for analytics and sharing are now analytics.jbrowse.org and share.jbrowse.org

Used Route 53 to create the analytics and share subdomains of jbrowse.org

Both use alias redirects to Custom domain names in API Gateway under the same name

The custom domain names in API Gateway have API mappings to the existing endpoints that analytics and sharing sessions uses

title: Create in app graphical plugin store
body: This is currently a draft PR while I get a few things figured out, but works for web. Opening this so I have a better view of the diff on this branch and the state of the CI. Remaining work: - [x] Get things working in desktop - [x] Write tests 😅 - [x] Merge main and resolve conflicts This closes #336 and also closes #1686 . **Screenshots:** With MsaView open:

title: Upgrade react scripts+react to latest versions
body:
In order to avoid letting our dependencies get stale on us, I tried upgrading react-scripts and react...

This I think had been attempted before, but I tried again just to see...seemed to work

1) yarn upgrade-interactive react-scripts --latest -> up to 4.0.3
1) skip preflight check in .env file of jbrowse-web as this introduces alternative version of jest that conflicts with tsdx's built in version
1) update worker loader to not manually refer to the oneOf[1].plugins since this crashed startup, this also seemed unneeded so line was removed
1) fixed a couple lint errors that prevented startup, including adding eslint-config-react-app to root, and removing @typescript-eslint/camelcase stuff which may be due to similar stuff to here (https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/issues/2077)
1) manually upgrade react and react-dom in package.json of root, jbrowse-web, jbrowse-desktop as yarn upgrade-interactive complained about @babel/preset-env

title: Add ability to manually specify the adapter type from CLI

The code from the CLI currently assumes guessAdapterType is correct, it may be useful to have a override

Maybe --adapterType flag

More custom adapter types may need to use add-track-json or similar

title: update analytics and session sharing endpoints to use a URL we can move
body: Probably a cloudfront url or something? Currently it's logging to https://mdvkjocq3e.execute-api.us-east1.amazonaws.com/default/jbrowse-analytics

title: Update website to link to demos on cloudfront for better compression
body:
Xref previous lab talk where I noted that our S3 bucket doesn't have compression enabled...I went ahead and tried turning on a setting to turn on compression on cloudfront with these instructions

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudFront/latest/DeveloperGuide/ServingCompressedFiles.html#compressed-content-cloudfront-configuring

I tried a couple tests loading volvox cram files, etc and it seemed to work fine

This makes overall downloaded content 

Initial load of v1.1.0 is ~1MB total amount downloaded vs before which has 3.9MB downloaded, so the new bundle size is 25% of the size of the old bundle (or a 75% decrease)

Can see comparing

https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/v1.1.0/index.html
https://jbrowse.org/code/jb2/v1.1.0/index.html

So this PR updates demo links to use cloudfront, and removes the "currentLink" field in the docusaurus json and instead manually uses currentVersion in template strings

I still believe that things like optimizing bundle size is important, especially since users of jbrowse may not configure their compression properly + just perceived improvements in load time do matter, but if you do have it configured properly it can make a big difference

title: Add curly:error to global eslint config
body:
In general, I find it much more intentional to have curlies around any code block that is indented

This makes a global eslint rule to produce an error if it is not, and it is also autofixable too

There are some instances of single-line-if-statements that are still allowed with this, but when it spans multiple lines it should have a curly

title: Fix import of BED and navToLocString from spreadsheet views
body:
The syntax +item is not available in jexl so I converted to parseInt (with the radix param :))

Also, for example, the variable row.cells.ref.text was not actually existing, the previous code was

var [ref, start, end] = row.cells
ref.text

In jexl form, without destructuring, we use row.cells[0].text

Finally the navToLocString click on cell gave an error for "model width undefined" so I moved the view.initialized await above the view.setDisplayedRegions. There was some rearrangement of this code at some point so it works better to check for initialized before setting displayed regions

title: Add react-window to the data-management plugin, remove from linear-genome-view
body:
The react-vtree has a peerDependency on react-window

Currently there is a react-window dependency listed in linear-genome-view but that appears unused, so I just moved it over to the data-management plugin

title: Rename "Manage connections" to "Delete connections..."
body: Internally, it is still called ManageConnectionsDialog but usefully it only is used to delete connections. If needed I can change the internal name too.

title: Use MDX to add proper image captions in web and pdf documentation
body:
This is a stub PR that tries to standardize how to make captions on figures in our docs

Currently it is assumed the line following a markdown image like `![](img/blah.png)` is a caption, and this is actually hardcoded as an assumption in the PDF. There is also the suggestion to fill out alt text e.g. `![Alt text here](img/blah.png)`

Currently the webpages don't even display captions that well, and since markdown has no real good concept of a caption, I propose using MDX for this

This PR begins this propagation

It appears to work well on the user guide and quickstart_gui for admin server, so I may continue to propagate it. Images will be moved from website/docs/img to website/static/img since I think it is required to be in static resources for use with mdx maybe https://docusaurus.io/docs/static-assets

title: Add close button to assembly manager dialog box
body:
This adds a X close icon to the top right of the assembly manager, and makes clicking outside the dialog close the dialog (as is the case with most of our dialogs, this behavior is made by having an onClose prop to the Dialog component)

Also renames the "Return" button to "Close"

title: Fix reloading of local sessions when using React.StrictMode
body:
This was found while testing React.StrictMode, which revealed that page refreshes did not keep the local session working.

StrictMode does a little "chaos testing" like double rendering components which can reveal weird things

In this case, I found sessionStorage from rootModel autorun outputs sessionStorage.setItem('current', JSON.stringify({session}))

The code here in loader was outputting sessionStorage.setItem('current', JSON.stringify(session)) instead

This fixes it so they both output {session}

It may be possible to not even update sessionStorage here and only rely on rootModel's autorun but I didn't look into this yet

title: Fix breakpoint split view visualizations for files that need ref renaming (e.g. chr1 vs 1)
body:
Fixes #1902 

This makes sure to use canonical refname when searching.

There are possible alternatives to this PR

We could try to make all our adapters return features with a field called feature.get('originalRefName') that can be used for purposes like this (note that adapters do receive a parameter called region.originalRefName which is the canonical ref name for the assembly being views to their getFeatures function)

This could either

a) be the adapters responsibility to fill out this field or
b) be some sort of auto-added thing by some other aspect of our system (renderer/serialization/adapter/something else?)

Or we stick with this this type of solution, and wait until we find a good abstraction

title: Snapshot preprocessor to filter out old connectionInstances
body: Fixes #1903

title: Exon-Intron Structure Display
body:
I have a question about visualization of gene data in the current version of JBrowse2. Depending on whether or not this is currently implemented, this might be a request for a new feature -or- a request for documentation about an existing feature.

It appears right now that JBrowse2 displays some information about genes using lines and arrowheads. However, it seems like the exon-intron structure (specifically, length of exons) is not currently displayed for our data from AUGUSTUS. 

Has this feature been implemented in JBrowse2? If so, what fields are necessary in the GFF3 file for gene data to make the exon-intron structure visible?

title: static configuration API or DSL
body:
Make a nodejs API or DSL or something like that which can procedurally generate and edit JB2 configurations.

Supports includes.

Example API sketch:
```js
const config = new JBrowse2Config()
config.addView(blahblahblah)
config.findTracks({ compatibleView: 'LinearGenomeView'}).setColor(xyz)
config.writeTo('config.json')
```

title: embeddable builds of the full jbrowse-web app
body:
* embeddable react component of the full app
* UMD build of plain-JS wrapper around the react component for people who just want to run everything from script tags


Some things that need to be solved for this:
* what do we do about the URL processing
* what do we do about SessionStorage
* what do we do about share links
* make new build and deploy systems for these two deployment scenarios
* drawer widgets might not want to stay inside the embedded div, might need to change the drawer widget implementation. need to check into that.

title: Add coarser/finer resolution toggles to Hi-C tracks and bump version
body:
I had done this awhile ago but just wanted to rebase and put on master

Note that technically, and if interested we could do this, we could replace "coarser/finer" resolutions with a select box that chooses the true window size so it would instead be a dropdown with 5000,10000,25000,etc. that would probably be a custom RPC method that fetches that list of resolutions

Just an idea, though the coarser/finer seems to work pretty OK

title: Additional lazy loading of individual adapter types, aim to reduce bundle size
body:
Add on PR to #1888 


In order to separate concerns somewhat, it is made as an add on. Comment made in that thread moved here:


In my previous comment (https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/1888#issuecomment-816799144), I suggested how it may be interesting to make data adapters lazily loaded. In that comment there is a branch that tries to lazy load e.g. our @gmod/bam parsers inside the data adapter, but to truly make the entire e.g. BamAdapter class lazily loaded, I made a proposal here that tries to help

https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/tree/lazyreact_dataadapters_alternative_interface

The idea is that getAdapter now is async, and the AdapterType pluggable element can have an AdapterClass or a getAdapterClass->() => Promise<AdapterClass> so that when you define an adapter type you can have

```
pluginManager.addAdapterType(() => new AdapterType({
    configSchema: configSchemaJustLikeNormal,
    getAdapterClass: () => import('./BamAdapter')
})
```

This also means that the capabilities would not be statically available from calling getAdapter which is what some main thread code does, so I made an extra field to make capabilities statically available

BamAdapter.ts

```
export default BamAdapter {
    ...
    static capabilities=[...]
}
const adapterCapabilities = BamAdapter.capabilities 
export {adapterCapabitilies}
```
```
import {adapterCapabilities,configSchema} from './BamAdapter'


pluginManager.addAdapterType(() => new AdapterType({
    configSchema: configSchemaJustLikeNormal,
    getAdapterClass: () => import('./BamAdapter/BamAdapter') # the actual class
    adapterCapabilities
}))
```

title: Fix issue with synteny polygons displaying slightly offset
body:
Fixes #1895

Currently bpToPx overestimates the amount of times it needs to incorporate interRegionPaddingBlock to all the displayedRegions that are offscreen to the left of any particular view

It actually only needs to incorporate the interRegionPaddingBlock for any displayedRegion that is on the blocks, not ones that are off screen to the left.

A similar concept was incorporated in pxToBp (which was much needed when using show all regions in assembly) but needed to be applied to bpToPx here too.

title: Previous working session links broken by connectionInstances schema change

title: Possibly incorrect SNPs displayed on long read nanopore data
body:
See #1869 



To orient us I'm gonna look at chr20:13,846,375, and the "caac" motif is highlighted in red along with the position in pink


samtools tview, with 
![Screenshot from 2021-04-09 23-22-58 (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/114257011-fc28c900-998a-11eb-82cb-ffc99793cf36.png)

igv desktop

crucially, it shows a G and T mismatches at this position

JBrowse 1 and 2 show a C and a T mismatch at this position, but note that the reference base is C, so it is likely jbrowse is wrong here. We may have a glitch in CIGAR/MD processing or this particular file may be reporting CIGAR/MD in a way we do not expect

jb2

also checked in jb1 latest version and 1.15.0 and 1.11.6 but it matches what is displayed in jb2 hence not working

title: Synteny rendering may be slightly inaccurate
body:
See https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/main/?config=test_data%2Fyeast_synteny%2Fconfig.json&session=share-tJt2GX2rkK&password=dUSfs

I think the alignments juncture should be at exactly the boundary of CP006421 and CP005470 (e.g. bright green marker) but instead they are a little off (e.g. bright red marker)

![t12 (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/114251169-10aa9880-996e-11eb-99e6-49c550eb0650.png)


The two rows from this are

I believe the two rows that make up the "juncture" here are these from https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/genomes/yeast/YJM1447_vs_R64.paf

```
CP006421.1  1556556 1497164 1556547 + BK006945.2  1078177 1003601 1062357 52563 59436 60  tp:A:P  cm:i:4992 s1:i:52418  s2:i:2096 dv:f:0.0085 rl:i:150 
CP005470.2  895110  10  176381  + BK006946.2  924431  7844  184159  159014  176893  60  tp:A:P  cm:i:15316  s1:i:158796 s2:i:359  dv:f:0.0076 rl:i:408 
```

There is no real way for a single alignment to "cross" the boundary between refseqs hence, probably the rendering is inaccurate

title: Allow clicking on a particular alignment in synteny view
body: Technically PAF "features" (e.g. a row) can have arbitrary metadata like SAM flags added to the end, and clicking on a particular alignment may be useful to get more info about an alignment. It may be challenging to handle clicking overlapping alignments but it might be useful to make a best effort to do this anyways

title: Improve assembly manager styling and typography
body: This is a tiny PR that revisits the styling and typography of the assembly manager screen. As I got started on the plugin store stuff, I felt like it looked a bit small and sad. Just adjusted spacing and typography a bit. Before: After:

title: Create new JB2 plugin store
body: This PR implements the plugin store described by #1838 . In working on this PR, I set up the initial list of plugins at: https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-plugin-list A Github Action copies the JSON file of plugin data to S3 when the repo is updated. There is also a guide for adding a new plugin at this repo. I've added a step to the website build where this file is fetched. The plugin store looks like this: When you click "show configuration" for a given plugin card, you get a copyable code block of the JSON configuration necessary to add the plugin: **Note:** I didn't implement search or pagination for the plugin store, because we currently only have 7 plugins in the store. I could either add that to this PR, or we could revisit this as the store grows.

Some people use GTF.

title: More lazy loading of react components to reduce bundle size
body:
Currently loading the page load 

- For start screen incurs 3.8MB js to be downloaded
- For a page direct to an LGV with a track incurs about 7.4MB js

This PR does not help too much yet but I thought some more work to reduce JS size could be beneficial

- Making some of the NewSessionCard images smaller and runs pngquant on them (low hanging fruit, can be made a separate PR probably)
- (Re-) introducing the LazyReactComponent option for ViewType, which could be expanded upon. I added LazyReactComponent for circular, dotplot, and spreadsheet
-  For spreadsheet in particular, tries to lazy load the parsers since csvtojson dependency is ~160kb
- Makes dotplot/circular/spreadsheet not use jbrequire just for simplicity and since it doesn't appear needed

Note that the lazy loading isn't paying off big yet but I think it could help in the long run cut our load times


Current payloads with this PR

- For a page direct to an LGV with a track 6.4MB (delta -1MB)
- For a start screen 3.3MB (delta -0.5MB)

title: JB1 connection does not work with relative data directory
jbrowse-cli admin server should watch config.json on disk for changes
body:
If you are running the admin server, and the config.json gets changed on disk (by a text editor, or script, or whatever), the admin server should reload the GUI with the new configuration.

This would be useful for people who are testing configuration-generating scripts, or who for some reason want to edit their configuration outside of the GUI.

title: Add --delete to set-default-session, fix --session
body:
This PR is a couple of small changes from when I was trying to figure out https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/discussions/1873.

* Fixes `jbrowse set-default-session --session session.json` so that it expects a session JSON file. It was previously expecting a config JSON file. Also added support for the session being in a top-level "session" attribute on the session JSON so that files created with `File -> Export session` can be used with `set-default-session`
* Adds a `--delete` option to `set-default-session` that removes the "defaultSession" from the config. Setting the default session to `null` or `{}` using `set-default-session --session file.json` caused errors, so this adds an easy way to clear the default session.

title: Add ability to copy the text produced by the feature details sequence panel to MS Word/Google Docs and preserve styling
body:
This adds a button that says "Copy" (as in copy to clipboard) button for the feature details sequence panel, and the sequence can then be pasted in word or google docs and retain the coloring, and be used for microsoft word based bioinformatics

The code had to be modified slightly to support this (span instead of div)

title: Add aborting to CoreGetFeatures rpcManager call
body:
This PR that adds an AbortSignal options parameter to "CoreGetFeatures" rpcManager

This was just based on the observation that "SequenceDialog" if a large region is selected and then the dialog is closed, does not cancel the fetch of sequence

This does not yet actually add full aborting for that sequence fetch, because the sequence adapters such as indexedfasta-js et al would have to add abort support to make this really work, but it may be worth it to have the infrastructure added here anyways

title: easy import of common data
body:
Add functionality in the GUI for both admin and non-admin users to be able to easily import common assemblies and tracks with just a few clicks. Non-admins would just get these as session assemblies and session tracks, admins would be able to persist these to their configs if they are in the admin server.

Common assemblies and tracks like:
* hg19 and associated gene models from UCSC, Ensembl, etc
* same for hg38
* rat reference and annotations
* mouse
* cow
* etc


Implementation sketch:
* expand add-assembly dialog box to be able to add common assemblies from a JSON file on jbrowse.org that contains assembly configs that we keep up to date

title: Show modified bases using MM and MP/ML tags in BAM/CRAM
body:
Stub for coloring reads that have MM (positions of modified bases) and MP/ML (modification likelihood/probability) tags


This can be used to show methylation and other types of modifications, but methylation is probably the most common application


https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse/issues/1588

Needs to still incorporate CIGAR for positioning, but this is a fun start

Requested here https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse/issues/1588

title: Add Material UI's DataGrid to re-exports
body: @peterkxie is using the data-grid in the Apollo plugin, but it was proving hard to install in the plugin due to some conflicts with how we re-export Material UI for plugins. There are probably some improvements that could be made to make that easier, but as a first step, since the DataGrid is already in the peerDeps of core and is a useful component, I think we may as well re-export it so it's easy to use.

title: Display RNA/DNA modification probabilities at single read level.
body:
Hi @GMOD team,

The fields of epigenetics and now epitranscriptomics have evolved very fast in recent years and there are now a few DNA and RNA modifications which can be detected at single molecule resolution, in particular with Oxford Nanopore sequencing.

In order to avoid the proliferation of non-standard formats to store these modifications there was a long discussion with the samtools team on how to represent all modifications within SAM/BAM format (https://github.com/samtools/hts-specs/issues/362), leading to the proposition to use additional flags in the specification to store both modification positions (Mm) and probabilities (Ml) at read level. There can also be multiple modification tracks included within a single read. Here is the link to the Pull Request currently being considered: https://github.com/samtools/hts-specs/pull/418. Hopefully the PR will be merged soon and will be part of the official SAM specification.

Several Oxford Nanopore tools to detect RNA modifications already implement the specification ahead of the official release, including Megalodon (https://github.com/nanoporetech/megalodon) and Guppy basecaller. 

An ideal implementation in Jbrowse would display 1 track per modification and per read showing the probability of a modification presence as a color scale, or maybe multiple modification overlaid with different color scales. There is another old issue https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse/issues/509 discussing a way to display methylation information, but this is per position and not per read.

Does that sound like it could be easily implemented as a Jbrowse plugin  ?

title: Update @gmod/indexedfasta
body: Bumps @gmod/indexedfasta to 2.0.0 for the getSequenceNames change

title: Add example for using a build-time included plugin to storybook
body:
The storybook has an example of runtime-including a plugin but it is actually probably more common to use build-time plugins, so I added an example of that here

This adds a devDependency on jbrowse-plugin-ucsc to use as an example

title: Change Alignments track "Fade mismatches by quality" setting to a separate config param and made it less strict
body:
The "Color by" scheme for alignments currently has 'Fade mismatches by quality'

Instead of making this specifically a property of "Color by", I change this to a separate setting

Then I also make the fading less "strict" e.g. right now it is a scale on a 0-90 but I make it on 0-50 because at quality 40, you are 99.99% sure the base call is right (see https://learn.gencore.bio.nyu.edu/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/Screen-Shot-2018-01-07-at-1.36.09-PM-768x535.png) and so you really only need to worry at like 20 or less. Even though phred can go up to 90 it does not need to really be faded after 50 or so I think

title: Fix alignments read filter jexl syntax
body: This fixes the filters on alignments track e.g. read name, which currently had jexl syntax errors which are displayed in 1.1.0 if filters attempt to be used

title: Make @jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view storybook docs more visible
body:
It is not really clear from the (docs) that this (docs) is a separate link, so I made it into a separate part of a sentence

Also linked to the storybook docs from the /jb2/docs/ landing page

screenshots
![localhost_3000_jb2_](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/113042390-23042580-9169-11eb-834e-1d8e06fbed56.png)


![localhost_3000_jb2_ (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/113042384-21d2f880-9169-11eb-8b21-5db7787467e0.png)

title: If track is listed twice in a jbrowse 1 config, produces a duplicate track error when opening
body: Noted by @scottcain on the wormbase config, the trackList.json actually did have a duplicate track

title: Update v1.1.0.md
body: Adds snippet regarding updates to the drawer widget navigation.

title: Add download page in website header and new super-quick-start guide
body:
Proposes having a download page in the header bar for easy access to the latest release, for people that are too lazy to go through the blog post


Example screenshot
![localhost_3000_jb2_download (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/112881317-82930000-9099-11eb-9b90-e6636a9297a0.png)

title: Make "About track" dialog available from tracklist and for non-LGV tracks
body:
The ability to view the "About track" dialog is currently in LGV

This change allows a dotplot to have an "About track" dialog box too now

It also allows a track that has not yet been opened to have an "About track" access, directly from the dropdown in the tracklist

title: Add mouseovers in feature details that show field descriptions for VCF fields
body:
This adds the ability to inspect the "description" of a particular INFO field entry from a VCF

![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/112688146-d2ca5200-8e4e-11eb-96f7-fc65c2ddd8f5.png)

Modifies the API for BaseFeatureDetails somewhat to use this

Adds an API called getMetadata to the rpcManager, CoreGetMetadata, to get parsed adapter headers that may contain this information

title: Fix color by orientation on CRAM files
body: The "Color by orientation" on CRAM wasn't quite working. The CramSlightlyLazyFeature was missing this getter but BAM had it. Technically we could try to move towards just the FLAGS instead of individual feature types implementing this, but this is a smaller patch

title: Restore close button on drawer widget header
body:
This restores the close button for the drawer widgets

The previous PR https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/1778 removed it, but I think it should be restored. It is not intuitive to me that to close the "About jbrowse" drawer, I have to select it in the list of drawer widgets, and then "can it" with the trash can icon. I would prefer to hit the X button.

I also think the "trash can icon" is not really ideal, and would suggest removing that whole feature of having the can icon in the select box, but that is not part of this PR

title: Add true breakend ALT strings to the feature details panel
body:
This renders the true ALT breakend strings. Using our "MatePosition/JoinDirection" json representation may not be familiar to people, while the breakend syntax can be learned to be read...it is also more succinct and faithful to the datafile

Also adds curlies to VcfFeature, makes some multiline things a single line a bit shorter using object destructuring, and changes the order of resolving data to prioritize this.data instead of this.variant in toJSON and get

title: Bump docusaurus version
body: Just to try to stay on top of fast moving docusaurus releases. Requires node 12 now so it is built separately from our main codebase which keeps testing node 10 for now

title: Some package upgrades may result in build-time error
body:
This is somewhat random, but it is somewhat problematic when we are prohibited from staying up to date with package upgrades, so this is reported as a bug

When trying to upgrade @material-ui/data-grid results in this error during build cycle

https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/runs/2189848126
Seen in #1846 PR

title: Handle hundreds of thousands of scaffolds in assembly
body:
Some genomes have many, many chromosomes/scaffolds/contigs. Since they're all loaded into memory in the assembly manager, this can cause slowdowns or even page crashes. If there were some way to not load all the scaffolds into memory, it could help those users.

Here's an example that could act as an extreme stress test. This is a JBrowse set up with the Pinus taeda genome (from https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/assembly/GCA_000404065.3/): https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/ptaeda_genome/index.html?config=test_data%2Fptaeda%2Fconfig.json. This has 1,760,464 scaffolds. Currently, opening up a Linear Genome View with this assembly crashes the browser tab.

title: Improve copy+paste in the data grids for feature details
body:
This makes better data grid copy+paste operations in reference to https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui-x/issues/1197

It also turns off the sample filter panel in variant feature details by default as it can be a little specialized

title: Add wormbase example with connection to jbrowse 1 data directory
body:
Example link when built

s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/add_wormbase_example/index.html?config=test_data/config_wormbase.json

Needs tracklist optimizations since it has many tracks, but it does at least partially load

title: Remove non-functioning protein widget
body:
split from #1842 

remove the protein widget product, which has bitrotted

title: Remove function strings and eval usage
body: Fixes #1841

title: Change jexl callback helpers for features to use more functions and less transforms
body:
This is a proposal to change our syntax for jexl callbacks

It is based on a belief that the use of transforms, with the bar | syntax, will appear more unfamiliar than simply making everything functions

I propose making a function "get(feature, attribute)" where I can type

    get(feature, 'start')

This is similar to

    feature.get('start')

And replaces the current feature|getData(attribute)

Some other helper functions are changed from transforms to functions also

I add a section for documenting jexl to the configuration guide also

![localhost_3000_jb2_docs_config_guide (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/112254785-8953ea00-8c37-11eb-93ee-b970c85d9a16.png)

title: Remove eval from jbrowse1connection
body:
Currently jbrowse1connection maintains usage of eval

Since we have sessionConnections, there can be an xss risk

title: separate 'main' and 'dev' branches
body:
Under the new scheme:

Website deploys from `main` branch.
Releases are tagged on `main` branch.
GitHub default branch is `dev`
PRs go into `dev` branch

The website continually tracks the `main` branch, so any updates to main trigger a website deploy.
Website updates that need to go out immediately get manually merged into `main`.

title: central plugin store JSON and website display
body:
Make a JSON file that gets deployed to jbrowse.org, that is the central plugin list, which is just a list of npm module names that we have accepted into the plugin store.

The JSON file will be in its own little repo: https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-plugin-list
Need a little bit of CI on that repo to copy the plugin list to S3 when the main branch is updated.

And then the docusaurus build would go through that list, fetch the metadata about each plugin, and make a nice plugin list that Google can index and that people can browse on jbrowse.org to see all the cool plugins that JBrowse 2 has.

Plugin metadata is everything in the package.json, plus a plugin logo (svg or png). Plugin icon/logo would be at `jbrowse.plugin_logo` in the package.json.

Plugins are npm modules, hosted by npm (and from there, unpkg).
Plugins are loaded into browsers from unpkg URLs.

title: Change jbrowse-components monorepo default branch from 'master' to 'main'
body:
Updates our docs and automation to make the main production branch 'main'


fixes #1345

title: Fix infinite loop on desktop by using reference to pm instead of uninitialized state variable
body:
Fixes https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/1832

No tag needed since this was intra-release

title: jbrowse-desktop clicking on any card in new session freezes
body:
I tried clearing out ~/.config/@jbrowse/desktop but this does not fix it


clicking on any card such as New session, Linear genome view, or even the gear icon to reset session, results in an infinite loading as far as I can tell


Note that these infinite loading things are typical of any mobx-state-tree snapshot validation which is kind of dangerous

Trying to find out when this happened with git bisect seemed to indicate it is related to the jexl merge

Possibly bisect back to here https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/commit/1cc9f4139#diff-37c54790e7f32ece80db57d4889cf4df1174c3a310d2bfbf4f63eddabca942f7

title: Add dialog for launching breakpoint split view from variant feature details
body:
This is a demo for launching a breakpoint split view from a variant feature details panel

Note that there could be a similar thing dialog needed for alignments

An add on to this exists for side-by-side breakpoint split view but that may need more work (see branch side_by_side_dialog)

title: text search core system
body:
Implement the core code for JB2 text searching.

Requirements:

* pluggable text search adaptors
* Two different levels (or should we call them roles?) of indexes:
  * "aggregate" indexes that contain data for many different tracks and assemblies
  * "track-specific" indexes that contain data for just the track they are attached to
* When searching, the search system will determine which indexes are relevant to the search, search them all in parallel, then aggregate and rank the results and return them. Calls to the search system will probably want to have some kind of search options that specify the scope of the search.


Implementation sketch:

* create new pluggable element type in core called TextSearchAdapterType
* add optional `textSearch` volatile to rootModel that contains a text-searching controller made as a plain Typescript class
* add an optional text search adapter to all track configurations
* add array of text search adapters to root configuration for aggregated indexes
* all text search adapters need to have metadata about what tracks and assemblies they cover, so that searching code can make decisions about what indexes are relevant to use

title: LGV text search
body:
Add text searching functionality to the LGV autocomplete box.

Should offer type-ahead completions that use the current assembly's refnames, and also the text indexes that are relevant. (What is actually relevant? Open to discussion.)

title: generate-names.pl text search adaptor
body:
Create a text search adaptor that can search in a JBrowse 1 text index made by `generate-names.pl`.

Example data attached. Contains two indexes, one for volvox and one for yeast

[names.tar.gz](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/files/6174135/names.tar.gz)

title: jbrowse-cli text indexer subcommand
body:
implement an indexing subcommand in jbrowse-cli that can create text indexes.

Initially, this will probably feed data to the `ixIxx` binary from the kent utils to make a trix index that we will read with the #1826 adapter

title: trix-js text search adaptor
body:
implement a text search adaptor for [trix](https://genome.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/help/trix.html) output

depends on #303

title: REST text search adaptor
body: Make a REST text search adaptor similar to the [one that JB1 has](https://jbrowse.org/docs/data_formats.html#jbrowse-rest-names-api), but better

title: Add storybook docs page for nextjs usage
body:
This adds a Storybook docs page describing how webpack configuration and dynamic imports work for adding the React LGV component to Next.js apps.

This seems to be based on this aspect of Next.js builds: "The webpack function is executed twice, once for the server and once for the client." (source in Next.js docs: https://nextjs.org/docs/api-reference/next.config.js/custom-webpack-config). I think what is going on in #1786  is that there are Node environment variables that are still set when the client code is being compiled, leading to weird issues.

Since this is pretty specific to Next.js builds, and can be fixed using their own config, I think that this added documentation is probably enough to close #1786 .

title: Add note about previewing changelog to CONTRIBUTING.md
body: As discussed in meeting, adds a note about how to preview the changelog if you want it to help write the release announcement.

title: Let React LGV navigate without setting displayedRegion first
body:
Since navToLocString takes an optional assemblyName parameter now, we can avoid having to set a displayedRegion before navigating.

A similar thing could also possible be used in #1798.

title: Filter tracks does not filter out reference sequence track
Create v1.1.0.md, draft of release announcements

title: Standardized sentence casing on drawer widget titles
body:
This is a nitpicky change but I thought I would propose to use sentence casing on drawer titles

Seeing a list of items in the new select box makes it more obvious when we are not consistent

Note that "Add a track" and "Add a connection" are currently sentence case so this is more consistent with those examples

title: Changing color on wiggle density renderer produces a solid color
body:
Currently the code assumes any setting of "color" is a color callback basically for density renderer

Instead it assumes changes to posColor and negColor are used and creates a gradient between them

However, the menu item for "Set color" changes the color and is not a callback, making it a solid color

title: Fix fonts on @jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view storybook
body:
This issue brought up something with fonts on the react linear genome view

https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/discussions/1800

I think that the storybook shows we haven't fully figured out fonts for the react-linear-genome-view yet though

https://jbrowse.org/storybook/lgv/master/

we can see that fonts in

1)overview scale bar
2)svg feature labels
3)core feature details

these are all using a default font

is this a storybook issue or something more general? is it caused by #1763 ?

title: Remove some animation effects
body:
I sometimes get the sense that the drawer slide-in animations feels laggy

We can remove this animation, and to me, this produces the feeling of the app being faster and snappier. Note that we have a slide in but not a slide out currently so this basically just makes it more even also

Similar things can be done for the menu. Currently, it does a growing expansion that isn't necessarily that laggy but to me, it feels (and is) faster if the menu appears instantly

My operating system menus do not have any delay for example, so it feels more native

title: Clear tracks when using "Return to import form"
body:
Reported by https://github.com/li153348734 in the gitter chat, this is a small fix where the tracks remained after using "Return to import form" and changing assemblies but the tracks weren't cleared out https://files.gitter.im/5c59cb65d73408ce4fb6f58e/BIz5/image.png


I checked other options in the linear-genome-view state that might also need to be "cleared" but didn't see any. Any further update that might need clearing can go into "clearView"

title: Add ability to get promoter sequence and intron sequence for genes from the feature details panel
body:
This adds some more options to the sequence calculations in feature details

It can get 500bp up/downstream of the gene, and the intron sequence, or a "collapsed intron" with 10bp of the intron sequence around the splice site

![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json session=local-kxBDb9pU0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/111727694-c5570b80-8841-11eb-89b6-695b7b7a3379.png)


Things you'll note while observing this include that upstream and downstream are fetched in a separate request to the main, because I thought it was a little tricky to get the math right for fetching the sequence in one request with the possibility of hitting the start or end of chromosome boundaries, so I figured I would ensure the integrity of the fetch for the main gene body and then do the upstream/downstream separately

title: Add convenience function to load tracks in @jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view
body:
If you want to load tracks into your instance, it seems like you have to configure a defaultSession

It might be nice if your tracks parameter can be the full tracklist, and then activeTracks could be the tracks that are opened at the start


I might be missing something if this is already available in the docs

title: Move jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view storybook to lgv subdirectory
body:
This is a silly PR but it proposes moving the storybook generated to jbrowse.org/storybook/lgv/master instead of jbrowse.org/storybook/master

This allows us to use the same directory for other components if needed

Also makes it so that storybook is a supplementary link on the homepage

title: Check for existence of window more robustly to allow in SSR or node applications
body:
This is a tiny PR takes some of the logic out of #1125 that changes how `window` is used. This is to help with running JB2 in other contexts than the browser, where `window` might not be defined.

This is related to #1786 . I'm looking into how our React LGV works inside of a vanilla Next.js app, and have run into issues with `window` not being defined.

title: Try to help detect whether the species you selected in your assembly matches that from your PAF
body:
If you go through the PAF loading process, you may mismatch your species in column 1 or column 2, and the code then will display nothing.

The code could try to heuristically match the assembly refnames to the names in the PAF, and try to make sure the choice of the user aligns

Or it could "show the user the first couple rows of the file" and ask them to pick

It is hard, without literally looking at the file, to really tell and that isn't the best user experience

title: Grouped track autoscaling
body: It is very common to have a group of bigwig files, and to want them to all have the same y-scale. This feature has been requested in jbrowse 1 land here https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse/issues/254 and recently requested on https://sourceforge.net/p/gmod/mailman/message/37242475/

title: Add another heuristic for returning gene features from BigBed
body:
Currently the ClinVar CNV bigbed file classifies features as "mRNA" because it uses both thickStart and blockCount (just 1 block, but single exon genes also only have 1 block)

These are heuristics to classify the feature as an mRNA and convert to processed feature

There is nothing really that bad about this, but it tries to show the "CDS" sequence for this feature from #1758 

This adds another heuristic to also have strand not be 0 in order to convert a feature into a gene

It may not be perfect but it is hopefully keeps the current status quo

title: Update developer guide to cover displays, and highlight working external plugins
body:
This does not address anything about making factory functions because we have seen that it is unnecessary

In order to try to most accurately direct people to the right place, it puts currently working external plugin links  at the top

Then it also

1) Removes completely the "ring the bell" track type example. Although fun, I could not get it to work, and it was non-functional as written
2) Moves a specific internal codebase example to our CONTRIBUTING guide
3) Fixes a color callback example in jexl, and adds it to volvox just so we can see results easily

title: Add ability to add extra items to the region select dropdown via plugins
body:
Currently we have "zoom to region", and "get sequence"

May want to make it possible to add extras, use case for @shihabdider

title: Bump abortable-promise-cache
body: Used `yarn upgrade-interactive abortable-promise-cache` in the root of the repo

title: Open tracks from current view when launching a new breakpoint split view from feature details
body:
from grooming just now, idea from @cmdcolin, for the variant feature detail navigation link that opens a breakpoint split view:

It would be a fairly easy win to have that link open the same tracks in the new split view, as are open in the original LGV it came from.

Could also pop up a context menu on the link or a dialog box that gives people some options:

* open up tracks that are visible in the current view
* replace the view that you are currently looking at
* open the same tracks in the top and the bottom

Might also be relevant for the alignment nav links, to open a new view, or navigate the current view, etc

title: Transcript and gene glyphs can now display implied UTRs, active by default
body:
This is similar to jbrowse 1, but instead of having to manually configure impliedUTRs true in the config, this automatically turns on impliedUTRs if it thinks it is relevant. This has the effect of making it available by default on a feature of type transcript or mRNA that does not have UTR on it. NCBI GFF by default need impliedUTRs so it can help a broad class of users with this

before

title: Create backup for s3
body:
If we were to accidentally run aws sync --delete dir s3://jbrowse.org it may clear out our whole s3 bucket (I think...)


Possibly we can replicate the bucket, or we can turn on object versioning on the s3 bucket

https://www.cloudsavvyit.com/7782/how-to-backup-an-s3-bucket-and-why-youd-even-want-to/

Or we could decide to keep running as is, but this is may be dangerous to above commands

The disable_float setting for the docs pdf is helpful because otherwise figures can be placed very far away from the place that they are referenced

This adds this back to the github workflow

title: Allow MainThreadRpcDriver to skip serialization during RPC, improving main-thread rendering performance
body:
The main outcome of this PR is to enable MainThreadRpcDriver-rendered tracks to skip all the serialization and deserialization and render directly. Basically how this was accomplished is that the RPC methods now get the name of the RPC driver, and the RPC method can do different things based on which driver is used. Control over serialization and deserialization was also moved to RPC driver methods (out of the renderer).

There is a branch here that you can test where the web worker has been disabled, so everything is running on the main thread: https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/mainthread_ssr_disable_webworker/index.html

There are a lot of commits, but each one should be a self-contained change, so I'll briefly describe each of them here.

- ef76214
  This adds to the RPC top-level config to make individual drivers configurable. This will be necessary in some cases in future drivers to add e.g. server url. Existing configurations should still work. The config now has a "drivers" field, which by default has a main thread driver. Individual products are responsible for adding drivers and changing the default driver if they want (e.g. jbrowse-web adds a webworker driver config and changes the default to that)
- b4f963a
  This allows each display to define an RPC driver name, and if found the RPC manager will use that driver instead of the default for that display
- da28546
  Just adds a tiny bit of typescripting
- 4a59c92
  This adds the rpc driver class name as an argument to the RPC methods' `serializeArguments`, `deserializeArguments`, `serializeReturn`, `deserializeReturn`, and `execute` methods, so that the RPC methods may do different things based on which driver is in use
- 541dde3
  Removes a few unused ts-ignores
- 626e086
  Makes the the RPCMethodType abstract. It was already abstract in its usage, this just formalizes it.
- 173dd05
  Change the variable name `element` to `reactElement` when it is used by renderers
- e591555
  Probably the biggest change here, this factors a FeatureRenderer out of ServerSideRenderer. That way ServerSideRenderer only has logic for basic serialization/deserialization, and logic for things like fetching features are in FeatureRenderer. It also moves fetching of features to the `render` method instead of having it be part of deserialization, so that serialization/deserialization steps are kept pure and can be skipped. This also means that ComparativeServerSideRenderer now extends from ServerSideRenderer instead of the base RendererType, and does not have to duplicate some of its code, because it no longer conflicts with with feature fetching of ServerSideRenderer.
- ddca96e
  Make the models pass their filters as a serilizable filter chain instead of a serialized filter. This will allow them to be used even if the render args don't go through a serialize/deserialize step
- cba7c04
  Remove `cloneArgs` from main thread RPC, which was unused code. Also skip the filtering step since main thread RPC doesn't need to filter out non-clonable things.
- 0f5651f
  Since the layout isn't observable, things like `get blockLayouFeatures()` don't update if e.g. `layout.rectangles` updates. With server-side rendering, this wasn't noticed since the layout was already populated with rects when it got to the client side. In preparation for rendering without the server-side component, this change forces `get blockLayouFeatures()` to not cache its result the first time it's evaluated, when it may have no rects.
- 2ef14c8
  Moving layout generation to the `render` step instead of having it be part of deserialization allows the renderer to still work if the serialization and deserialization are skipped.
- a4e1dc5
  This moves the call of the renderer's `serializeArgsInClient` to the RPC coreRender method. This allows serialization to be different (or skipped) based on the RPC driver in use.
- f2ca495
  There appears to have been some duplication of how the context menu was handled, sometimes in the track and sometimes in the rendering. This removes it from the rendering, which didn't always work when using main thread RPC, and lets the track always handle it.
- e2e6374
  This uses all the setup from the previous commits to allow the coreRender RPC method to skip serialization/deserialization and call `render` on the renderer (instead of `renderInWorker`) when main thread RPC is used.

Fixes #1733
Fixes #1277

title: Add hic aborting and fix remoteAbort signal propagation
body:
This fixes a bug in the remoteAbort call where the signalId was not being passed at all (it was calling {...1} which is just {}, the signal wasn't given a name on the object)

Then it adds a couple points in the hic code where it checks the abort signal, using a timeout to yield to the webworker to process the abortsignal RPC calls

title: All connection tracks are stored in session
body:
Noted in #1723 

We could accept this as is... or figure out a way to not load the entire connection contents into the session

title: Hic track scrolling results in rerendering requests that arent aborted
body:
No aborting is done

Side scrolling, I see

rerender: 5474.264892578125 ms
rerender: 5376.658203125 ms
rerender: 5252.326904296875 ms
rerender: 5089.2138671875 ms
rerender: 5049.67919921875 ms
rerender: 5212.996826171875 ms

So it can take 30+ seconds to see your data after a sidescroll in hic

title: Bump elliptic from 6.5.3 to 6.5.4
body:
Bumps [elliptic](https://github.com/indutny/elliptic) from 6.5.3 to 6.5.4.
Commits
  • 43ac7f2 6.5.4
  • f4bc72b package: bump deps
  • 441b742 ec: validate that a point before deriving keys
  • e71b2d9 lib: relint using eslint
  • 8421a01 build(deps): bump elliptic from 6.4.1 to 6.5.3 (#231)
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=elliptic&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=6.5.3&new-version=6.5.4)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself.
