title: Collaborative release announcement editing
body: This PR makes the release.sh script take release blogpost drafts from `website/release_announcement_drafts` so that we can write them collaboratively with PRs before the release, to make sure everybody is happy with them.

title: Adds dropdown to show drawer widget stack
body:
Proposal for [Issue 536](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/536)

Adds Material UI Select dropdown to allow navigation between active widgets. 
Adds a minimize option to the widget drawer and maximize fab button when drawer is hidden to be able to quickly access the full JBrowse screen.

This is the final state of the changes.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45598764/111691566-b0e82400-87eb-11eb-826b-71f45b9bef17.mov

title: Quick fix for block error
body:
This is a quick fix for #1776 

Restores the try {} catch that existed previously in renderBlockData

title: Add integration test for block error
body:
If a block rendering error occurs

```
diff --git a/plugins/linear-genome-view/src/BaseLinearDisplay/models/serverSideRenderedBlock.ts b/plugins/linear-genome-view/src/BaseLinearDisplay/models/serverSideRenderedBlock.ts
index 79042b986..8a92c2bdf 100644
--- a/plugins/linear-genome-view/src/BaseLinearDisplay/models/serverSideRenderedBlock.ts
+++ b/plugins/linear-genome-view/src/BaseLinearDisplay/models/serverSideRenderedBlock.ts
@@ -202,6 +202,8 @@ function renderBlockData(self: Instance<BlockStateModel>) {
     )
   }

+  throw new Error('this is a failure that happens on any block render')
+


```

Then the error is not handled properly, it goes into renderBlockEffect with props undefined and gives an error on destructuring an undefined object

title: refName aliasing does not work if refName for assembly is not first in alias file
body:
I'll push a branch that has a config with an example of this, but basically if e.g. your FASTA uses `"1", "2", "3", …` and your aliases file looks like this:

```
chr1	1
chr2	2
chr3	3
…
```

aliasing won't work because the first entry on each line isn't the same as the assembly refName. This should work, though, since everything on a line should be equivalent.

title: Add warning dialog in LGV before returning to import form to prevent accidentally losing the current view
body:
Currently there is a "return to import form" helper on the linear genome view, however if it is used accidentally you can lose your current view

This adds a dialog prompt to check if you are sure

It creates a model state for tracking whether a dialog is open

title: "Get sequence" gives uninformative error with chromSizesAdapter
body:
If you try and use "Get sequence" on an LGV and the assembly's reference sequence track uses a chrom.sizes adapter, the error message isn't very informative: `TypeError: Cannot read property 'get' of undefined`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/110380884-f485a580-8015-11eb-933c-f04ffe063c4f.png)

https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/master/index.html?config=test_data%2Fconfig_honeybee.json&session=share-du5-ntUHXi&password=VDXoJ

We could try to disable that rubber band menu item if a chrom.sizes adapter is used, but that might not give the user enough feedback about why they can't get the sequence. In that case, maybe the get sequence dialog should have a message that explains that the adapter in use does not provide sequence information.

title: Reference sequence track errors out with chromSizesAdapter
body:
If you open a sequence track that uses a chrom.sizes adapter, you get an error in the track: `Error: CoreRender cannot handle this type of data adapter [object Object]`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/110380669-a8d2fc00-8015-11eb-92c0-a56fe004e2de.png)

https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/master/index.html?config=test_data%2Fconfig_honeybee.json&session=share-du5-ntUHXi&password=VDXoJ

I think the best way to handle this might be to disable the reference sequence track in the track selector if the adapter doesn't provide a sequence.

title: Overview polygon top edge does not cover elided regions
body:
If there are elided regions in the overview and the track area, the polygon covers the elided region in the track area but does not in the overview.

![Screenshot from 2021-03-08 13-33-58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/110378697-20535c00-8013-11eb-9746-6368b2dfe05c.png)

https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/master/index.html?session=share-6SJVg54Odk&password=UAVwy

title: 1469 storybook deploy
body:
This PR implements a deployment of our Storybook stories into a docs site for the embeddable LGV React component. (Closes #1469 )

After talking with @cmdcolin , this was designed to be built on each push for each branch. The current release tag will serve as the actual docs site that is linked to. One nice feature/use of this is that this will serve as a way to detect if any changes we are making are going to break the embeddable component while we develop.

Currently a draft, still working out:

- ~~The Github Actions workflow~~
- ~~Adding a link to the Storybook site from the docs~~

title: Synteny example config linear display not working
body:
In the Grape/Peach synteny config, the linear displays on the top view in the default session don't work:

https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/master/index.html?config=test_data%2Fconfig_synteny_grape_peach.json

Error in the console is: 

```
rpc-error 3 CoreRender TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
    at PileupRenderer.drawMismatches (PileupRenderer.ts:427)
    at PileupRenderer.ts:675
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at PileupRenderer.makeImageData (PileupRenderer.ts:666)
    at PileupRenderer.render (PileupRenderer.ts:698)
    at PileupRenderer.renderInWorker (ServerSideRendererType.ts:249)
    at async CoreRender.execute (coreRpcMethods.ts:181)
```

title: Adds navigation between stack of widgets in drawer
Use configRelationships to automatically launch evidence track when creating breakpoint split view from VCF details/SV inspector
body: This had been conceived as an idea for SV inspector before, but renewed energy for this...add the internal code and accessible UI/command line for this

title: Fix "Add track" workflow with local files on desktop and make a bit more testing of this widget
body:
The AddTrack MST refactor in #1414 introduced some bugs with local files from jbrowse-desktop

This fixes that issue and also creates some unit tests to help cover more cases

Issue did not affect any "releases" yet but a desktop user from Keiran Raine's collaboration found this issue on desktop

title: Add ability to have alternate codon tables
body:
This is sort of an apollo-ism but being able to specify an alternate codon table could be good for the sequence track and issue #1755 


Table of alternate genetic codes
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Taxonomy/Utils/wprintgc.cgi

title: Make sure the dotplot view creates views with interRegionPaddingWidth: 0 and minimumBlockWidth: 0
body: There might be a better way to make sure the derived Dotplot1DView sets these by default to 0, but currently any instantiation of Dotplot1DView should manually set these to 0

title: Add a "CSS reset" to jbrowse-react-linear-genome-view to prevent parent styles from outside the component leaking in
body:
Fixes #1678 

Uses a "CSS reset" on the div containing the jbrowse-react-linear-genome-view to avoid parent styles leaking into this component

Ref
https://css-tricks.com/almanac/properties/a/all/

title: Add requestidlecallback ponyfill in @jbrowse/core/util
body:
Added a really basic rIC ponyfill that performs setTimeout(cb,1) for @jbrowse/core/util, used it throughout the codebase where needed

The alternative I can think of is adding the requestidlecallback-polyfill to jbrowse-react-linear-genome-view specifically but probably just better to do this
https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/tree/ric_polyfill

For compatibility with Safari mostly

Fixes #1659

title: Adjust rpcSessionId to use the config ID instead of instance ID, saved on bandwidth when same track used in multiple views
body: Fixes #1712

title: Add warning for JSON session if it contains callbacks
body: Fixes #1757

title: Add length limit on error message from session loading
body: Simple approach to fix #1749...chop the error message length at 1000 chars which is pretty sizeable length but shouldn't overflow the screen

title: Add ability to get stitched together CDS, protein, and cDNA sequences in feature details
body:
Requested by #1755 

Example screenshot:

![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fconfig json session=local-Jn6bNBkPk](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/109877419-3be3ee80-7c30-11eb-818b-40c020074f9a.png)

There are more things that could be done including getting promoter/intron sequences (add +/- some user-configurable number of bases) around the region, but I think this is possibly a good start

title: JSON sessions in the URL need a security dialog
body: JSON sessions in the URL, which came in from #1669, is another XSS vector that will need a security dialog if we include it in 1.0.4

title: Split alignments track menu items into "Pileup" and "SNPCoverage" submenus
body:
This was sort of inspired by #1754 but does not fix it

I split the long list of track menu items for the combined snpcov+pileup alignments track into submenus, one for pileup, one for snpcoverage options

It also added a custom getter called "extraTrackMenuItems" instead of overriding composedTrackMenuItems in the SNPCoverageDisplay model because it was not possible to properly override composedTrackMenuItems and preserve the wiggle options

![localhost_3001__config=test_data%2Fvolvox%2Fconfig json session=local-QB2XB3ssB (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/109737437-4dbb8800-7b83-11eb-91ad-5328ee998b14.png)

title: Coding sequences as attribute / subfeature for gff / tbi tracks
body: Hi - I am using JBrowse2 for a collaborative project and have uploaded tabix-indexed GFF files via add-track. My collaborators would like to be able to click on a gene model and copy / download the mRNA / CDS sequences from JBrowse2 like they can for sequences from aligned RNAseq bam files. Is this a feature already in JBrowse2 and if so - what do I need to do to enable it? If not - I think this would be a valuable feature to add moving forward.

title: No track menu options when changing alignments display to LinearPileupDisplay
body:
Screenshot showing this

![Screenshot from 2021-03-01 14-05-57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/109559066-75352680-7a97-11eb-8fe9-b026bab7955e.png)

title: Rename LinearBasicDisplay->LinearBareDisplay and LinearFeatureDisplay->LinearBasicDisplay
body:
Proposal to fix #1752

The changes in #1394 created a LinearFeatureDisplay that was the default for FeatureTrack, which subsumed the LinearBasicDisplay which was the default for FeatureTrack

However, this created #1752 

This renames LinearFeatureDisplay to LinearBasicDisplay to make the transition between pre-#1752 and post-#1752 as seamless as possible

title: Updates to FeatureTrack/LinearFeatureDisplay can make some session links fail
body:
The changes in #1394 can cause some session links that previously worked to fail now

Fails to load
https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/master/index.html?config=https%3A%2F%2Funpkg.com%2Fjbrowse-plugin-ucsc%2Fdist%2Fconfig.json&session=share-wyY8ZgC9uY&password=CtcMX

Working
https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/v1.0.3/index.html?config=https%3A%2F%2Funpkg.com%2Fjbrowse-plugin-ucsc%2Fdist%2Fconfig.json&session=share-wyY8ZgC9uY&password=CtcMX

title: Make the variant display derive from the feature display
body:
This proposes to make the LinearVariantDisplay derive from the LinearFeatureDisplay

This gives it the ability to hide feature labels via the track menu, and other similar things


The current version has the ability to choose PileupRenderer as its renderer but I think this is probably unneeded

title: Fix pileup sorting when using string tag
body:
Currently if someone tries to sort based on a string tag, it fails to sort

This tries to determine upfront whether a tag is of type string (looks at first element)

Then it sorts using localeCompare to sort the strings

title: If session could not be loaded warning is very long, the notify takes up the whole screen with no way to exit
body:
This may be a bug with all session.notify.
Ran into this issue during this catch where the error message is very long:
```
 catch (err) {
                console.error(err)
                rootModel.setDefaultSession()
                const errorMessage = (err.message || '')
                  .replace('[mobx-state-tree] ', '')
                  .replace(/\(.+/, '')
                rootModel.session?.notify(
                  `Session could not be loaded. ${errorMessage}`,
                )
```

Screen ends up looking like: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22454194/109372416-4718d200-785e-11eb-917f-9efc6d37f1f5.png) with no way to close the notify

If I comment out the session.notify line, I can see the default session

title: External plugins load after confirming config warning
body:
This closes #1692, now the config warning modal holds off fetchPlugins until after the user confirms that they trust the source, so external plugins get loaded after. Cancel resets to default configuration (same logic as onFactoryReset)

Making as draft for now because not too sure how to handle the cancel case. Assuming they do not want to load the cross origin config, will have to atleast clear the config in the URL and in the configPath and set it to the default config (config.json). If clearing the config, may have to clear the session since that session may have info recorded using the previous config (such as confirming, loading a view, and then refresh and not confirming/cancel the second time).

title: Fix the position of the popup menu after rubberband select when there is a margin on the component e.g. in embedded
body:
Currently the embedded mode, most clearly, can have an example where the "Zoom to region" menu after a rubberband selection is shown in the wrong place

To properly place the menu using anchorPosition it should use left: event.clientX, top: event.clientY from the mouseup event (these are screen coordinates instead of offset to any particular element)

Found while looking at the storybook :)

title: Flaky test on LGV
Config for labels and color not working in LinearFeatureDisplay
body:
Demo link: https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/master/index.html?config=test_data%2Fvolvox%2Fconfig.json&session=share-GC7Dxi6Huf&password=8Lr20

There are two session tracks in that session, and changing the feature color, label name, label color, etc. in the config editor widget doesn't change them in the displays. Changing other configs, like the mouseover text or displayMode, however, does work.

title: Breakpoint split view doesn't work with React.StrictMode
body:
We don't use React.StrictMode but it could be helpful in rooting out issues in our code

The breakpoint split view does not work with React.StrictMode on though

http://localhost:3000/?config=test_data%2Fbreakpoint%2Fconfig.json&session=share-e-pgwB8bcQ&password=hYC4s


```
diff --git a/products/jbrowse-web/src/index.tsx b/products/jbrowse-web/src/index.tsx
index 663f5036f..0407d4a0e 100644
--- a/products/jbrowse-web/src/index.tsx
+++ b/products/jbrowse-web/src/index.tsx
@@ -8,8 +8,10 @@ serviceWorker.register()
 const Main = lazy(() => import('./Loader'))
 const initialTimeStamp = Date.now()
 ReactDOM.render(
-  <Suspense fallback={<Loading />}>
-    <Main initialTimestamp={initialTimeStamp} />
-  </Suspense>,
+  <React.StrictMode>
+    <Suspense fallback={<Loading />}>
+      <Main initialTimestamp={initialTimeStamp} />
+    </Suspense>
+  </React.StrictMode>,
   document.getElementById('root'),
 )


```

Rest of the app seems to work ok though


May not be a priority but thought it could be worth noting

title: Add color picker and choice of summary score style for wiggle track
body:
This adds a simple color picker for the wiggle track

This is almost going too far in a way, and I believe is starting to call into question the duplication of config items into state

I believe the user experience of having to clone a track and use our config editor is not ideal, and I think the track state and track menu helps, but it is causing duplication of code.

However, I also see that the continued use of track state as a way to open up a new opportunity: it offers a conceptually nice way to get config layers:I can simply say something like

    // using concept from @teresam856 for top level config
    getConf(getSession(self).WigglePluginSettings, 'someSetting')

Then I can get a "global setting" to apply to all my wiggle tracks a la config layers. This would be otherwise difficult to setup on every individual wiggle track

So there are tradeoffs here, but open to ideas.

Note that other track types like FeatureTrack could enjoy a color picker also

title: Add ability to display crosshatches on the wiggle line/xyplot renderer
body:
Adds a setting to display crosshatches, editable via the track menu for wiggle tracks. Moves the "ticks" concept into the model so the renderer can use the ticks

![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fvolvox%2Fconfig json session=local-4zNuYPPf-](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/109115702-ad85df00-76fc-11eb-87a5-9d399a1ff4e5.png)

title: Instrument navToLocString tests in the LGV and fix refname navigation
body:
This tries to instrument some simple navToLocString tests for the LGV for easier testing of corner cases

There is likely more that can be done to ensure reliability but I hope these tests could be a starting point for simulating end-user behavior of using locstring inputs


Fixes #1740

title: Using locstring navigation with refName navigates to very start of chromosome
body:
Using the locstring navigation to go to a new chromosome e.g. 2 ends up going to 2:1-19 instead of showing the entirety of chr2

Git bisect says this was caused by https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/1719

title: Fix some long read tracks not getting features properly (bump @gmod/cram version)
body:
Linked to https://github.com/GMOD/cram-js/pull/85

Fixes https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/1654

title: Fix CLI add-track --load inPlace to put exact contents into the config, add better CLI example docs
body:
This fixes the usage of --inPlace tag to put the exact config without using file.basename(filename) into the config

It also adds some "helpful comments" above each example usage to try to explain what happens in each use case

title: Test having 1000 assemblies
body:
Testing an instance with many assemblies, just an arbitrarily large number like 1000, will likely reveal some issues at bootup time because we wait for all assemblies to be loaded to do many operations


One motivation for this is due to supporting navigation and loading refnames is required to do navigation, however (a) a user should be able to select a specific assembly and that should not require loading all assemblies and (b) a name store could store chromosome names if needed to search globally across assemblies

title: Allow using color encoded in an attribute
body:
The itemRgb/reserved field in bigbed is an example

It would be nice to have this functionality baked in for some cases, since it is difficult to make a color callback to properly express this. 

Note that BAM also has this, and is not currently supported by our color by tag system (example YC:Z:255,0,0)

title: Proposal: make SSR in LGV optional
body:
Currently the blocks in the LGV displays use the model in `serverSideRenderedBlock.ts`. This calls `rendererType.renderInClient`, which means the renderer has to be based on `ServerSideRendererType.ts` (i.e. it can't just be the base RendererType).

I propose making it so that the blocks could use an SSR renderer or a regular renderer, based on a setting (probably in the display).

My motivation for this was in developing the Apollo plugin and talking with @rbuels, it would be nice to have an Apollo Renderer based on our BoxRendererType, but that doesn't use SSR.

I did a basic hack to show that it's possible, and it seems to work ok. I only did it for Pileup and SVG tracks. These links are to live demos. Each one has the same display twice, with current (SSR) rendering on top and new (non-SSR) rendering on bottom.

https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/gs_ssr_test/index.html?config=test_data%2Fvolvox%2Fconfig.json&session=share-_IKMrS2zA%2F&password=PwbMo

https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/gs_ssr_test/index.html?config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo.json&session=share-vzK6oWbwKI&password=itPQN

https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/gs_ssr_test/index.html?config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo.json&session=share-Bmtu2FtROP&password=Mysls

title: Wrong URI while adding GFF track
Fix alignment track ability to remember the height of the SNPCoverage subtrack on refresh
body:
Currently changing the snpcov subtrack height is not remembered on refresh

This fixes that. There is an old useEffect thing that was hacky that was causing reset to height:45 along with a couple other things

The autorun that propagates state from alignments display model to the SNPCoverage display model is kind of awkward and could be evaluated, but this fixes the particular issue of setting the subtrack height in track state

title: Changing track height with click and drag rapidly produces re-rendering requests
body: Should probably throttle this somehow

title: Add sessionAssemblies to jbrowse-desktop for use in linear read-vs-ref comparisons
body: Fixes #1726

title: Add list of loaded plugins to the "About widget"
body: Slightly tweaked approach to #1715. Instead of making the plugin manager know that some plugins are "core" and others are not, adds a more general plugin metadata area (optional) that can hold anything, and has the about widget and the jbrowse-web loader set an `isCore` boolean in that.

title: Upgrade mobx, mobx-react, mobx-state-tree to latest versions
body:
This bumps mobx, mobx-react, and mobx-state-tree in the ecosystem. Updates all the peerDependencies in the plugins, although technically, since they all "just work" could be made to say e.g. "mobx-state-tree":">=3.14.1"

The `getParent` calls are turned into explicit templated `getParent<any>` because the return type of getParent was changed to type unknown in recent releases and it would take a lot of work to handle that correctly

Fixes #1277

title: Fix linear read vs ref comparison in jbrowse desktop
body: Uses session assemblies which are not on the desktop sessionModelFactory

title: JBrowseR release
body:
This PR:

- Adds a blog post introducing JBrowseR
- Adds a link to JBrowseR from the embedded links list of our site

title: A few bugfixes
body: These are just a few bugfixes I've run into that didn't really fit in any particular PR

title: Adjust position of the SNPCoverage indicators to be slightly higher
body:
The original code for adding the YSCALEBAR_LABEL_OFFSET  helped make sure that the labels on the Y-scale bar get drawn, but it had the effect of losing some space that could be used to draw the indicators on the SNPCov. This allows drawing the indicators in the region where the yscalebar was

This is a gif shows the effect
![out](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/108608522-a5d4dc00-7384-11eb-845d-3a835ee5aa43.gif)

title: Manually adjust feature height and spacing on alignments track
body:
This allows both manually adjusting feature height and spacing between features via toggling pitchY to 1 using a track setting

Example

![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json session=local-mn0hpkxC9](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/108590842-d126df00-7322-11eb-9273-a6fab2412e9f.png)

For #1693

title: Standardize phred qual scaling between BAM and CRAM and add option to make mismatches render in a lighter color when quality is low
body:
This adds

(a) a new coloring option "Adjust mismatch visibility by quality" that helps adjust the coloring of SNPs by their qual score
(b) standardize the qual score across BAM and CRAM. the CRAM was adding +33 which is basically what is done to report proper ASCII characters for scores, but to be standardized we skip adding +33

title: Fix for navigation past end of chromosome
body:
Fixes #1718


This adds a redundancy that avoids an all out crash, and then fixes the navigation so it clamps to the end of the newly navigating displayed region


This is just a general observation but our logic for navigating is fairly complex...I think it is likely that a refactoring probably along the time that name indexing comes around is likely in order

title: move feature selection from display models to track models
body:
Right now display models have `selectFeature` actions, and they decide to open feature detail widgets or not. That logic probably belongs in track MST models instead.

## previous general thoughts

There are some things in the MST models for displays that probably need to move upward in the hierarchy to live in the track models, since they are more related to the behavior of how to interact with the data itself, rather than how to interact with a specific display.

 Example: when a feature is selected, the display is currently making the decision to open a feature details widget, but that seems like it would be more appropriate to be in the track.

Also, composedTrackMenuItems probably belongs in the track.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73749/108562048-1c55d900-72b4-11eb-9234-4f2aeb01eceb.png)

title: Stringify labels before adding to rendering to avoid undefineds on label.length
body: In UCSC plugin, the feature label was being set to a numeric field. I thought I could shore up what was happening there but I think it is better to stringify the labels at time of use since a user could user-select their own label field via configuration that could result in the same issue

title: Add list of loaded plugins to the "About widget"
body:
This adds a list of currently loaded plugins and their version if available

It also tries to distinguish between corePlugins and non-core plugins which is somewhat awkward, and it could potentially even hide core plugins but currently separates them out

title: Fix ability to add a PAF on initial dotplot view creation
body:
The Dotplot ImportForm ability to add a PAF file was broken because it was referring to DotplotTrack but this was renamed SyntenyTrack

I wanted to make sure this process of importing a PAF file this way was tested so I added a full integration test with @teresam856 

This does sprinkle some more data-testid throughout the code but it should help make sure this feature stays functional

title: Add console.error log in block setError
body:
https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/compare/better_console_warn?w=1

This is minor but there are some cases where if an issue arises a console.error with the exception is not printed, which makes it difficult to debug. This adds a console.error in setError

It also makes it unnecessary to do try/catch in the serverSideRenderedBlock->renderBlockData

See whitespace-ignored-diff here https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/compare/better_console_warn?w=1

Possibly some error messages could get duplicate printed by this but hopefully better than none, and more reliable than sprinkling errors everywhere

The alternative is sprinkling console.error closer to the source e.g. could do it in the catch handler of makeAbortableReaction but that is a little presumptive

title: Breakpoint split view uses two different webworkers for top and bottom view
body:
Current usage of breakpoint split view uses two webworkers for the top and bottom track, which results in it downloading the entire BAM index twice

My original hope for this would have been to use adapter fingerprint to avoid this but currently it uses track id

If this is simply unavoidable, we can close but this does result in longer wait times

title: Bold insertion indicator for large insertions on pileup track
body:
Sort of tangential but related goals to elucidating insertions as #1687 

Adds similar insertion indicator seen in igv

Ref fig S2 https://static-content.springer.com/esm/art%3A10.1186%2Fs13059-020-02107-y/MediaObjects/13059_2020_2107_MOESM1_ESM.docx from https://genomebiology.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13059-020-02107-y#Sec22

![Screenshot from 2021-02-10 20-44-22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/107600357-cb255580-6be0-11eb-9464-c0759857f6dd.png)
The insertion signal for the 6000bp insertion is dispersed by complicated mapping, but can be pieced together from the large numbers

I arbitrarily thresholded it so that len<10 it draws line indicator, and larger than than it makes the bold indicator which draws it as wide as needed to accommodate the number

title: Threshold for indicators on SNPCoverage + inverted bargraph of interbase counts for sub-threshold events
body:
Current code for drawing the insertion draws an indicator if there is even 1 insertion, which can make too many insertion indicators for long noisy reads especially

This adds a threshold based on this so that at least 30% of reads by default would share the indicator. This filters out many false positives I think

In addition to drawing the indicator, I added a "upside down histogram" of the interbase info such as clip/insertion. The upside-down nature emphasizes that these do not contribute to the count in the pileup. This captures things below 30%, and that is especially handy when there is a "region" that has a lot of clipping or the insertion has a fuzzy position by the aligner, which I think is biologically a real phenomenon (see cuteSV paper for how they call fuzzy insertion positions)

Sort of xref #1065 

![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fvolvox%2Fconfig json session=local-zG1O8Um2E (6)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/107599934-746b4c00-6bdf-11eb-91fc-84568987b40b.png)

two examples from volvox

example from human, sometimes there are tiny things that can catch your eye that stand out more than background but might not trigger the "indicatorThreshold"

note that the settings for "drawIndicators" and "drawInterbaseFuzz" are configurable booleans, and could be made track menu items

title: session plugins

This obviously brings up security concerns, the draft plan for that would be to allow only plugins that are in the central plugin store to be loaded in sessions.

title: Change callbacks language from JavaScript to Jexl
body:
Implements Jexl for callbacks over using new Function syntax to create functions

Jexl repo here for reference: https://github.com/TomFrost/Jexl
In core/util/jexl.ts, a new jexl instance is created and core functions/transforms are added. getData does all of the old function(feature) { feature.get(something) } callbacks, getId gets feature.id()

Other files such as configurationSlot, functionStrings, and SlotEditor are changed to fit the new jexl syntax. Callbacks must now be written in jexl format, either by using the UI track settings editor or in a config file. In config file you must add the jexl: tag to make it a jexl callback, in the ui editor when toggled to callback mode you can write the callback without the jexl tag, one will be pre-pended after.

I.e jexl:feature|getData('name') in config, feature|getData('name') in UI

title: Fix issue with using launching the add track widget on views that are not displaying any regions
body:
Alternative Proposal to [pull request 1676](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/1676) to fix bug [1674](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/1674)
Jbrowse web currently crashes when we click File -> Open Track while an import form is being rendered due to 

This PR
- Adds error handling when retrieving assemblyName from displayedRegions in the addTrackWidget model.ts. Not all views have displayedRegions @ session.views[0] (e.g synteny which has them @ session.views[0].views) which causes 'TypeError: Cannot read property 'assemblyName' of undefined'. DisplayedRegions can also be undefined when opening a view (import form) but displayedRegions are still yet to be defined which will throw the same error. 

- Small test in CircularView. Tests being able to click `Open Track` from circular view set up wizard without crashing Jbrowse web.

body:

![localhost_3001_](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/107415551-bd80aa80-6ad0-11eb-933f-072b313aa5af.png)


Kind of a weird case, possibly a css-reset could help

I never know what those really do, but we could possibly recommend this to users to use one or automatically use one in the distribution

title: Config guide updates
body:
Some updates to the config guide in our docs:

1. Update `WiggleTrack` -> `QuantitativeTrack` to update the name change since the addition of displayTypes
2. Add an "Advanced adapters" section which covers the `FromConfigAdapter` and `FromConfigSequenceAdapter`, and an example of how they might be useful. (Closes #1638 )

title: Fix ability to use open track widget when import form open
body:
Proposal to fix bug [1674](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/1674)
Jbrowse web currently crashes when we click File -> Open Track while an import form is being rendered due to 

This PR
- Removes retrieving assemblyName from displayedRegions in the addTrackWidget model.ts. Not all views have displayedRegions @ session.views[0] (e.g synteny which has them @ session.views[0].views) which causes 'TypeError: Cannot read property 'assemblyName' of undefined'. DisplayedRegions can also be undefined when opening a view (import form) but displayedRegions are still yet to be defined which will throw the same error. 

- Small test in CircularView. Tests being able to click `Open Track` from circular view set up wizard without crashing Jbrowse web.

Can remove utilizing the  `self.view.displayedRegions[0].assemblyName` in the addTrackWidget `get assembly()` or maybe add more options for retrieving the assemblyName.

title: Jbrowse Web crashes when clicking menu item "Open Track" while import form is rendered
body: **Describe the bug** Jbrowse-web crashes when you click File -> open track while you are at the import form of a view. **To Reproduce** 1. Go to Human Basic 2. Go to a view (Either LGV, Structural Variant Inspector, Linear Synteny) 3. while the import form is open, click on File -> open Track 4. See error: 'TypeError: Cannot read property 'assemblyName' of undefined' **Expected behavior** ~Disable Open Track, wait until an assembly is defined, or~ account for error in err handling. **Screenshots** **Version:** **Additional context** It could be getting resolved by #1672, but will still make a note to document issue.

title: Correct the name of package
Fix import forms crashing if there are no assemblies
body:
This is perhaps an obscure thing but it is possible to create a jbrowse instance with no assemblies loaded, and some non-genome-browsing things like MSA have a config like this

Some of the ImportForm had an incorrect use of setError causing infinite renders

Adds a small test...gotta exercise those unit testing muscles

title: Add ability to refer to named callbacks or named jexl functions to config
body:
Ability to edit function callbacks directly into the config will be disabled after jexl (AFAIK) and so we will maybe try to allow referring to named functions that are coded as for example a functions.js file that admins can setup and which is included by script tag or loadScript type method


This will help admins who create complex callbacks for coloring, etc.

title: typo in developer guide docs
body: https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/developer_guide/#adding-a-top-level-menu

title: Allow plain json encoding of the session in the URL
Fix global autoscale selection in linearwiggledisplay
body:
This fixes the use of the global autoscaling selection in #1664 

Static parameters can't be accessed on a instance of the object e.g. can't use  `instance.staticField`, but can use  `instance.constructor.staticField`


For some reason this issue has only existed after the merger of #1629 but the MDN as Garrett found out explains this https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Classes/static#using_static_members_in_classes

title: Fix session sharing when using cross origin config
body:
Currently if a session is shared with a cross origin config, it produces a warning about that but then fails to load the requested session

The session loading needs the config to be loaded first, so it needs to wait for the config to be "untriaged" using the wording of the PR

This PR adds an autorun so when we get the config is untriaged, then processes the session

Only exists sense the merger of #1632

title: Move "mouseover" config from BaseLinearDisplay to LinearBasicDisplay display
body: This is a proposal to move the "mouseover" config slot from the BaseLinearDisplay to LinearBasicDisplay. There are some displays, like LinearWiggleDisplay, that extend from the config of BaseLinearDisplay but don't have the same concept of mouseover. This way those types of displays don't have a "mouseover" slot in the config editor that doesn't do anything.

title: Add Nextstrain COVID storybook

This PR adds:

1. A test data file with some Nextstrain COVID data:

- an assembly config with the sequence
- tracks config with the gene map and entropy score (from Nextstrain diversity panel)
- a default session with these tracks loaded

2. A Storybook story to to the React linear genome view using the new data.

This should provide another good example of the embedded view, and might make further development on #1616 easier. Also could be useful for working on #1635 @teresam856

title: Make LGV "initialized" not depend on displayedRegions
body: This is an alternate approach to https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/1651. This means that `initialized` means that the width is set and the assemblies are ready, and if you want to know about displayedRegions, you have to check for it separately. Adds a `hasDisplayedRegions` view for convenience to do that.

title: Use itemRgb/reserved for feature color
body:
BigBed tracks often contain an encoded itemRgb or reserved field that contains rgb color. Note that sometimes this exists on a parent feature so parent feature is checked too.

We could enable rendering this by default in our SvgFeatureRenderer color callback

![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json session=local-vGn3hp2jX](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/106670299-18af1c00-656a-11eb-99fc-39a6f0fcf38e.png)

They aren't great about documenting the legend unless one goes to the UCSC page of interest, but it could help some cases and provide more rich visualization(e.g. the CNV is apparently blue for loss, red for gain https://genome.ucsc.edu/cgi-bin/hgTrackUi?db=hg38&g=iscaComposite) 

Enabling this by default makes it easier for any end user using the system to not have to make any custom code for this

Also deletes chromStart,chromEnd,chrom from feature details because those display 0 based coords when we want to display 1 based, and are basically duplicate attributes.

title: "Localstorage quota exceeded" errors are difficult to recover from
body:
Currently the saved sessions/autosaves can exceed quota for the localstorage, and recovering from this involves manually clearing out localstorage

They are also fatal and crash the app

![localhost_3000__config=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A9000%2Fconfig json session=local-m1yYGpByZ](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/106658524-a551de00-655a-11eb-8f56-ee433fde4eb0.png)

title: Allow connections to have multiple assemblies
body:
Previously, assemblies were only allowed to provide tracks for a single assembly. This removes that limitation. This means that there is no way to know if a connection that is turned off which assemblies it has tracks for, so all connections now show up in the track selector for every assembly. If you turn on a connection and it does not have any tracks for the assembly you currently have in your LGV, you get a message (this is on an hg19 LGV):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/106652321-851e2100-6552-11eb-81f2-b0231fd2a4ec.png)

    in Layout (at [gene].tsx:146)
    in Gene (at _app.tsx:8)
    in MyApp
    in ErrorBoundary (created by ReactDevOverlay)
    in ReactDevOverlay (created by Container)
    in Container (created by AppContainer)
    in AppContainer
    in Root
```

<!-- Put a clear and concise description of the bug here. -->

**To Reproduce**

Open a page with @jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view in Safari.
If the bug doesn't occur, it's maybe an error from my assembly/tracks/defaultSession config which is below.

For the files used, they are in this [archive](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/files/5911164/issue-github.tar.gz).

Assembly:
```json
    {
        "name": "ASM15095v2",
        "sequence": {
            "type": "ReferenceSequenceTrack",
            "trackId": "ASM15095v2-ReferenceSequenceTrack",
            "adapter": {
                "type": "BgzipFastaAdapter",
                "fastaLocation": {
                    "uri": "http://localhost:8000/Phaeodactylum_tricornutum.ASM15095v2.dna.toplevel.fa.gz",
                },
                "faiLocation": {
                    "uri": "http://localhost:8000/Phaeodactylum_tricornutum.ASM15095v2.dna.toplevel.fa.gz.fai",
                },
                "gziLocation": {
                    "uri": "http://localhost:8000/Phaeodactylum_tricornutum.ASM15095v2.dna.toplevel.fa.gz.gzi",
                },
            },
        },
    }
```

Tracks:
```json
[
        {
            "type": "FeatureTrack",
            "trackId": "ASM15095v2-genes",
            "name": "Phatr3 gene models (Ensembl)",
            "category": ["  Genes"],
            "assemblyNames": ["ASM15095v2"],
            "adapter": {
                "type": "Gff3TabixAdapter",
                "gffGzLocation": {
                    "uri": "http://localhost:8000/Phaeodactylum_tricornutum_sort.ASM15095v2.48.gff3.gz",
                },
                "index": {
                    "location": {
                        "uri": "http://localhost:8000/Phaeodactylum_tricornutum_sort.ASM15095v2.48.gff3.gz.tbi",
                    },
                    "indexType": "TBI",
                },
            },
            "renderer": {
                "type": "SvgFeatureRenderer",
            },
        },
    ]
```

DefaultSession:
```js

  name: "My session",
  view: {
    id: "linearGenomeView",
    type: "LinearGenomeView",
    tracks: [
      {
        type: "ReferenceSequenceTrack",

title: Improve typescript for mobx-state-tree reexports
Fix for track using assembly alias not displaying
body:
Found this as part of other work, but am submitting it separately since it's a self-contained bug fix.

In the case where e.g. as assembly had a `name` of `"hg19"` and `aliases` of `["GRCh37"]`, if a track configuration used `"assemblyNames": ["GRCh37"]`, the track would not show up in the track selector, even though it was using a valid assembly alias.

Fixing that then revealed that the track would not display in the LinearGenomeView because the check comparing the track and displayedRegion assembly names was not being performed properly.

Fixes both bugs and adds a test to confirm the proper behavior.

title: Proposal: move less-used core plugins to external plugins
body:
Some of our core plugins that were developed before the external plugin architecture was fully developed might fit better as external plugins. The purpose of moving them would be to keep the core plugins code smaller and more focused, and to not include seldom-used plugins in the JBrowse Web/Desktop default builds. In particular I was thinking of:

- Trackhub registry API plugin
- RDF plugin

Other plugins that could also perhaps be moved:

- Filtering plugin
- Lollipop plugin
- Protein plugin

title: Add GFF3Tabix and BEDTabix inference to JB1 connection
body: Since JBrowse 2 has GFF3Tabix and BEDTabix adapters now, this adds the ability to the JBrowse 1 connection to guess those adapters based on the JBrowse 1 storeClass.

title: Long read CRAM track produces bad layout in certain case
body:
This is a random thing I stumbled on using minion cram data

There is something weird going on here where the SNPCoverage track is populated but the PileupTrack is not, and apparently for the CRAM track only. Scrolling around in this area I also saw a populated layout with onhover mouse over shadows, but when clicked, it have an error with feature.toJSON being called on undefined feature

title: Alignments tracks can timeout their rpc operation too soon
body: Seen timing out after ~90s in mailing list and benchmark tests

title: Support plugins using material-ui/icons >= 4.11.2
body:
There was a change in how material-ui exports its icons between 4.9.1 and 4.11.2. This adds one more special case name to the re-exports that allows plugins to bundle material-ui/icons using the new versions. Also works with the most recent beta of material-ui 5 (5.0.0-alpha.24).

xref https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-plugin-msaview/issues/6

title: Wait for initialization when setting display
body: This fixes a bug in the LGV that I encountered during #1616 . If `setDisplayRegion` before the view is initialized, the region doesn't actually get set. Adding the mobX get ensures that `zoomTo` will be successful.

title: Fix YSCALEBAR_LABEL_OFFSET usage for SnpCoverageRenderer
body:
Fixes #1648 

The code used "padding" as the variable which increased paddingLeft and paddingRight. Just wanted paddingTop and paddingBottom though. We could perhaps say that the use of padding is a bit awkward here but it does the trick

This PR also makes sure that the renderProps for SNPCoverageRenderer gets the right height also that takes into account YSCALEBAR_LABEL_OFFSET, and increases the height of the SNPCov slightly since some pixels are lost due to this padding (40->45px tall. also tried 40->50px but that causes more ticks to show up which is a little busy)

title: Add option for configs to be ephemeral
body:
This is a draft PR for config schemas that are "ephemeral", i.e. they get omitted when a snapshot is made of the jbrowse config. This was discussed as a possible approach toward making #1444 possible. This way, configs can be added that will never be written to disk in admin mode, so e.g. a connection can write assembly configs that don't persist, so they are restored from the connection each time they are used.

If this approach is acceptable, this will need some tests added.

title: "See code" in documentation links to missing github page

The image captions in the CLI docs page [https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/cli](https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/cli) link to a GitHub page that no longer exists. Clicking on the link returns a 404 error. 

**To Reproduce**
1. Go to [https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/cli](https://jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/cli#jbrowse-add-connection-connectionurlorpath) 
2. Click on _See code: src/commands/add-assembly.ts_
3. See Github's 404 page in the new tab.

**Expected behavior**

The documentation links should open GitHub in a new tab and show its specified file in the master branch.

body:
Right now, if you click on elements on an alignments track, it opens an info panel. Would it be worth adding to ability to trigger actions based on clicking on things on a QuantitativeTrack? Right now, there is a MUI info panel when you hover over it, but no behavior on click.

This would be necessary for full feature parity with the Nextstrain diversity panel. (#1616 )

When you click on one of the bars for the entropy score, it changes state that other parts of the app are observing and responding to:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/105788253-f9ded300-5f34-11eb-9240-44adf6fa71d2.png)

**Caveat:** I'm not totally sure what ways this would be used outside of the Nextstrain demo.

title: Autogenerate GC content track for refseq
body:
It seems like it would be useful to automatically create a GC content for a reference sequence

I thought perhaps we could synthesize one automatically, but this might be difficult. Actually showTrack doesn't like auto-generated track configs that aren't actually part of the tree because it uses resolveIdentifier


My thinking alternatively is instead of auto-generating it is we could add a convenience function to the CLI, either add-assembly or add-track, that automatically makes a GC content track

title: Get column names from BED tabix files and other utils for external jbrowse-plugin-gwas support
body:
This adds a "linear manhattan plot display"

Also makes it so that stats are available on the base adapter, so that means that all the different adapters types that use some basic stats (which includes, SNPCoverageAdapter, BigWigAdapter, GCCoverageAdapter (#1624), and now BEDTabix for manhattan plot) all don't have to individually implement stats

This is similar to jbrowse 1 where the base seqfeature store has a local stats operation

Then it also adds ability for BedTabixAdapter to choose it's "score column" and read column names from the header of the bedtabix file if available

This allows us to choose the column named "neg_log_pvalue" in the summary_stats.txt.gz file as the score that is plotted with the manhattan plot from a tabix file prepared from summary_stats.txt.gz from here https://my.locuszoom.org/gwas/236887/ 

![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json session=local-ioGQhLLNk (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/105399279-a2610000-5be0-11eb-81a6-acfe35aef9b1.png)
![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json session=local-ioGQhLLNk](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/105399281-a2610000-5be0-11eb-8149-0a363428e224.png)


Can display whole-genome-wide results and local results

title: Add RegionsAdapter/SequenceAdapter, reorganize base adapters
body:
I was making a new sequence adapter, and realized that even if it only provided a list of regions and no sequence (like the `ChromSizesAdapter` does), there still had to be a `getFeatures()` that does nothing. This change makes it so that there is now a `BaseAdapter` class, which is extended by the `BaseFeatureDataAdapter` class (has `getFeatures()`), the `BaseRefNameAliasAdapter` interface (has `getRefNameAliases()`), and the `RegionsAdapter` interface (has `getRegions()`). There is a new interface `SequenceAdapter` that extends both BaseFeatureDataAdapter and RegionsAdapter (has both `getFeatures()` and `getRegions()`).

This allows checks like `isFeatureAdapter()` that will return `false` for `RegionsAdapter`s. A nice follow-up might be to store on the assembly in the assemblyManager whether the sequence has a `RegionsAdapter` or a `SequenceAdapter`, so that UI elements could react to that. For example, we could disable the reference sequence track in the track selector or disable the "get sequence" from the rubber band menu if a `ChromSizesAdapter` is being used.

This also adds a `FromConfigRegionsAdapter` for convenience, and removes `getRegions()` from the `FromConfigAdapter`, so if you want to use a sequence adapter from config you have to use the `FromConfigSequenceAdapter` or `FromConfigRegionsAdapter` (this helps avoid situations like [this](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/1623#issue-788495768), where `FromConfigAdapter` is used instead of `FromConfigSequenceAdapter`).

title: Make renderArgs consistent and don't duplicate data
body: As I was developing the Apollo plugin, I found that sometimes the info I wanted was in `renderArgs` and sometimes it was in `renderArgs.renderProps`. I then noticed that in CoreRender, `renderProps` were getting passed twice, both in `renderArgs.renderProps` and then also spread into the `renderArgs`. After talking with @rbuels, we decided to keep the `renderProps` that were spread and get rid of `renderArgs.renderProps`. This PR does that, and then also unifies how `renderInWorker` and `renderInClient` are called so their arguments are the same.

title: GCContent adapter
body:
This is a sketch for a GCContent adapter 

Ref #281

Imports some utility functions from @jbrowse/plugin-wiggle, uses the sequenceAdapter/subadapter concept similar to CramAdapter, and there is a track is in config_demo.json for hg19


![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo json session=local-947DkYCtt (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/105065811-81ab7580-5a3b-11eb-8ece-d56a4f716899.png)

title: Unify FromConfigAdapter and FromConfigSequenceAdapter
body:
Using the `FromConfigAdapter` with sequence data of moderate size causes JBrowse web and the embeddable LGV to become slow/unresponsive.

This came up during work on #1616 . Auspice takes very specific JSON files (generated by [Augur](https://docs.nextstrain.org/projects/augur/en/stable/index.html#)) as input. This imposes some constraints on the LGV. There is no indexed fasta to work with. To circumvent this, I tried using a `FromConfigAdapter` with the sequence from the JSON stored as a string. The COVID genome is 29,903 bases. This size string caused the embedded LGV to hang considerably when rendering the sequence, or basically doing any actions. This hangs the rest of the app too.

I tried to see if this was also the case for JB2 web, and it is.

Example session: https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/from_config_perf/?config=test_data%2Fcovid_config.json&session=share-2mOEag-5nX&password=E4Rv9

Just open sequence to reproduce.

@cmdcolin It's also worth noting that the hang seems to causes the translation frames added in #1458 to break.

**Caveat:** I'm not sure how high priority this actually is when not considering the Nextstrain use case. I think in general, I don't really know if this is a problem, since there are better supported ways to add large data to JB2 instead of putting it directly in the adapter.

title: the overview scale bar rubber-band polygon inaccurate (sometimes)
body: **Describe the bug** Inaccurate overview scale bar rubber-band polygon. Does not display the correct width in the overview scale bar rubber-band polygon . The overview scale bar polygon displays a polygon with inaccurate width for horizontally flipped regions. **To Reproduce** Jbrowse-web 1. Open volvox 2. JBrowseSession.views[0].setDisplayedRegions([{refName: 'ctgA', start: 0, end: 50001, assemblyName: 'volvox'}, {refName:'ctgB', start: 0, end: 6079, assemblyName: 'volvox'}, {refName: 'ctgA', start: 0, end: 3000, assemblyName: 'volvox'}]) 3. Horizontally flip 4. drag scrollbar **Expected behavior** Sometimes and not always is the the overview scale bar rubber-band polygon inaccurate. **Screenshots** Can be seen here **Version:** **Additional context**

title: prototype embedded LGV running inside nextstrain auspice
body:
Auspice ([site](https://auspice.us/)) ([repo](https://github.com/nextstrain/auspice)) is the main UI dashboard that nextstrain uses. Let's prototype using an embedded JB2 LGV in place of the current Diversity panel in the app, and see how good we can get it to look and what additional features it might enable.

Do it in the [GMOD fork of auspice](https://github.com/gmod/auspice) and see how it goes, and if it might be worth developing all the way.

cc @ihh @jameshadfield

title: Overcome 400kb dynamodb limit
body:
Dynamodb is limited by 400kb size entries

This could be

- a limit we have to live with or
- a limit we overcome

One possibility is to store data in s3 since s3 is (also) basically a key value store to try to overcome this


Procedure to reproduce

a) navigate to config_demo.json
b) open up cram ultralong nanopore reads
c) open feature details on a read greater than 400kb
d) try to share session

This is a possible approach that parse the error message from the JSON form and if that fails, display it as is

Alternatively, we could simplify our return from our dynamodb API to not return json formatted errors, but this may be ok as is here

title: Replace 'show all regions' with 'show all regions in assembly'
body:
This is a break out from #1531 

This adds a new behavior where we can "Show all regions in assembly" and also changes a behavior so that maxBpPerPx is conditional on totalBp/(self.width*0.9) rather than totalBp/1000

That means on a wide monitor, the behavior for "Show all regions in assembly" would use more of those horizontal pixels than just choosing to squish everything down to 1000

title: main thread hangs more than expected in cancer demo embedding section
body:
To reproduce:

1. go to https://jbrowse.org/demos/cancer-demo-2020/#embed
2. open hg19 in the embedded lgv
3. click one of the gene names
4. while it loads, scroll up and down with your mouse wheel or touchpad
5. you will see that the scrolling hangs a bit as the processing runs

This is probably a result of using MainThreadRenderer combined with heavy BAM processing. Should be confirmed with profiling though.

Some mitigation strategies:
1. add some yielding
2. fundamental performance improvements in BAM parsing or feature rendering
3. reduce serialization overhead in MainThreadRenderer or RPC in general (like maybe #416).

title: Fix positioning of scalebar tooltips, overview scalebar plotting, and refName label positioning when displaying many regions

#1556 
#1532 
Also see refname label positioning issue (X not flush with boundary) in #1556

I also make the minimum block width smaller to make it so realistically human sized chromosomes such as 20-22 of human are displayed even when zoomed out



The refname label positioning  was fixed by updates to calculateStaticBlocks/calculateDynamicBlocks: only needs to add interregionpaddingwidth when it is a content block

This PR also adds ellided blocks to the overview bar so that we avoid rainbow-of-small-displayed regions, and changes it from paper with margins to exact width divs

However, these changes do improve the general situation

title: Create --branch and --nightly flags for `jbrowse create` and `jbrowse upgrade` commands
body:
This re-instates the upload of a jbrowse-web build to the folder where it is being deployed (this existed in travis but was lost in the github move)

Then it also adds a --branch and a --nightly (alias for --branch master) flags to the `jbrowse create` and `jbrowse upgrade` commands

title: Update build system for external plugins
body:
After talking with @rbuels, this PR removes support for previous webpack-built plugins and switches over to using TSDX ([ref](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-plugin-gdc/pull/5#issuecomment-746780473)).

There's a template with information in the README about how to use it here: https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-plugin-template. (The template is private for now, would be made public on merge of this)

Also adds a couple notes in the docs about this.

I've got a PR going for switching the GDC plugin to this. I could also put in PRs for other plugins if wanted (https://github.com/cmdcolin/jbrowse-plugin-biothings-api and https://github.com/cmdcolin/jbrowse-plugin-ucsc-api are mentioned in the docs, are there others we should update?).

There's a bug relating to build naming in the current version of TSDX that gets fixed with `patch-package` (see https://github.com/formium/tsdx/pull/669), and when that bug gets fixed we can then update `development-tools` to not use `patch-package` and end users shouldn't notice any difference.

Also the bgzip indexed fasta was missing the note to use bgzip -i

title: Breakpoint split view can miss drawing splines if maxHeight is reached
body:
We saw on friday that possibly maxHeight could be a limiting variable to properly viewing the breakpoint split view

There are several options for how this could be addressed

1) Making the breakpoint split view not rely on inspecting the rendered output for splines. This was attempted on the linear-comparative-view branch but we reverted back to just inspecting the rendered output for now
2) Override maxHeight when using breakpoint split view to ensure it gets everything
3) Make it easier for users to change maxHeight themselves via a track menu option or similar

title: Provide a dialog to add extra genomic context for linear read vs. ref visualization
body:
This PR proposes to expand the start and end of the reference linear view when opening a linear vs. ref view. I think that this helps avoid cutting off details on the reference genome surrounding the read.

Example:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/102124906-b8b7b700-3dfd-11eb-8096-01b40a6c7dbf.png)

The current solution is add a region that is the length of the read to the left and right side of the read for the reference.

i.e.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/102126304-bf472e00-3dff-11eb-8f26-255b83b3f5cb.png)

This was motivated by #1322

title: Remove the TextDecoder/TextEncoder polyfill
body:
Fixes #1553 by removing the TextDecoder polyfill we were using

It has different behavior to what exists on the proper https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextDecoder

Hard exactly to tell why but the TextDecoder object we were receiving was not a proper instance of a TextDecoder

Possibly related to how this module allows multiple different ways of importing the module
https://github.com/anonyco/FastestSmallestTextEncoderDecoder

Note that caniuse says that all our browsers we target are ok without this https://caniuse.com/textencoder

title: Coloring options with simple color for tag
body:
Continuing off @cmdcolin's PR #1473, below is the original content (see original PR for snapshots)

This is kind of multi-part PR that is carried over from the paired alignments viewing.

It tries to offer some new things like coloring, filtering, and sorting options
Fixes #940

coloring alignments by various options, chosen by the track menu. the color by tag offers a possible way to color by arbitrary tag, but currently this is not super general and is a predefined list of some tags

sorting alignments by various options, including by tag (which prompts a dialog box to select a tag, which is a predefined list for now)

filtering alignments #767 by flags. the default filters out PCR dup and QC fail reads. Users can also extend the filtering using both inclusion and exclusion filtering (e.g. only include reads with this flag, exclude all reads with this flag). Similar to -f and -F in samtools. The filter is applied to both the snpcoverage and the pileup at once, which required a couple tricks

Also adds little directional arrows to the alignments features

-- NEW CONTENT --
Color by tag is no longer a set list, instead users will input a two character tag to color by, very similar to IGV. Tags must follow the conventional SAM tag format or submit will not be allowed. After submitting, code will run on the main thread to gather all values for submitted tag on static blocks and assign them a color pairing

title: Contribute feature/name search feature to project?
body:
I posted this on gitter a while ago, and thought it would be easier to follow up here. We use JBrowse as part of some NIH-funded projects and want to migrate to JBrowse2. We need the name-indexing/search feature to make that viable. I have developers, and would be willing to try take a stab at porting/adapting the JB1 concept to JB2., contributing this to your project. That would only make sense if we're engaged with your team, including design discussions. The basic blueprint for how to adapt JB1's feature to JB2 has been discussed on other threads and that basically made sense to me. There might be some smaller points to discuss. 

I see there is a prioritized dev item on your project board for this feature. Do you have a sense whether that is realistically being developed soon by your team?  Whatever that answer, is there a useful way we could contribute in a way that meaningfully accelerates this? From my perspective, the sooner the better.

Once we have this in place and have migrated to JB2, my group is very interested in building extensions to JBrowse that leverage your session config file (i.e. defining the tracks), and client-side parsing in order to create other kinds of UI driven by the same data. For example, one might want to render a table of variants/features. That's a separate conversation.

Anyway, please let me know if there's a way we can contribute here.

title: Fix memory leak when side scrolling LGV blocks
body:
There was possibly a memory leak from side scrolling blocks. I saw memory increasing pretty high from sidescrolling lgv

I looked and this code was not called for example


```
diff --git a/plugins/linear-genome-view/src/BaseLinearDisplay/components/ServerSideRenderedContent.t>
index efd6e3600..66dd4de57 100644
--- a/plugins/linear-genome-view/src/BaseLinearDisplay/components/ServerSideRenderedContent.tsx
+++ b/plugins/linear-genome-view/src/BaseLinearDisplay/components/ServerSideRenderedContent.tsx
@@ -75,6 +75,7 @@ function ServerSideRenderedContent(props: { model: BlockModel }) {

     return () => {
       if (domNode && isHydrated) {
+        console.log('here')
         unmountComponentAtNode(domNode)
       }
     }
lines 1-12/12 (END)


```
We could adjust the use of the isHydrated variable but also it seems this fix on this branch is a simpler approach: always unmount because it is a do nothing if not mounted https://reactjs.org/docs/react-dom.html#unmountcomponentatnode

title: improve Spreadsheet and SV inspector workflow
body:
**Edit:**

@cmdcolin and I addressed the dotplot and synteny open screen in #1541 

This issue now mainly is thinking about two things:

1. The workflow of opening spreadsheet and SV inspector from an existing track, as @garrettjstevens mentioned in #660 
2. Performance questions of keeping the whole file for spreadsheet in an MST model in the session.

To resolve problem 2, @cmdcolin were wondering if some "service" like workflow could be used, where the search/sort/filter operations for spreadsheet could be done in the web worker, or even a lambda. This would require separating out the spreadsheet into a frontend API, that simply made requests to the model keeping track of the data.

title: Plugin top-level configuration
Fix breakpoint split view showing too many connections for paired end ends
body:
The breakpoint split view when plotting the paired read connections across chromosomes uses the fact that the flag is NOT "read mapped in proper pair" https://broadinstitute.github.io/picard/explain-flags.html?flag=100

But it was using the old flag helpers which were removed. Instead we check bitwise ops on the flag

title: Display file headers in pre tag in about dialogs and bump @gmod/bam and @gmod/tabix package versions
body:
This is a proposal that was started when trying to make gff3tabix track display nice "About this track" header information

The VcfTabixAdapter already has has a "About this track" based on the vcf header, and does mild parsing of the header to make it display using a "feature details" style box

This modifies it to not do parsing of the header, and instead print the raw header using a `<pre>` text box

This then applies across many header types including BAM,CRAM,BEDTabix,GFF3Tabix,VCFTabix

In some situations, this could be better, and in some it could be worse. If the tracks have many thousands of refseqs, then there would be many thousands of not-very-informative header lines. Those can be collapsed when we do the mild parsing approach, but not with this raw approach. Is there any preference? We could also have both mild parsing and raw version...

Any thoughts welcome

This would require updates to BAM and CRAM to have a getRawHeader methods, which are on branches on those respective repos

title: Add NCBI aliases to hg19
body:
Currently the NCBI GFF was failing on some chromosomes in the config_demo

This came down to the GFF having been processed (by me) with a script that renamed the chromosomes in the GFF file and missed some including chr17 for example

This updates it so the NCBI GFF we use has native NCBI chromosome IDs e.g. NC_000001.10 and adds the NCBI chromosome IDs to the hg19_aliases.txt (they already existed in hg38_aliases.txt)

title: Avoid large object hash on SV inspector load
body:
Found with @elliothershberg on #1518 

The SV inspector makes a FromConfigAdapter of the features in the spreadsheet, but the BaseAdapter calculates a adapter ID using objectHash of the constructor's args (comment in diff explains purpose of that id)


We saw that the objectHash was consuming an endlessly large amount of memory (2gb, at which point it seemed to be struggling, which is good to know maybe....probably keeping whole app memory under 2gb is a good marker) basically with the large config.features input


This uses math.random just out of convenience but could use shortid, etc.

title: Release and workflow updates
body:
These are some adjustments to the release process determined after releasing v1.0.2. The biggest change is that the release script uses `semver` to get the new version number before `yarn lerna publish` is run. That way it can generate the blog post and changelog with the new version number and commit them before tagging and publishing the release.

Also includes a couple GitHub workflow updates:

- update the build job to install the website deps with a cache to help it be a bit faster
- add a new workflow that will add a "needs label triage" label to a PR if it doesn't have a changelog label

title: Use jbrowse.org link for the alias files to fix CORS errors
body:
Currently, every time I load up the app I get a CORS error for this file

![Screenshot from 2020-11-30 15-52-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/100663289-10492380-3324-11eb-801b-5a0b3e930482.png)

This is the whole screenshot I see almost every app load

```
Access to fetch at 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/genomes/hg19/hg19_aliases.txt' from origin 'http://localhost:3000' has been blocked by CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. If an opaque response serves your needs, set the request's mode to 'no-cors' to fetch the resource with CORS disabled.
rangeFetcher.ts:13 GET https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/genomes/hg19/hg19_aliases.txt net::ERR_FAILED
getfetch @ rangeFetcher.ts:13


```

It has been hypothesized that this is due to weird amazon throttling, because it is intermittent and doesn't affect all users

Ian also ran into this for a VCF file once, which makes it somewhat concerning that it would affect other users

This change would specifically help me, because the cloudfront'ed file has no issue, hence this tiny change.


It is some question of whether this should be done to more of our files. I don't know the details or implications of making cloudfront host giant files that we range request against (could be expensive)

title: Updates to release process
body:
These are some more changes to the release process after learning some things doing the last release. Using our new synchronized versioning scheme, lerna just does one tag for each version and not a tag for each package. Big changes:

- Build jbrowse-web for each version tag, even if internally the jbrowse-web package doesn't change
- Make workflow-generated GitHub release a draft so we can manually change the description (e.g. add changelog) before publishing
- Fix website build (was missing a texlive package)
- Publish `@jbrowse/plugin-circular-view` (see #1502)

title: @jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view not working because of @jbrowse/plugin-circular-view
body:
<!-- Please fill out as much of the template as you can. -->

When creating a new react app and installing the @jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view it breaks with this error:

***Failed to compile.***

***./node_modules/@jbrowse/plugin-variants/dist/plugin-variants.esm.js
Module not found: Can't resolve '@jbrowse/plugin-circular-view'***

<!-- Put a clear and concise description of the bug here. -->

The steps to reproduce this bug are 
1. Create a react app using: npx create-react-app <project-name>
2. Install @jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view (1.0.1): npm i @jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view
2. In the auto-generated App.js folder change the contents by (following the tutorial): 

import React from 'react'
import 'fontsource-roboto'
import {
  createViewState,
  createJBrowseTheme,
  JBrowseLinearGenomeView,
  ThemeProvider,
} from '@jbrowse/react-linear-genome-view'
 
const theme = createJBrowseTheme()
 
function View() {
  defaultSession = {
    name: 'aNameHere', // what the name is doesn't really matter
    view: {/* view state here */},
  }
  const state = createViewState({
    assembly,
    tracks,
    defaultSession,
    location: 'ctgA:1105..1221',
    onChange: patch => {
      console.log('patch', patch)
    },
  })
  return (
   \<ThemeProvider theme={theme}>
      \<JBrowseLinearGenomeView viewState={state} />
    \</ThemeProvider>
  )
}

export default View

3. In the auto-generated replace: 
import App from './App'; with import View from './App';
and 
\<App /> with \<View />

title: Increase test timeout using jest.setTimeout
Updates to release workflow
body:
While trying to integrate changelog generation into the release process, I was having trouble making things clear to someone looking at the changelog. The biggest problem was that usually changelogs are grouped under a version number, but since all our packages are versioned independently, and the changelog is for the whole repository, that didn't work. Also, not every package is published during every release. Packages that have no changes are not published and don't have their versions bumped. I tried creating a table in the changelog of all the packages that were changed, what their new version is, if they are published to NPM or not, etc., but it got a bit complicated. It also seems like it would be difficult to decide individually for every package in each release whether the changes deserve a minor or patch bump.

That leads me to the biggest proposal in this PR: **Use lerna to lock all packages to the same version**. That way a changelog can refer to a specific version number, and it's easy to see which changes happened in which versions. Lerna will still only publish the packages that have changed if done this way, so not everything will be published under every version number. I know we decided on independent versioning at some point, but I couldn't remember the exact reason why. I thought this might be a good chance to reconsider that, since we just synchronized everything at 1.0.0, and it would be a straightforward switch.

The other problem I ran into is that some releases may not include a release of JBrowse Web. This could happen if, for example, after a release we found a critical bug in another product, like JBrowse Desktop, that we needed to publish a fix for quickly. If only JBrowse Desktop is changed, and not JBrowse Web, then the release would not include JBrowse Web. I had to change the release script and the automatic blog post to account for this.

title: pop up a warning and remove callbacks when sharing/exporting/importing sessions
body:
Until we sandbox or sanitize config callbacks, we need to remove them from saved sessions when they are imported or shared.

Implementation sketch:

* when sharing or exporting a session, scan it for config callbacks and pop up a warning that they cannot be shared and will be removed, with default values used in their place. then go through and remove the config callbacks before sending the session to the share URL
* when loading a shared session from `shared-` session URLs (not localStorage or sessionStorage), scan it for config callbacks and remove them. if any were found, pop up a warning (snackbar probably) that some config callbacks were removed

title: LinearSyntenyView unable to plot self-alignment synteny
body:
This was known for a little while by me but the LinearSyntenyView is unable to plot self-alignments


This is something that can be a real task, and seems more commonly in dotplots, but basically highlights repetitiveness or other interesting self similarity


The reason for this difference is a sort of weird

The PAFAdapter determines which column to fetch from based on the assemblyName attribute in it's config matching the query assemblyName, and since it is self, it always matches column 1


The Dotplot view actually is able to plot self similarity because it uses feature.mate and so it can handle getting just features from the first column. The synteny view uses matching syntenyID property queried from both columns, but the second column can't get queried right (because it is a duplicate assemblyname)

title: Pagination for the spreadsheet
body:
This is a proposal for pagination on the spreadsheet

It's thought that the dominating factor in how the session becomes overloaded with the spreadsheet is due to dom elements e.g. the NxM style thing that the spreadsheet creates

This proposes a pagination limiting us to a number of rows



As much as I would like virtualized seamless scrolling it is challenging to deliver properly as you have to hijack default browser scroll bars


Notes on a couple attempts at trying virtualized spreadsheet

a) if you make a virtualized scroll, you can get some ways into it, however many columns becomes a problem because you have to predeclare a div area to put the virtualization in, and if it is simply a width 100% you can't sidescroll it to get to a large number of columns
b) in this case you are looking at like a 2d virtualizer and that seemed somewhat complex, especially because you then need sticky virtualized column names which is like scrollsync from react-virtualized but this doesn't look that great and feels like non native scroll

the xgrid from mui is nice, didn't try, but the licensing is weird so just avoiding for now

That also made me realize it would be good to import sessions from files as well. We already had an ImportConfigWidget, which was from before a lot of restructuring happened and it didn't really make sense anymore. This repurposes that as an ImportSessionWidget.
