title: Color, filter, and sort options for the alignments
body:
This is kind of multi-part PR that is carried over from the paired alignments viewing.

It tries to offer some new things like coloring, filtering, and sorting options
Fixes #940 


1) coloring alignments by various options, chosen by the track menu. the color by tag offers a possible way to color by arbitrary tag, but currently this is not super general and is a predefined list of some tags

2) sorting alignments by various options, including by tag (which prompts a dialog box to select a tag, which is a predefined list for now)

3) filtering alignments #767  by flags. the default filters out PCR dup and QC fail reads. Users can also extend the filtering using both inclusion and exclusion filtering (e.g. only include reads with this flag, exclude all reads with this flag). Similar to -f and -F in samtools. The filter is applied to both the snpcoverage and the pileup at once, which required a couple tricks

Also adds little directional arrows to the alignments features

Here are some screenshots

title: Have assembly manager get plugin manager from factory function args
body:
After #1438, the React Linear Genome View wasn't working. It turned out to be because the assembly manager was looking for the plugin manager on the root model, which doesn't exist in the React Linear Genome View. I thought about adding `pluginManager` to `AbstractRootModel`, but that caused typescript errors elsewhere. Instead, I decided to pass the plugin manager as an arg when creating the assembly manager model, which is similar to the way a session model is created.

This seems to work fine, but it led to `pluginManager` being correctly typed in `assembly.ts` (before this it was implicitly `any`), which required some typescript fixes. Basically what it amounted to was that `getSubAdapter` was marked as required in `AdapterConstructor`, but from what I understand, it should actually be optional. Changing it to optional required changing a few adapters that use that interface.

title: Fix GH workflow build
body:
This PR fixes the issue with the website breaking the GH workflow build. #1450 added building the website to the yarn build. #1448 moved builds from Travis to GH Workflows.

The workflow step was failing because the main `package.json` didn't have the dependencies for the website. This PR moves the website building step back out of the main yarn build, but includes it as its own step in the workflow.

Once the build finishes and things look okay, this should be good to go.

title: Add alt-text to website/docs images
body:
A lot of the images in our docs look like this, with no alt-text (the text that goes inside the square brackets):

```
![](./img/some_img.png)
```

The alt-text is important for accessibility, e.g. for people who use screen readers. The alt-text should describe what is in the image so that someone who cannot see the image could still benefit.

One note, there seems to be some parsing of alt-text in `tex_parser.js` that I don't totally understand.

title: Fix website build
body:
The website currently won't build. This fixes the build and adds the website build to the root `yarn build` command so that if it breaks again it will show up in CI (website used to be built in CI before https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/pull/1336).

Some fixes are because there seems to a bug in docusaurus that if a markdown image alt-text has double quotes (like this: `![alt text with "quotes"!](../static/img/logo.svg)`), the build breaks: https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/issues/3751

Another fix updates `tex_parser.md` so that it only tries to extract a caption for an image if there is no alt-text, and only extracts the caption if it's on the next line (no blank lines after it).

title: Move building and testing from Travis to GitHub Workflow
body:
@elliothershberg and I worked on this together. This removes `.travis.yml` and moves the testing and build steps to two new workflows that run on every push:

* **test**
  * runs tests
  * uploads coverage
  * checks typescript types
* **build**
  * builds codebase
  * runs build-only tests
  * uploads branch build to S3 in the same location Travis did

So far the build step takes the longest at right around 20 minutes, and we haven't seen any builds time out.

Fixes #1328

title: No way to add refNameAliases adapter in GUI
body:
If an assembly config doesn't already have a refNameAliases adapter, that slot doesn't show up in the GUI config editor and there is no way to add the slot.

Assemblies added via the AssemblyManager GUI don't have refNameAliases adapters, so there's currently no way to add an assembly with refNameAliases via the GUI.

title: session assemblies
body: Allow a non-admin user to open an assembly from elsewhere, and add tracks on it, all within their session.

title: assemblies from connections
body:
We need to support getting assemblies from connections.

For example, we should be able to point JB2 directly at a JB1 config (or maybe a whole JB1 installation) and have it mostly work (assemblies and tracks visible and viewable).

And you should be able to open a UCSC assembly hub, and use the assembly from there.

title: 1381 improve assembly add form
body:
This PR improves the form and workflow for adding a new assembly graphically.

## Previously

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/98989558-278fb080-24de-11eb-8a0d-3875f7994a79.png)

Would accept a name, and then immediately direct the user to the full configEditor for the assembly.

## Now

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/98989964-af75ba80-24de-11eb-93a0-18892a2dd824.png)

A simple form that asks for name and adapter info (IndexedFastaAdapter, BgzipFastaAdapter, or TwoBitAdapter)

when submitted, the user gets notified:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/98990294-1eebaa00-24df-11eb-84e1-ed0270b3b0c7.png)

and then returned to the main table of assemblies. Any more granular editing can be accessed through the pencil icon which gives access to the full configEditor.

title: Improve assembly loading time by moving to main thread
body:
This is an alternative to #1406 that performs assembly loading on the main thread

This improves loading time, and makes it so the assembly is waited on before the app is called initialized

title: Use lerna-changelog for changelog generation
body:
This is an alternative to #1279 

It uses github PRs as a proxy for fixes to the repo


I tried this before but probably didn't have something working quite right, as it worked in the latest test

I did the following


Added the "bug" label to the #1422 PR
Ran `yarn lerna-changelog`
This generated a changelog with that PR mentioned

This is less granular than the conventional commits changelog, but may be more in line with how we expect changelogs to be developed

title: Updates to quickstart guides
body:
While pairing with each of @teresam856, @peterkxie, and @elliothershberg yesterday, we went through an exercise of trying to approach JBrowse from the point of view of someone who is brand new to it. While doing so, we made some proposed changes to the quickstart guides.

The proposed flow is to have three guides. First is the general quickstart which installs the JBrowse CLI, downloads JBrowse, and makes sure it's working. The users then have the choice to proceed with configuring JBrowse by using the CLI config quickstart or the GUI config quickstart.

This also adjust some formatting and wording and adds some screenshots so users can confirm that what they've done is successful.

title: Create separate config schema for ReferenceSequenceTrack
body:
I noticed that after the (awesome) changes to the display methods, there were some fields that seemed unnecessary for the ReferenceSequenceTrack config schema.

For example, this is the config editor after the changes:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/98837464-d60cf600-23f7-11eb-91ec-56b7c79f38ad.png)

Probably not useful graphically, or in the config in general. In pairing, @garrettjstevens and I created a smaller base config schema for the ReferenceSequenceTrack.

Now, the slots look like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/98837818-4582e580-23f8-11eb-8b8d-908b425d8f6e.png)

Removing some of the unnecessary slots for a ReferenceSequenceTrack.

title: Make add track warning a bit more lenient
body: This expands what the add track widget is looking for in an absolute URL so things like `/my.bam` and `//mysite.com/my.bam` don't give warnings, since they are valid [absolute URLs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Common_questions/What_is_a_URL#Absolute_URLs_vs_relative_URLs).

title: Make global variables window.JBrowseSession and window.JBrowseRootModel available in jbrowse-web
body:
~[Issue 1417](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/1417)~

Issue: Window session object did not get set after going through the splash screen. Kept the JBrowseRootModel and JBrowseSession in prod for debugging purposes.

title: Fix connection tracks not showing up in track selector
body:
Fixes a bug introduced in #1398. This makes the connection track filtering logic the same as the regular track filtering.

Fixes #1424

title: Paginate or virtualize large VCF samples table
body:
Large VCF samples table in the sidebar makes app performance drop similar to how many tracks cripples our performance. We could paginate or virtualize the table to help

Also adding a small text filter and sorting to the VCF samples table would be nice probably 

Example, 1000 genomes vcf http://s3.amazonaws.com/1000genomes/phase3/integrated_sv_map/supporting/GRCh38_positions/ALL.wgs.integrated_sv_map_v1_GRCh38.20130502.svs.genotypes.vcf.gz

title: Avoid rendering the string 'null' in feature detail views
body: Currently missing data like null is rendered as the string null, which happens on VCF data. We would probably want to change these back to '.' to be faithful to the data in some cases. In some cases the null could be hidden perhaps (ID, QUAL, FILTER), but in others it is needed to report the '.' (any instances of it in GT columns, etc)

title: Fix the listVersions behavior of the jbrowse-cli returning duplicate entries
body: I didn't fully test this but it looks like their pagination system has numbering starting from 1 where we attempted to start from 0, resulting in the duplication. Also filter out @jbrowse/web tags only #1415

title: Change "Factory reset" to "Reset session" in jbrowse-web

If I am an end user, and trigger an error, there is a button to "Factory reset". I think that an end user would not understand this and would maybe conceive of it as scary and might not click it for fear of actually messing up the administrative instance?

Just a thought from seeing this in a fatal error context...maybe "Reset session" instead

title: Warning before closing last view in a session
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

It's really disorienting to a newcomer when they close the last view in a session and are greeted with an empty screen. 
e.g. https://twitter.com/gringene_bio/status/1324900824611352579?s=20

**Describe the solution you'd like**

It would be a good idea, as @gringer suggests, to warn before leaving the user with an empty session. Perhaps the warning should only be displayed once.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

Default sessions would sort of help with this problem too, but why not do both?

title: Only set window.MODEL, window.ROOTMODEL in development

**Version:**

## CLI

USAGE
  $ jbrowse [COMMAND]

COMMANDS

                       configuration

  "name": "@jbrowse/web",
  "version": "0.0.1-beta.26",
```

And for OS I'm using `Ubuntu 20.04 LTS`


**Additional context**

title: Displays
body:
Some main takeaways from this PR:

* A single track config can have multiple displays.
  * When you create a display, you register it with a track type, so tracks know which displays it can have
  * There is a preProcessSnapshot that takes a track config, looks at the displays it has, and adds a default config for any possible displays it's missing
  * If you don't need to use any non-default config for the displays, the displays don't even have to be in the config file. That means when doing `jbrowse add-track`, you can just add the track and not worry about displays at all.
* Can switch between multiple possible displays in LGV
  * Only shows up in track menu if that track has multiple compatible displays for the view
  * For AlignmentsDisplay, this replaces the "show pileup" and "show coverage" track menu options
  * Another example is for FeatureTracks, you can choose basic, filtering, or lollipop displays

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/98178525-129d9680-1eba-11eb-9fa3-0e7befbcf8d7.png)

* Enables opening of same track in different views. e.g. a SyntenyTrack can have a DotplotDisplay in a DotplotView, and then that same track can be opened as a LinearSytentyDisplay in a LinearSyntenyView.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/98178924-e0406900-1eba-11eb-9bf6-661a0e7fd4c9.png)


Resolves #852 
Resolves #1382 
Resolves #1182

title: 1318 admin quickstart
body:
This adds the admin quickstart guide to our docs (#1318 )

Covers:

- Launching `admin-server`
- Adding an assembly using assembly manager GUI
- Accessing configuration editor for a track, seeing live updates

Open to any suggestions on improvements :)

title: Search box integration test
body:
This tests ref renamed search input

Note that navToLocString becomes async

If this seems undesirable we may need to have a more proper wait-until-loaded state that is otherwise waited on

Xref #1387

title: Update bcc2020_embedding_jbrowse_04_assemblies.md
body:
Change filename from 'assemblies.js' to 'assembly.js'.
We export only one assembly in this file,  and that's consistent with the following html file which imports assembly using 'assembly.js'.

title: Add new menu items for show/hide feature labels, set max height, and set compact display mode
body:
This adds

- Track menu item to show/hide feature labels
- Set compact setting on the features
- Also adds a maxDisplayedBpPerPx default, which is otherwise unset on normal BasicTrack, allowing it to not try to render gigantic regions when too far zoomed out (we instead get a prompt where you can force render)

I think these things are helpful add ons to the BasicTrack concept
Since this track type actually works in tandem with the SvgFeatureRenderer closely, it is in the plugins/svg

Possibly we could imagine de-emphasizing the svg'ness, so I just call this a FeatureTrack

title: Resource list for helpwidget
body:
Screenshot

![localhost_3000_index html_config=test_data%2Fconfig json session=local-ZubbSIjul](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/98054800-f6dab780-1e09-11eb-87e9-276654619003.png)


Adds the user guide

Makes the version display similar to the about dialog

Uses less prose when offering links, instead providing a short list

title: Volatile error for spreadsheet/import wizard
body:
This is a tiny PR for suggesting that the error be a volatile state for spreadsheet/sv inspector import wizards

Any error during import persists across refreshes. I can't think of a great reason why that would be a good thing to do

title: Fix chevron rendering
body:
Fixes #1218 



http://localhost:3000/?config=test_data%2Fconfig.json&session=share-rSgu97MMnu&password=ouMvS

![localhost_3000__config=test_data%2Fconfig json session=local-JI5KB9NhS](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/98038494-3b0a8f80-1deb-11eb-9d5d-c80a7332c9e7.png)

Master branch, nothing rendered here
http://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/master/index.html?config=test_data%2Fconfig.json&session=share-rSgu97MMnu&password=ouMvS

![s3 amazonaws com_jbrowse org_code_jb2_master_index html_config=test_data%2Fconfig json session=local-x8u5VCupc (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/98038555-52497d00-1deb-11eb-8aa2-93ebd83335af.png)


Approach: change from using a elongated polygon to a rectangle with a small triangle that is added to the ends of features that end in the current view. This is somewhat easier to keep track of than all the cases where we need to render partial length rect as a result of the -100000000+100000100 stuff not rendering, and then rendering the pointed directionals

title: Fix allRefNames on assembly
body: Restores previous functionality to return a list of all refNames and aliases.

title: Add blank FORMAT column for spreadsheet view VcfImporter if none exists
body:
If a VCF that is uploaded to the spreadsheet view has no FORMAT then it crashes

This avoids the crash by making a fake FORMAT column

body:
Xref #1386 

Started here https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/compare/search_test

Note that there is some stuff where we have to make sure the assembly is initialized before searching since the tests happen faster than what the user might do themselves, resulting in new usages of await assemblyManager.waitForAssembly

title: Fix usage of aliases for isValidRefName
body:
Currently on master searching chr5:1-100 does not work since chr5 is an alias

This fixes that.. This is a knock on from #1369 

Note that having an integration test for this would be great. Have tried to do this here recently but didn't get it completed https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/compare/search_test

title: Add back the RefNameAutocomplete loading state
body:
This is a bit of refactoring

It removes some internal state of RefNameAutocomplete which gives it a little more predictable behavior, and basically makes it more like a controlled component.

title: Create "example sessions" or "session templates"
body:
A very common thing in bioinformatics tools, for demo purposes, is to have "example links" that auto fill out some forms and give you the output

In our context, this could be like example sessions that demonstrate different types of views or regions of interest or tracksets. The admin could configure these.

title: Remove savedSessions from configs
body: `savedSessions` no longer gets loaded from the config file after #1240. This removes references to it in demo configs, and moves a saved session to `defaultSession` where applicable.

title: Error opening linear synteny view from dotplot
body:
Drag over a section of the dotplot and choose "Open linear synteny view". Error is

```
Failed to resolve reference 'grape_peach_synteny_mcscan' to type 'LinearSyntenyTrackConfigurationSchema' (from node: /session/views/1/tracks/0/configuration)
```

Link: ~~https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/master/index.html?config=test_data%2Fyeast_synteny%2Fconfig.json&session=local-2GHotOIXN~~ https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/code/jb2/master/index.html?config=test_data%2Fyeast_synteny%2Fconfig.json

This works on the peach/grape dotplot, but not other ones. It looks like the peach/grape track might be hardcoded in the menu action:

https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/blob/7b95e14f11d12109676e22d8ef1a64f42d9d0896/plugins/dotplot-view/src/DotplotView/model.ts#L380-L385

title: Improved Add Assembly Form
body: Add form fields to the Create New Assembly Form in the Assembly Manager GUI for adding the sequence files.

title: Don't crash app when live editing assembly
body:
This is a small change that checks if the Assembly Manager GUI is open before cascading errors loading an assembly up to the root model of the app and crashing it. This fixes issues with live editing values using the config editor for assemblies (#1375 ).

I'm going to open a separate PR with an improved form for adding assemblies, but think this should go in now, depending on how long creating the new form takes me.

title: Make hasWidget check hidden widgets
body:
Currently the removeReferring uses hasWidget to check if anything is referring to a track. This searches all widgets including hidden ones from self.widgets in the session

This would fix #1342 


Alternative fixes might involve not keeping track of hidden widgets

title: Linear synteny fixes, updated import form, and some misc
body:
These are some miscellaneous fixes for making the linear synteny import form

- make the import form set the child view widths ref #1332 
- make the drawer widget detect whether the view is valid ref #1224 
- adds a simplified add-track URL input for PAF files for linear-synteny and dotplot ImportForm


 then some more random changes along the way including

- some misc docs update
- material-ui version bump, was looking at a weird thing where class="[object Object]" on tooltip was happening but it just is still there. oh well
- rename expansion panel to accordion according to the version bump
- add a gallery page with some updated docs for synteny and dotplot views

title: Add ability to use admin-server in dev mode
body:
This attempts to help with the issue #1297 


The admin-server prints out a message for how to run it in dev mode e.g. when yarn start is running on port 3000 and the admin server is running on port 9000

The URL format looks like

http://localhost:3000/?adminKey=ebcd0bd95f&adminServer=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A9090%2FupdateConfig&config=test_data%2Fvolvox%2Fconfig.json&session=local-WlWepLIjl

To work with volvox I run

cd test_data/volvox
../../products/jbrowse-cli/bin/run admin-server
http://localhost:3000?adminKey=320ffbf8eb&adminServer=http://localhost:9090/updateConfig

title: adding new assembly with assembly manager GUI breaks with Volvox session
body:
When doing more manual testing, I noticed that for the Volvox demo the assembly manager GUI throws an error when adding a new session. The error occurs when I try to switch the type of adapter for the assembly. When I switch from BamAdapter to BgzipFastaAdapter it throws: "Error: Error: HTTP 404 fetching /path/to/seq.fa.gz.fai". Seems like I problem with trying to interpret the default value.

Doesn't happen for the human basic demo, or an empty config (which is what I was testing with.)

To reproduce:

1. Build jbrowse-web
2. Copy the contents of `test_data/volvox` into the root of the build directory.
3. Run `jbrowse admin-server` inside the build directory.
4. Open the Assembly Manager
5. Create new assembly
6. In the config editor, switch from Bam Adapter to BgzipFastaAdapter

Not sure what the problem is with why it is immediately looking for that file and throwing an error for this demo compared to having either the basic human config, or a default one.

title: Simpler crypto
body:
Following #1356 and also #1326 I made this PR to have a simpler crypto implementation. The bundle size improvements are not updated yet AFAIK but I think this result is a good code change anyways

I think the results are easier to read in the code though and it doesn't use a fake key, just a random password 

Also updates the lambda to make the session id shorter and the full hash is not generally needed, just a small amount of randomness. This change is already live

Note that this change would make currently shared sessions obsolete so deploying to yet a new base URI. I do this by removing the beta prefix

title: More inference addtrack workflow
body:
This PR

- Removes the FromConfig option
- Infers track name as filename
- Infers assembly name (this was almost already in the code but the key was assemblyConfig which was unattainable)
- Adds an additional index file input box, a heuristic that gets us most of the way there to more generic add track workflow

title: Bug - ParentInfo for Displayed Regions not accurate
body: **Describe the bug** The zag zag patterns at the ends of the overview scale bar regions disappear after doing a horizontal flip. **To Reproduce** 1) Add LGV 2) set displayed regions MODEL.views[0].setDisplayedRegions([{refName: "ctgA", start: 0, end: 2001, reversed: false, assemblyName: "volvox"}, {refName: "ctgB", start: 0, end: 2000, reversed: false, assemblyName: "volvox"}, {refName: "ctgA", start: 0, end: 20000, reversed: false, assemblyName: "volvox"}]) 3) correct behavior 4) horizontally flip 5) zig zag patterns disappear Correct behavior when setting the original state of the displayed Regions..it shows the zig zag patterns at the end to indicate the region is smaller than its parent region. When you horizontally flip the LGV, the zig zag patterns disappear. **Expected behavior** I expect the zig zag patterns to render even when we do a horizontal flip. context(the presence of zigzag patterns indicate that the region displayed in the overview is a section of the parent region, if the displayed region and the parent region have the same then no zigzag indicators will appear). In the screenshots below, we are rendering regions that are smaller than their parent regions so the zig zag patterns should remain no matter the HF **Screenshots** correct incorrect **Version:** JBrowse 2: Release @jbrowse/web@0.0.1-beta.27 Catalina). MacOs Catalina 10.15.7 Chrome **Additional context**

title: Unwanted scrolling behavior on Safari
body:
<!-- Please fill out as much of the template as you can. -->

**Describe the bug**

Scrolling on Safari has unwanted behavior. Scrolling back can unintentionally trigger the back button in the browser, and scrolling forward has the visual appearance of the app being "dragged" to the left slightly each time.

**To Reproduce**

1. Open JBrowse2 in a Safari browser on MacOS.
2. Open a linear view.
3. Try scrolling with either touch pad or mouse.

**Expected behavior**

Safari should match the behavior of the view in Chrome.

**Screenshots**

App being dragged when scrolling right:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/97744161-ff4a8f80-1aa3-11eb-9ed7-fb00e434169c.png)

Back action being hit when scrolling left:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19295181/97744210-12f5f600-1aa4-11eb-839e-d0ce4e87733f.png)


**Version:**

MacOS Catalina 10.15.6
Safari Version 14.0

title: Don't disable LGV 'select tracks' button if its track sel is already displayed
body:
Just ran across this in-passing:

Don't disable lgv 'select tracks' button if its track sel is already displayed, it can be confusing. A user has the track sel open for that LGV, gets distracted for a bit, then looks back and wonders why the button is disabled, not realizing it's because the track sel is open. If they click it again, it does no harm.

title: make rootModel setSession check and attempt to remove undefined MST refs
body:
Attempts to filter out undefined references in sessions at load time as much as possible. It can't get everything, but it does validate all the references at the time that you set the session, so at least you can handle the undefined ref at session load time.

Adds logic in Loader.tsx to handle the new undefined ref errors thrown setSession, which is what actually addresses the problem in #1275.

this is an alternate approach to #1275, but they might possibly be able to work together, could consider testing that.

title: Coarser update frequency for lgv headerbar
body:
This tried to speed up the scrolling animation by making the headerbar text e.g. in the search box update less frequently

This is a trick that exists in jbrowse 1 also

title: Add Analytics to JB2
body:
Adds Analytics to JB2

Locally:
 - In Loader, commands are triggered to send data to AWS lambda function and Google Analytics
 - Stats sent to AWS are the following: 
```
{
    ver: rootModel.version,
    'assemblies-count': rootModel.jbrowse.assemblies.length,
    'tracks-count': rootModel.jbrowse.tracks.length,
    plugins: rootModel.jbrowse.plugins
      ? getSnapshot(rootModel.jbrowse.plugins)
      : '',
    'open-views': rootModel?.session?.views.length || undefined,
    'synteny-tracks-count': rootModel.jbrowse.tracks.filter(
      (track: Track) => track.assemblyNames.length > 1,
    ).length,
    'saved-sessions-count': Object.keys(localStorage).filter(name =>
      name.includes('localSaved-'),
    ).length,

    // screen geometry
    'scn-h': window.screen.height,
    'scn-w': window.screen.width,

    // window geometry
    'win-h': document.body.offsetHeight,
    'win-w': document.body.offsetWidth,

    electron: typeof window !== 'undefined' && Boolean(window.electron),
    loadTime: (Date.now() - initialTimeStamp) / 1000,
    jb2: true, // note, this is solely for determining the correct table to write to
  }
```
TODO: approve the final stats sent
AWS:
- Uses the existing lambda function `jbrowse_analytics` that JBrowse 1 uses
Changes to lambda
 - removal of the third party dynamo-doc package and uses the native AWS dynamodb.documentclient
 - updated runtime from node 8.x (depreciated) to node 12.x
 - include code to determine which table to write to
Changes to DynamoDB
 - JBrowse1_Analytics_Events table is untouched, only JB1 analytics will be written here
 - Creation of new JBrowse2_Analytics_Events table. same setup as JB1 table and only JB2 Analytics events will be written here

Google Analytics
 - Created a new property and view for JBrowse 2 ( will record separately from JB1 GA)
 - Setup the custom dimensions tracks-count, ver, electron, loadTime, plugins

title: Add ability to specify an optional --index file for add-track
body:
This proposes having a --index argument so that we can supply an alternative index location to a BAM, CRAM, or VCF

It also removes the concept of supplying an index file directly to the positional argument

It does not try to tackle the double index of indexedfasta, suggesting that this should be more or less standardized. If needed, we can create an index2 option for this though

title: Change default branch from "master"
body:
There has been more awareness lately that using "master" for the name of the default branch can be offensive. In a statement from GitHub (see more details [here](https://github.com/github/renaming)):

> Many communities, both on GitHub and in the wider Git community, are considering renaming the default branch name of their repository from `master`. GitHub is gradually renaming the default branch of our own repositories from `master` to `main`.

Also, starting this month, new repos created by any user on GitHub have a default branch of `main`.

In order to try to be more inclusive, I propose we change our default branch name. Since we have the 1.0 release coming soon, it could be a good time to make this change, and also think about how we want our branches structured. A couple possibilities:

* Change `master` to `main` and continue our workflow the same way it is now. If you want to get the repo in the same state as the latest release, use the release tags.
* Change `master` to `main`, and create a `development` or `dev` branch where daily development is done. The dev branch is then merged into master each release.
* Change `master` to `development` or `dev`, and then have a non-default `main` branch that we merge to when we release so there's always a branch with the latest release.
* Various other naming schemes are possible.

title: Fix add track relative urls
body:
This PR

- Removes the checkLocation concept (e.g. checking for a manifest.json) except for in the case of jbrowse upgrade which should supply a path with a manifest.json
- Removes resolveFileLocationWithProtocol in add-track replacing it with an inline logic
- Removes the live-checking that a URL exists before adding it. If this is really desirable, we can add it back but I think it's better to let the tool be something that just does stuff rather than validate everything down to whether a url that they supplied is valid
- Adds --subDir argument to add-track so that when I say --load copy --subDir bam then it copies the file to a bam subdirectory near target
- Adds a --protocol argument that allows the user to manually specify the protocol used for the user to manually supply this, since it's not really able to be automatically determined. uri is used by default

Finally it fixes #1337 by making the file path that is written to the config.json generated via guessAdapter different from the actual file locations that are generated by guessFileNames

title: jbrowse-cli outputs wrong filename in config.json when run outside of directory
body:
this  bug probably follows from #1242 

example
 bin/run add-track ../../test_data/volvox/volvox_fake_synteny.paf --out ../../test_data/volvox --skipCheck --load copy --assemblyNames volvox,volvox --force


generate pafLocation: {uri:../../test_data/volvox/volvox_fake_synteny.paf}

it should generate

generate pafLocation: {uri:volvox_fake_synteny.paf}



e.g. it should be relative to config.json and where the file was copied to (unless inPlace used)

title: RefNameAutocomplete long wait time with no loading state
body:
The RefNameAutocomplete currently returns null until it is fully loaded which involves a full instantiation of a worker thread which is 3MB of JS downloaded to do anything


An alternative is fetching of the refNames on the main thread for this case. This would almost certainly be faster fetching it on the main thread.

Note that waiting on loading the header bar for the LGV is also affected by this, you can see the linear-progress going while it waits for a worker thread to instantiate and getRefNames from the reference genome


Example of the loading screen you can get stuck at, where the screen has the disabled open button for sort of a "confusing reason"

title: Assembly failing to load has no error handling on desktop
body:
![Screenshot from 2020-10-19 11-50-00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/96474988-76a93500-1201-11eb-96da-ddcbe76fb9fa.png)
 

Currently assembly.ts does a getParent(self, 3).setError which works on web but not desktop. 

Note that on web, this getParent(self, 3).setError is basically root model I think, and then makes the entire app fail to load. 

Maybe instead it would be better to do a self.setError, and have that error only apply to the failed assembly?

title: localPath for indexedfasta fails in electron desktop
body:
![Screenshot from 2020-10-19 10-08-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/96462028-18755580-11f3-11eb-97f1-387ddeab24c1.png)


It is getting a Uint8Array instead of a Buffer (possibly?) and then Uint8Array.toString is not sufficient to transform this to a string.

We could fix this in indexedfasta by making it use readFile('utf8') instead of readFile() -> result.toString() but this is an interesting bug

title: mockConsoleLog from CLI obscures console logs from other tests
body:
Was debugging a zoom in zoom out timeout and my console logs did not appear

The console mock stuff and the way that tests can affect other tests sometimes is confusing but I think when we realize that, for example, one file is run at a time (and hence why splitting a test file up helps parallelize it) helps to realize that the mocks should be cleared after they are setup in a given file.

title: Remove tracks through the JBrowse CLI
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

You can add tracks using the CLI but the only way to remove tracks is to directly edit the JSON file. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**

A CLI command that lets you remove tracks given the name or track id--and maybe the category as well (i.e remove all tracks for a given category).

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

The alternative right now is to edit the `config.json` directly (or for bulk removal, use a script). 

**Additional context**

Having many tracks or assemblies in the config exacerbates the issue.

title: Make the track selector button more obvious/intuitive
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

If a user closes the track selector after selecting some tracks, the only way to open the selector again is to press the track selector button on the top left of the view or to use the hamburger menu. Both are a bit unintuitive (since initially you select tracks with a button in middle of the view).

**Describe the solution you'd like**

1. Change the button from an icon to text and move it to the far right of the screen (i.e the same side as the track selector). 
2. Make it so you can click the button to toggle the track selector open and closed. Currently, it only opens the selector, after which you have to close using the cross button. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

Instead of changing the button from icon to text, it might be better to simply include the icon in the initial select track button. The consistency would then help the user make a connection between the icon and its function. In this case a bit of pop-up text to the tune of "Select Tracks" when hovering over the button would also help clarify things.

**Additional context**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12467607/96050375-7dbdf500-0e47-11eb-94eb-fee749e0e302.png)
This is clear enough, but once we have selected a track and closed the track selector...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12467607/96051372-5b2cdb80-0e49-11eb-9f81-4779d113592e.png)

It's not clear that the user should use the view's hamburger menu or the little button to the left to bring back the track selector for that view. Moving this button closer to the track selector and changing it's appearance so its more consistent with the initial button the user is presented with would help the user understand its function.

title: Replace the blank screen on startup
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

When starting JB2 in an new session you get an uninformative blank screen:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12467607/96048551-c58f4d00-0e44-11eb-8547-feecedb49eb2.png)

It's not entirely intuitive where the user is supposed to go from here.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

I think one possible solution would be to replace this screen with the "previous sessions" menu that was presented in this week's lab meeting (Oct 13. 2020). This would allow a returning user to quickly go back to what they were doing without having to navigate through the toolbar. For new users, maybe just a "start new session" box. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

We might also think about extending this idea wrt recommendations and analytics. For instance, we could use the "session gallery" to present recommended sessions as thumbnails and record which ones are chosen (a way to do A/B testing).

**Additional context**

Here's a quick mockup:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12467607/96049310-d68c8e00-0e45-11eb-9cd8-03a8ed976c73.png)

title: Make hierarchical track selector folds closed by default
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

When there are many tracks and many categories, having all the category folds open by default makes scrolling through the track selector unwieldy. The search filter is useful when you know the name (either in part or whole) of the track you're looking for but if you're searching for a track through the categories, it can be annoying to have to close all the folds.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Make all the folds closed by default.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

Another good alternative might be an "open all/close all folds" toggle. 

**Additional context**
For an example of this see: http://hg38.jbrowse.org/jb2_track_test

title: allow admin to refer to tracks/datafiles by MD5, to minimize duplication from overlaps
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

We're trying to set up JBrowse (human/cancer) to come "fully loaded" with default datasets. However, many of the datasets we would like to include are supersets/subsets/overlapping with each other.

For example, the UCSC dataset (and to a lesser extent Ensembl) overlap with a lot of the other datasets of interest: UCSC has the Uniprot protein domains, GDC tracks for tissue types, gnomAD exome/genome tracks, 1000genomes, TCGA gene and transcript expression data and a few others not mentioned here but probably also relevant (e.g targetDb, gtex, dgv). 

(h/t @shihabdider)

**Describe the solution you'd like**

In the config files for these tracks, if we could refer to files via their MD5 (or SHA-whatever) hash, we would not pay any penalty for duplication. (If we re-use styling and other metadata sections of the config file, and use MD5 hashes for those files, we can readily duplicate their config too.)

Ways I can imagine doing this:

1. A crude but effective way to do it, that can still easily be implemented in an S3 bucket or other dumb static site, is by hacking the filenames. Effectively demand a part of the  simply to define a by-convention REST API something like `/cache/0123456789abcdefdeadbeefcode6502` where `0123456789abcdefdeadbeefcode6502` is the MD5 hash of the file. This can be easily implemented in multiple ways on different servers, e.g. by creating a parallel set of symlinks/hardlinks/redirects/301s/307s etc, or using a DynamoDB cache, or whatever. Maybe you add slashes to the path to break up the MD5 hash, e.g. `/cache/slash4/0123/4567/89ab/cdef/dead/beef/code/6502` to avoid overburdening filesystems... though that is messier...
2. Perhaps more sophisticated (and/or complimentary) would be to add an assertion about the MD5 hash of the file, which the client could use when trying to GET it from the server, e.g. by using the (not very consistently-supported, officially-obsolete) [Content-MD5](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1544) header field, or (by convention) adding "&md5key=0123456789abcdefdeadbeefcode6502" to the URL query parameters

Not sure of the best way... these are just ideas... it seems like this (MD5 caching to detect/avoid repetition) should be a "solved problem"


**Describe alternatives you've considered**

I mean, you can already DO this if you want, completely as part of the data pipeline. Just store files by hash name, and/or create those symlinks from `/my/track/datafile.bam` to `/cache/0123/4567/89ab/cdef/dead/beef/code/6502` on the server filesystem. But even if we do it hackily/idiosyncratically like this, might there be room a JBrowse convention for how to do it, that adds value... e.g. defining a policy/schema for admins to make Content-MD5 assertions about data files at particular paths (or URLs generally, including possibly external URLs) from within the config file?

title: Make base color part of the theme
body:
As discussed in #1270, this PR adds "bases" to the color theme, so different components can use the same configurable color for base colors.

* Uses base color in sequence, pileup, and SNP coverage tracks
* Uses `theme.palette.bases.${BASE}.contrastText` or `theme.palette.getContrastText(baseColor)` for more consistent and accurate determination of optimal text color. Also will log a warning in development if neither white nor black text provide adequate contrast.
* Uses Material-UI default colors for default base colors

title: Proposal to change linear-genome-view to linear-view
body:
I've noticed that LinearGenomeView doesn't really match the naming scheme of the rest of our views. For example, we have CircularView not CircularGenomeView, or DotplotView not DotplotGenomesView. I propose changing it to LinearView (or at least changing the name of the package to `@jbrowse/linear-view` instead of `@jbrowse/linear-genome-view`).

If people like the current name, or if it's too ingrained to change it, that's fine with me. I just thought I'd bring up in case we wanted to change it before we publish things.

title: Updates for publishing
body:
This PR is some preparation for publishing the plugins as packages.

* Moves packages from the `@gmod` to the `@jbrowse` npm namespace, following essentially the same naming scheme that `@babel` uses:
  * Core packages look like e.g. `@jbrowse/cli`, `@jbrowse/core`
  * Plugins look like e.g. `@jbrowse/plugin-alignments`, `@jbrowse/plugin-circular-view`
  * Third-party plugins would be named something like `jbrowse-plugin-stuff` or `@scope/jbrowse-plugin-stuff`
* package.json files have been updated to be more consistent and have more information
  * "author" on all packages is now "JBrowse Team"
  * Added homepage, bugs, repository, and keywords to most packages
    * I added "jbrowse" and "jbrowse2" as keywords, any others I should use?
  * Added to each package `"private": true` or `"publishConfig": {"access": "public"}`, depending on whether or not it should be published
    * For now only publishing plugins that `@jbrowse/react-linear-view` will use, not publishing others
* Remove `generator-jbrowse` package. It might still be a good idea to have a generator for plugins someday, but that package probably wouldn't even be a good starting point for a future generator.
* Rename gff3tabix plugin to gff3, in line with the naming for our other plugins (e.g. variant and bed plugins, which have inside them vcfTabix and bedTabix adapters)

title: Use conventional commits to fix changelog generation
body:
This is a proposal for #1257 

This adopts "conventional commits" and adds a git commit hook to make sure we try to keep this up to date

Commit messages use a format like "fix(packagename): description of fix" or "feat(packagename): description of feature" 

There are other types like build:, chore:, ci:, docs:, style:, refactor:, perf:, test:, refactor:, and more. The packagename is also a freetext, it doesn't automatically have to associate with any specific package from our monorepo, but it is probably best to use the monorepo package names.


Following this, I tested out a "release process" using

```
npx lerna version prerelease --no-push --no-git-tag-version

```

This generated changelogs for the release process locally

This automatically instantiated CHANGELOG.md files in all packages across the board. I removed these from the PR since it was a test release but think this is basically a way forward. There is still the behavior of things that depend on core getting their version bumped if core gets it's version bumped. This will result in the dependencies CHANGELOG having a note about what changed in core.

There is an alternative system called lerna-changelog that inspects your github repository for PRs and stuff, and is used by the docusaurus repo which was a point of comparison, but I couldn't get it to work and I think conventional commits is a bit more striaghtforward

title: Bump electron from 9.1.1 to 9.3.1
body:
Bumps [electron](https://github.com/electron/electron) from 9.1.1 to 9.3.1.
Release notes

Sourced from electron's releases.

electron v9.3.1

Release Notes for v9.3.1

Fixes

  • Added missing module delay loads on windows to reduce per process reference set impact. #25437 (Also in 9, 10, 11)
  • Fixed a crash in the renderer process when invoking the Badging API. #25371 (Also in 9, 10, 11)
  • Fixed a memory leak in net.request(). #25382
  • Fixed multiple dock icons being left in system when calling dock.show/hide on macOS. #25301 (Also in 8, 9, 10, 11)

Other Changes

  • Security: backported fix for 1081874. #25389
  • Security: backported fix for 1098860. #25289
  • Security: backported fix for 1111737. #25391
  • Security: backported fix for 1122684. #25390

Unknown

  • Added support for some chrome.management APIs. #25344 (Also in 9, 10, 11)

electron v9.3.0

Release Notes for v9.3.0

Features

  • Added back a previously broken visibleOnFullScreen option for setVisibleOnAllWorkspaces. #25126
  • Added the currencyCode field that Apple's StoreKit in-app-purchasing library provides but has not been added to the Product object that inAppPurchase.getProducts returns. #25085

Fixes

  • Fixed powerMonitor not emitting suspend/resume events on some Windows machines. #25165
  • Fixed an issue where filters set in dialogs on macOS would have nondeterministic ordering. #25194
  • Fixed an issue where notifications with a reply button could potentially be destroyed too early when a user clicked on the notification body before replying. #25101
  • Fixed frameless window's size being changed when restored from minimized state. #25045
  • Fixed network permission error when there are multiple WebContents sharing same session are created with web security disabled. #25179
  • Fixed node's TLS stack not allowing renegotiation. #25041
  • Fixed the following issues for frameless when maximized on Windows * fix unreachable task bar when auto hidden with position top
  • fix 1px extending to secondary monitor
  • fix 1px overflowing into taskbar at certain resolutions
  • fix white line on top of window under 4k resolutions. #25218
  • Fixed window size being changed after unmaximizing. #25133

Unknown

  • Fixed not working WebSQLDatabase in extension background pages. #25070

Fixes

title: Warning in tests/MainThreadRpcDriver: useLayoutEffect does nothing on the server
body:
This warning shows up in tests on master branch (see e.g. [here](https://travis-ci.com/github/GMOD/jbrowse-components/builds/188210623)) and anytime that MainThreadRpcDriver is used:

```
Warning: useLayoutEffect does nothing on the server, because its effect cannot be encoded into the server renderer's output format. This will lead to a mismatch between the initial, non-hydrated UI and the intended UI. To avoid this, useLayoutEffect should only be used in components that render exclusively on the client. See https://fb.me/react-uselayouteffect-ssr for common fixes.
```

It looks like this is related to Material-UI, and the warning appears when server-side rendering is done in an environment where a DOM is detected (like when everything is done in the main thread, which we do in out tests). Further reference: https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/issues/15798

title: Bump electron from 9.1.1 to 9.3.0
body:
Bumps [electron](https://github.com/electron/electron) from 9.1.1 to 9.3.0.
Release notes

Sourced from electron's releases.

electron v9.3.0

Release Notes for v9.3.0

Features

  • Added back a previously broken visibleOnFullScreen option for setVisibleOnAllWorkspaces. #25126
  • Added the currencyCode field that Apple's StoreKit in-app-purchasing library provides but has not been added to the Product object that inAppPurchase.getProducts returns. #25085

Fixes

  • Fixed powerMonitor not emitting suspend/resume events on some Windows machines. #25165
  • Fixed an issue where filters set in dialogs on macOS would have nondeterministic ordering. #25194
  • Fixed an issue where notifications with a reply button could potentially be destroyed too early when a user clicked on the notification body before replying. #25101
  • Fixed frameless window's size being changed when restored from minimized state. #25045
  • Fixed network permission error when there are multiple WebContents sharing same session are created with web security disabled. #25179
  • Fixed node's TLS stack not allowing renegotiation. #25041
  • Fixed the following issues for frameless when maximized on Windows * fix unreachable task bar when auto hidden with position top
  • fix 1px extending to secondary monitor
  • fix 1px overflowing into taskbar at certain resolutions
  • fix white line on top of window under 4k resolutions. #25218
  • Fixed window size being changed after unmaximizing. #25133

Unknown

  • Fixed not working WebSQLDatabase in extension background pages. #25070

electron v9.2.1

Release Notes for v9.2.1

Fixes

  • fix loading shared worker scripts over custom protocol
  • fix crash when loading worker scripts with nodeIntegration enabled. #24750
  • Fixed a crash that could occur when using in-memory sessions. #25002
  • Fixed an issue where some Node.js methods would not work with URL instances constructed in the renderer process. #24862
  • Fixed an issue where the Save button did not function in PDF previews. #24996
  • Fixed inactive windows having active titlebar on Windows. #24873
  • Fixed missing guid parameter in Linux crash reports. #24898
  • Increased maximum length for crash keys from 127B to 20KB. #24854
  • [a11y] fix an issue where voiceover doesn't read the first item selected from a ARIA combobox. #25004

Other Changes

  • Backported the fix to CVE-2020-6532: Use after free in SCTP. #24887
  • Backported the fix to CVE-2020-6537: Type Confusion in V8. #24885
  • Resolve network issues that prevented RTC calls from being connected due to network IP address changes and ICE. (Chromium issue 1113227). #24997

Unknown

  • Fixed issues with CORS when making requests from extensions. #24915

... (truncated)

title: Auto-remove tracks with non valid config references in view->afterAttach
body:
Ref
https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/560

Procedure to test

Open a couple tracks
Delete one of those tracks from the config.json
Refresh the page

Expect: The track that was deleted will not be present on the refreshed page

Note that "all views would need to implement this functionality" as implemented here

title: Make sort, show soft clipping stateful aspects of the track
body:
This is a breakout from the #1231 branch

Moves sorting from volatile to real track state

This also required updating AlignmentsTrack's autorun to make it capable of reloading the subtrack state

This would allow you to send a "session link" with a sort enabled on it. I like to imagine a screenshot service if that seems kind of unuseful.

Other track states like color scheme, linking reads etc were attempted in #1231

title: Changing zoom level removes the pileup sorting
body: Known about this for awhile but just wanted to make sure it is documented. Changing the zoom level removes the sorting, and you can't re-apply the sorting without clearing and then sorting again

title: Remove "flag helpers" from the BAM/CRAM features
body:
- Removes the "flag helpers" from the BAM/CRAM features, emphasizing to use the feature.get('flags') directly
- Reflection on the prototype getters for the BamSlightlyLazyFeatures features, similar to how it is  done for CramSlightlyLazyFeatures
- Use MD and CIGAR capitalized in the codebase, making capitalization sensitivity a bit higher (pre-serialization doesn't toLowerCase)

Note that we could keep the flag helpers if it's helpful for, perhaps, callback writers, but I think it's probably more confusing than helpful.

title: Move control of spacing/size to theme
body:
This is a proposed add-on to #1270 and #1255.

This changes the default props of various of the Material-UI components to use smaller versions (e.g. `size="small"`, `margin="dense"`) using the theme. We were already manually specifying most these props anyway. This way they can be specified in one place and we don't have to worry about specifying them each time they are used. Also, someone could override the theme and use bigger components if they wanted.

title: Improve theming
body:
* Convert theme to typescript
  * This means we can use `theme.tertiary` without ts-ignoring it, since a JBrowse theme will always have the property
* Theme can be customized with top-level config
  * Theme object defined in configuration will be deep-merged into the JBrowse theme defaults before running `createMuiTheme`. Can override colors, spacing, font size, etc. using this, e.g.:
```json
{
  "configuration": {
    "theme": {
      "primary": { "main": "#ff0000" }
    }
  }
}
```
* Use ThemeProvider when rendering in worker and hydrating in main thread so renderer can use theme
* Get rid of last two remaining SCSS files. One was removed, one was converted to use `makeStyles`/`useStyles`.
* Use react-syntax-highlighter instead of prism for highlighting config slot code, which removes the last CSS dependency
* Remove `mini-css-extract-plugin` workaround from JBrowse Web since it doesn't have any CSS anymore (fixes #37)

As a demo of how the renderer can respond to the theme, here's what the DivSequenceRenderer now does, lightening up the colors to provide more contrast on a dark background:

**Before:**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/95139763-7d787800-072a-11eb-91a7-86698db9a1f7.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/95139889-c6c8c780-072a-11eb-8587-e76e40e08883.png)

**After:**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/95139787-88cba380-072a-11eb-9b43-ca1d57434344.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/95139811-97b25600-072a-11eb-9686-d59dcfeb70c6.png)

title: Replace "Spreadsheet view" with "Tabular view"
body: I think following #1162 we will go back to the old terminology, but maybe calling it "Tabular view" rather than just "Tabular data". Possibly "Tabular data view" if it seems still vague

title: Fix SV inspector view
body:
PR #1249 broke SV inspector view unfortunately. Basically the cause was that we created generatedTrackConf but this was not added to the tree so using showTrack(generatedTrackConf.trackId) and then using resolveIdentifier did not work

I made it so there is an alternative interface, addTrackConf, on the circular view model, that helps with this scenario

I tried using a viewTrackConfs similar to what exists on dotplot/synteny views, e.g. adding the config to the tree to a specialized spot on the view only, but this made the live updating after spreadsheet filters were applied not update the view.

title: Add a sequence cache backing indexed fasta
body:
This adds a sequence cache for the indexed fasta

I found that trying to view the HG0096 high cov dataset was quite slow even when pretty zoomed in

Performance tracking revealed many many unzipping operations for tiny chunks of the bgzip indexed fasta

This is due to seqFetch calculating the MD tag for BAM, trying to unzip very tiny chunks sequence data repeatedly, e.g. each feature. Note that CRAM also benefits here since it uses the same seqFetch strategy



This adds a cache layer that extracts sequence chunks 128kb in size, and then slicing that as needed, for all operations involving sequence fetches. This is easier than trying to optimize the seqFetch operation specifically

Speedup

Before: 110s 
After: 20s

Viewing a 45kb region

title: Add disableRestoreFocus to Popovers in rubberband
body:
Looking at #1193 a clue was that changing Popover to divs stopped this from happening

Then I found this issue thread https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/issues/10072

This appears to fix #1193

title: Bump mobx-react version
body:
Currently I was seeing a warning (on master, have seen it for awhile) where dragging on the overview scale bar would cause a React warning about setState from another component running 
https://reactjs.org/blog/2020/02/26/react-v16.13.0.html#warnings-for-some-updates-during-render


Looking at the stack trace as recommended yielded a useForceUpdate in mobx code.

Found a lengthy thread that I didn't read entirely but found that updating mobx-react made the warning go away. Looks like it does something like "queued force updating now"

https://github.com/mobxjs/mobx-react-lite/issues/274 
https://github.com/mobxjs/mobx-react-lite/pull/299/files

Upgrading to the latest version printed a console log message said batchingForReactDom is not needed, so that is removed now too

title: Dotplot gets confused when there are overlapping displayed regions
body:
![t1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/94980851-79b2de80-04fb-11eb-8594-d64f9ab0b5ed.png)

We could (a) solve this so it handles overlapping regions or (b) try to ensure non-overlapping displayed regions

It might be some combination of those

title: Add ability to view file info in dialog box
body:
This is a proposal for #1207 

* Adds a getInfo function for BamAdapter,CramAdapter,VcfTabixAdapter that returns some header info
* Makes an RPC call for CoreGetInfo that can be fed an adapter config, and adapters can respond with a getInfo function
* Tries to make things like entries from the BAM header usefully visible even though they are sort of complicated little structures. We could print raw text but instead we print JSON-ified versions of the header (because this is what both BamAdapter and CramAdapter expose, they don't provide raw text currently though we could if needed)
* Track config snapshot is also displayed
* The SQ lines from the BAM header are hidden by default because there could be many thousands if there are a large number of refseqs, but there is a button to show them called "Show hidden entries"
* Copies some display code similar to BaseFeatureDetail, but doesn't import that code directly as a dependency


![t11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/94978209-592e5880-04ea-11eb-911c-42036a878254.png)
![t1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/94978206-57fd2b80-04ea-11eb-8745-9aa6d2172742.png)
![t1243](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/94978207-5895c200-04ea-11eb-8885-7ba6afef4339.png)

title: 1246 flaky admin test
body:
I was able to reproduce the flaky error in the tests for `admin-server` from #1246 .

Occasionally, there would be an error where the string match in `killExpress()` which I use to kill the express server after tests where it is started would return `null`. I got rid of posting `adminKey` for the shutdown, and the flakiness seemed to go away. 

I'm not totally sure what would cause this to intermittently fail, since the match would have to work once before hitting this code. But seems to be solved. The adminKey would already have been checked in the test, and this change doesn't affect test logic.

title: Create a framework for changelogs generation
body:
Currently autogenerated changelogs are kind of insane like this

https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/blob/master/packages/core/CHANGELOG.md


I'm not sure what is really happening there, maybe it just needs a brain reset or maybe there is something that needs doing

Options include, just investigating issue, investigating more standard lerna practices, or handwritten changelogs. I'm not opposed to handwritted ones necessarily, but it is a chore across many different packages.

title: "Max height reached" indicator stays even when navigated away from the region where it was triggered
More compact UI
body:
This is an attempt at a more compact user interface

Things that it touches

1) More compact menus
2) Making global typography smaller
3) Use FormGroup row to keep controls inline in the header, and make them all the same height (kind of annoyingly intricately hardcoded still but might be a little better). There was some sensitivity to changing things like theme.spacing e.g. from 4->8 caused the lgv header layout to get distorted, so hopefully this is a little better
4) Removes the little x icon on the refseq dropdown

It has to manually specify the height of certain things, but it puts them all in a little better and more consistent vertical spacing

![t2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/94656709-6d960980-02ce-11eb-8c8e-4edaa0e13048.png)
![t1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/94656711-6e2ea000-02ce-11eb-89d2-7694047c73c3.png)

title: Make static block calculation tied to window width, and remove extra block
body:
This fixes #718 and also removes, at least by default, the usage of the "extra" block concept.

The extra block concept means that an extra block on either side of the normal calculation is added. This was done early on by me in order to make sidescrolling feel faster by pre-empting the data to the left and right of the screen. My feeling is that currently, this might downloads more data than is needed especially with large data files (however with long reads, large amounts of data to the left and right are parsed anyways since the reads are just very long)

Using this branch results in ~20% speedup (saves 10 seconds, 50s vs 60s) on a ultra long read BAM dataset from nanopore 

http://localhost:3000/?config=test_data%2Fconfig_demo.json&session=eJztVltv2jAU_ivIT5vEJQQoJW-02wpTx1BBrbRpQiY5JN4SO7MdwkX89x0nGYQBlaZVe-oDCM7t-3x8PttbwmkExCEjSCsTUIoJXrEt26pZvZrdm9q207pyOq16p9v8QqokotJnnDhWlXiSpiCfmKcD4rSu21WyZJAq4nzdEuaZkq1-KB9tNsQ8j6k4pOtRDhb4zR4a9To2_-4ZByrvgIsIHrEEesRioUCPV8S5sq-adq_Vqlt297rdtrpVMo_HII2vua8L3gP4SD1Hl7AogJpYS2kqdcYYONKy2z27Y13ZmCxhCVIBGhc0VFAlVCmI5uERzd03JCqp-6O0Mg7v2oxZ0eawiH7IfB4B12pqgtERAPMDBEa0KnEFXzA_kVQjS1OBchELCbMkxOKh4D5mjFkISZznOwXUksvBbfoxeUwPWOW4A07TOsXZnk_J1jP0zvKYxVnobLU2qyumY3BnWXZlVARX9sGVNzf9T28reQo5bqDpV95C7KBLNfhCro3tbti_MTbq0ViDLLG8oVG_MOI20-heuPuFJJKZLdE6Vk6joVp1GtGN4DRVdVdEje9zKVIFdSH9hp-NkmoY8EbGtWbI1gTXs0C1ul5nFgcUN76OGGRXJYx7sDIg4X8AxA8jO0RV8DMB7kL_tA_-hsUfKE7uoR0L8_dyQy7SyfKyn_UFrfsbs94FZS9QCb-ZqYZkX6IalsG27IwscTskKtNUywf3oTCdTPTegXmTpf8BqE4knAk_49xlaJPR-FbgOUB9OFae7PQ7UcreXx-EdxJ7UF_7GfGdSXtWgYrHbhH_VzIs5f27FkukD0Ookvmral9Ve6raP2Vbmp5zYjzj3eXNDcHV5jY3Voa3okMMWRWI9HcGcbRMILflh0BuMRd1wDwYAPUMWnGnH0yfMd88UfauTISTDFLIaU4tYAgi3YC5NCQ5SKbZezqHUJWxb_GyB2keL0VBQyBlng86a0G50rSMtD9hLkfsT5zBpZCnDIiYQycMaZy9YrZmSFiIrKaw0qZ1-Zvs6C1m2kxdzZbwtOe6y84ujoVxGoYctxgHPHPsfgFDtX_f

Tying the static block calculation to window width makes it so that opening/closing a drawer does not cause a rerender, which can take awhile for larger datasets, so it feels much snappier. I think tying it to window width is not really a bad option either. Can imagine that it's a little less "pure" that manually providing the width but it works well here

title: Create remove-track CLI command
Hold shift + click-and-drag to rubberband
body:
This is a jbrowse1-ism that is kinda nice. If the entire screen is filled up with tracks, currently have to scroll up to the header to zoom

Alternatively, could have sticky headerbar....

title: Multi-variant-viewer track
body:
This can be really handy if there are multiple samples in a VCF to see the various calls for each sample

The HG002 trio whatshap VCF is an example of this

title: Make jbrowse2 homepage go live on jbrowse.org
body:
We want the jbrowse.org/jb2/ to go live on the jbrowse.org proper

currently the website is as follows
jbrowse.org/ ← generated by docusaurus1
jbrowse.org/docs/* ← generated by docusaurus 1


we then also have
jbrowse.org/jb2/<-- generated by docusaurus 2
jbrowse.org/jb2/docs/ ← also generated by docusaurus 2

we want to make it so that:
jbrowse.org/ ←  jb2 overwrites this page only, and make jb1 stop overwriting this page
jbrowse.org/jb2/ <-- stores the rest of jb2 content
jbrowse.org/docs <-- keeps storing jb1 documentation?


this might be somewhat challenging to achieve

The alternative "nuclear" option is to break all our jb1 documentation pages, make jb1 docusaurus start deploying to say jbrowse.org/jb1/ and then make jb2 write to jbrowse.org/ without a subfolder

title: Add ability for showTrack,hideTrack,toggleTrack to be linked via onAction
body:
Currently, onAction is used to "link views" in things like breakpoint split view and synteny view

Basically if it receives an action from one view, it can forward that action to the other views

However, things like showTrack/hideTrack/toggleTrack cannot be used like this, because onAction is not able to handle MST state models as arguments coming through the system

It suggests passing only MST identifiers through the arguments

Therefore this changes showTrack/hideTrack/toggleTrack to use trackId as an argument


Xref #754

title: Clicking away from a feature doesn't necessarily unselect it
body:
![t1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/94576437-52ca8300-0243-11eb-81f6-c66b9ab5c362.png)


If I have this feature selected, and I click below it, it does not get unselected because the SVG canvas is actually only as tall as the feature itself so I am clicking off the SVG canvas if I click below it

This is slightly unintuitive, but maybe not enough to warrant a big concern....

title: Fix insertion positioning in horizontally flipped mode
body:
This uses 0 length insertions to correctly position the insertions in both forward and reversed (horizontally flipped) modes

Note that the real bug started because CRAM encoded the insertion length into the mismatch.length field but this is meant for length-on-reference, so this caused an issue

BAM used insertion length 1, and had a comment that was carried from jb1-jb2 but was originally committed in 2013 that said

//// GAH: shouldn't length of insertion really by 0, since JBrowse internally uses zero-interbase coordinates?


commit 7bdcebe8947815d657d5ea9832e73dc35965c6e7

Well, now it is length 0

We will need to see if there are ramifications to this but this fixes forward and reverse rendering of insertions in my initial testing

title: Fix issue where the rubberband guide would change basepair label in the middle of basepair
body: On current master when hovering over a base, the coordinate changes in the middle of the base. This is due to a math.round in pxToBp, and changing to a Math.floor appears to fix in both forward and horizontally flipped versions

title: Virtualized scroll for track selector
body:
This is an initial pass at implementing a virtualized tree for the track selector

This is a demo with missing pieces, but it does have some expected functionality



Notes

(a) There is no way to turn on a connection e.g. no area for this in the track selector
(b) The "height of the virtualized tree" has to be pre-specified, and to avoid having a scroll within a scroll in the drawer panel, I  do some tricks to calculate how tall the virtualized area is
(c) The nodes are not styled, it is a plain `<input type="checkbox">` basically. We could possibly adopt some material-ui styling but unclear if that would be compatible
(d) Sometimes there are some blank gaps in the virtualized tree, see below
(e) Tests don't pass due to not being able to click htsTrackEntry currently, not sure why there
(f) Unclear how very long track names or category names can work, the react-virtualized-tree has a demo for this (nodes with automeasure https://diogofcunha.github.io/react-virtualized-tree/#/examples/node-measure)
(g) Track filter doesn't work yet but we might be able to do something about this


![t111](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/94378711-94e7ad80-00f9-11eb-86d4-945efa511339.png)

title: Add assembly fix when outside of directory
body:
With this PR I can say


jbrowse create mydir
jbrowse add-assembly ~/volvox.fa --out mydir --load copy

This will copy the files in there and copy them

I also make --out a synonym of --target, and allow using only the foldername instead of directly pointing to a config.json file. This much more commonly matches my expectations of a "data directory", which is what we are building with these commands (files are copied to the directory, etc making the fact that this is a directory an important feature)

 I can propagate this through other files beyond add-assembly if it makes sense.

I also remove the check for manifest.json

I find this check for manifest.json does not fit with my expected workflow with the jbrowse app, and propose removing it. I prefer to not have to type --skipCheck or --force or some combination of this for every command that I run, and would like to not have to be inside the directory to use the command without --skipCheck

title: jbrowse add-assembly with --target  doesn't copy data to the right place
body:
```
bin/run create testing
bin/run add-assembly ~/volvox.fa --load copy --target testing/config.json
```

This will not copy the volvox.fa into the testing directory, it copies it into the current directory

title: Rehaul session setup
body:
NEED TO DISCUSS: How to handle local storage filling up
Option 1: Use sessionStorage over localStorage. sessionStorage persists across refresh and restore, but does not persist across different tabs and is cleared upon tab closing. Only when user hits save UI button does the current session get saved to localStorage. This way localstorage fills slower. Saved sessions refer to everything in local storage

Option 2: Use localstorage, add a saved key to the value saved in local storage. Currently, local storage looks like =
key: uuid
value: { sessionObject }
With this would be changed to
key: uuid
value: { session: {sessionObject}, saved: boolean }
Then on tab close, localStorage garbage collects itself and clears all objects without the saved: true. Saved get flipped to true when user hits save UI button. This options allows for the same current session to persist across tabs since localstorage has not run the garbage collection part yet

TODO: fix tests after above has been decided

This PR completely rehauls how sessions work. Instead of having a sessionQueryParam with the whole base64encoded session included in the URL, it works as follows
1. When user starts JBrowse, on new session it generates an uuid + current snapshot of the session and is saved to local storage. If the url contains a session param, it searches local storage for a matching uuid and loads that session
2. while user is working, the session is continually updated in local storage
3. when user wants to share, they click the share ui button which triggers a lambda function. The current session gets base64encoded and encrypted before being written to the DynamoDB. User will see a dialog box with their shareable URL, this URL contains the sessionID param that is used to look up the matching sessionId in DynamoDB, and it contains a password used to decrypt the data received back from the DB. This password only exists in the URL, no where else.
4. When another user receives the shared URL and loads the site, it will read from the DynamoDB using the sessionID, find the encrypted session, and send it back. Locally, the session will be decrypted and assigned a local uuid before being written into localStorage

savedSession has been changed, previously it was an array that was part of the jbrowseModel, and now it completely refers to the localStorage to find all savedSessions

default session naming has changed to be more readable, looks like New Session 2020-09-24 13:12:44

title: Simplify error reporting in CLI
body:
This proposes removing some try/catch in CLI code

It is a draft PR because more things could be addressed but I believe this aids error reporting. Related to discussion in #1230

title: Smaller dotplot dataset for integration test
body:
This addresses #1221 using a smaller dataset.  Given the infrequent flakyness hard to confirm whether this truly fixes but would hopefully help a bit. Provies a way to load a specific session via the test framework

Small dataset generated using 1000 lines via shuf  of the whole peach_vs_grape.paf

title: Fix hq_isoform.bam rendering with fixes to getTemplateLocalCoord
body:
Fix for #1235 

Instead of making "getTemplateLocalCoord ignore the N" which is what it currently does, and works ok when there was just one N in a read, we incorporate N for getTemplateLocalCoord which helps with isoseq which can have many N segments

Still draft PR for the moment

body:
This was a rendering bug with the skip/intron rendering that was triggered by long isoseq reads
