SV inspector doesn't currently run in the web build, add it and get it working.

May require removing URL sessions.

After doing this, send a beta of jbrowse-web to Keiran. :-)

title: Improve ability to toggle synteny data tracks
body:
Ref #726 

The synteny view is made of a bigchain on two or more datasets/genomes

It would be useful to toggle both on at once using a specialized track selector or customize the track selector in a way that does this more smoothly

title: NCList feature ID collision across chromosomes
body:
If you mouseover or select a feature when two chromosomes are open in NCList the feature is selected across views

The feature ID should probably include the refname

![s3 amazonaws com_jbrowse org_code_JBrowse-2 0 0-synteny-demo-alpha 0_index html_config=test_data_config_synteny_integration_test json (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/70662546-70871700-1c34-11ea-80a5-0fc739eb69bb.png)

title: Create jbrowse2 webpage with documentation intended for users
body:
To assist users with their work, I think it will be helpful to make a jbrowse 2 webpage with some documentation for end-users on things like

- what capabilities does jbrowse 2 have
- how to install
- how to add track
- how to add connection
- serialize sv inspector video script into a webpage perhaps

Probably use docusaurus and upload to jbrowse.org/jb2/

title: support having thousands of tracks
body:
Having thousands of tracks introduces some issues of scale. We may need react-window to reduce number of dom elements in track selector, or we may see mobx-state-tree performance issues, or other unexpected things

Create something like modencode test dataset, or larger

title: Spreadsheet view by itself overflows X causing horizontal scroll
body:
Similar to #667

Simply go to File->Open tabular data and you'll get x scrollbar

title: Synteny view type
body:
This is a template for a synteny view type

It instantiates a view similar to breakpoint split view that creates an overlay that spans multiple lineargenomeviews


Screenshot
![localhost_3000__config=test_data_config_synteny_integration_test json (5)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/70461681-40e6dc00-1a87-11ea-8ec7-e8d1c1909c47.png)


The screenshot shows human-mouse-rat as 4 different "tracks" which are loaded from the rbest chain files from e.g. http://hgdownload.cse.ucsc.edu/goldenpath/hg38/vsMm10/reciprocalBest/ http://hgdownload.soe.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/mm10/vsRn6/reciprocalBest/

The files are loaded as bigChain files, and the literal feature names are the same across both bigChain files allowing simple connectivity to be made.

If it ends up that we do not want to use literal tracks to plot this data, then we will need to create a system similar to a track since this code uses layoutFeatures and such

The idea that you open "tracks on each view" is similar to how breakpoint split view works, but it's possible that a new machinery would make this more usable

This PR exists as a template or draft perhaps for now to faciliate discussion for issues like

#54 
#115 
#116 
#724 


Note that #724 is being addressed by a featToBlock method that maps a feature ID to a given block, which then has the proper refname in it

title: Scary warning message on MacOS 10.15 on start up
body: **Describe the bug** After starting up the alpha release (JBrowse+2-2.0.0-beta.0-mac-2.zip) and clicking on one of the options for a new session, I got this dialog box: which is pretty scary. I didn't answer, so now all of thumbnails are empty. To allow thumbnails, users can open the "Security & Privacy" option in the System Preferences and then the Privacy tab. Select "Screen Recording" in the left panel and check JBrowse 2 in the right panel and authenticate if necessary. **To Reproduce** **Expected behavior** **Screenshots** **Version:** **Additional context**

title: Make breakpoint split view/synteny view tolerant of having multiple refNames in single row
body:
Currently there is a raw bpToPx that takes a genome coordinate and turns it into a pixel offset for drawing the squiggles/polygons

This is only working for when there is a single refName

When there are multiple refNames, it actually has to look at the displayedRegion list, find where it is in there, and get the offset

The kicker is that this requires refname-renaming-tolerant lookup of the feature's refName to the canonical refName in the displayedRegions. The LinearGenomeView.bpToPx can do this operation but it does not handle renamed refNames.

Also, this step is could be kind of slow  if it is not implemented carefully, so I would worry about making bpToPx just do a getCanonicalRefName


Options for this include

a) Attaching "canonical refName" (e.g. the one from the reference genome) to all features, or making refName equal to the "canonical refName" in all cases
b) Making getCanonicalRefName fast and not async

title: Get UCSC public hubs list as a trackhub-registry-type-connection
body: See https://genome.ucsc.edu/cgi-bin/hgHubConnect

title: get rid of configIds
body:
Tracks should just have trackId that is required, and enforced to be globally unique (this could be tricky with connections).

We should remove all other uses of configId from the codebase.

title: scroll to new view
body:
This PR does 2 things:

* restructures the top-level DOM of the app to be a `grid` layout. This fixes a few bugs in the scrolling and resizing behavior of the app.
** drawer position not updating when the window is resized to be small
** the top menu bar could be scrolled out of view, we don't want that

* adds a little div container for top-level views, and calls the [scrollIntoView](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/scrollIntoView) method on it to scroll the new view to be visible

This has the maybe non-ideal side effect of having the views scrolled to the bottom on initial load

fixes #642

title: Drag and drop to reorder LGV tracks
body: resolves #670

title: Create circular view of synteny
body: As long as we are on a synteny kick, circular displays are a popular way to visualize synteny. This would have two genomes on different sides of the circle

title: Opening up a feature drawer produces re-render of all data
body: Given that a rendering can be quite intensive, the action of clicking on a feature creating a full re-render can be surprising

title: JBrowse-web build and release automation
body: Similar to #539

title: Create error handlers for the use of IPC asyncs
body:
Many StartScreen useEffect async have no error handling

Furthermore, the listSessions crashes if you rm -rf ~/.config/JBrowse 2

title: Create integration test for SV inspector workflow
add sv inspector ability to show features from csv/tsv
body:
Need to
* auto-detect locstrings in data
* make GUI elements to allow users to see/set columns as being locstrings
* might also add data types for ref1, start1, end1, ref2, start2, end2 that would allow people to use ref/start/end in different columns

title: Highlight views (e.g. show which view's track selector is open)
body: When there are two LGVs displayed, it can get hard to tell which one an open track selector applies to. We could highlight the view (using CSS outline?) that has an open track selector.

title: Better display hierarchy of tracks and views
body: Sometimes it's hard to tell that e.g. a view is nested in another view. We could add padding to the left of nested views/tracks to better show that hierarchy.

title: Create dot plot viewer
body: Dot plots can be useful at many different genome scales from small to large in comparing genomes. Given that we can do many types of views, a dotplot could be very useful

title: Fix CRAM ref renaming by passing in originalRegion or originalRegions
body:
Fixes #593

This is important for CRAM


Note that potentially the CRAM adapter will be initialized twice because the getRefNames dataAdapterCache will not receive the sequenceAdapter config, and the dataAdapterCache reinitializes the store once it receives a sequenceAdapter config

title: GWAS display
body:
I think being able to display GWAS results would be pretty interesting

I think this is not yet a solved problem simply by way of our ability to do a linear genome view with displayed regions

I would consider some factors

a) block boundaries are unnecessarily large when you are zoomed very far out
b) the large amount of data may not lend itself well to svg, however with canvas you get into some difficulties with hit testing
c) if we just render it as a single block instead of with block boundaries, still needs some ability to zoom in
d) the displayedregions data structure will elide regions when really all regions should be rendered regardless of size, think genomes with many scaffolds, etc. and large lists of displayed regions have in the past been shown to cause performance problems

title: Packaging of the desktop app puts all files in current folder
body: I personally think this is an issue because it has happened on multiple platforms linux and mac, the unzip of the folder puts all the files in the current directory which is hard to clean up if you want to delete them, and is commonly just my download directory which contains other stuff

title: Add some CircularView model tests
body:
Following #697 I thought it could be useful to add some tests but we might just need to create some basic initialization of CircularView.test.js in the model and/or the component

Just a housekeeping tag

title: Make paste shortcut on Mac work in desktop
body:
Mac requires an app menu to be registered for any of the normal copy paste shortcuts

Therfore, we are just going to create the app menu on mac, on other platforms we'll leave it null because on linux and windows @garrettjstevens confirmed paste works fine

Did you like the breakpoint split view: 1-5 star
What would you change about it: free text
etc

The generated Linux zip is still named `jbrowse-desktop...stuff...zip`, it looks like it's hard-coded to use the package.json "name" (instead of "productName" like the others). We'll have to change it manually if we want.

title: Add "Delete track" function
body: There doesn't seem to be a way to delete a track from the UI yet

title: Dereference tracks on connection close
body:
When closing a connection, if any of its tracks are open in a view or a configuration editor drawer widget, it opens a prompt making sure you want to close before closing.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/69564663-a78cd580-0f70-11ea-8233-26fc5b5f84d7.png)

fixes #653

title: Fix issue with mouseover/feature selection appearing across chromosomes
body:
Some work was done earlier to make fast mouseovers happen with an rtree, but the features from all the blocks, regardless of whether it was across totally different chromosomes, would be combined into the same rtree.

This PR makes it so the rtree is actually block specific, so that multiple independent layouts do not clobber each other

title: Unnecessary fallback to node-fetch's?
body:
I see fairly often that the fallback to node-fetch has been triggered on data that should not trigger it (e.g. CORS friendly, etc)

Seems related to AbortSignal'ing e.g. side scrolling can cause it

title: Feature selection/mouseover duplicated across chromosomes
body:
The gaps track on the human data has weird behavior if you are zoomed far out where it selects across multiple chromosomes

Tooltip component also can receive undefined feature and needs to take that into account

![Screenshot from 2019-11-23 18-28-56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/69486901-57eac480-0e1f-11ea-92b4-4d1d751a7e36.png)

title: 570 add circular view toggle fit window
body:
Add a fit to window lock feature in circular view

On lock mode: User can only zoom in up til model takes up full window size. Zoom in is disabled further until user either zooms out, increases window size, or unlocks

On unlock mode: User can freely zoom in

Additionally added a disable for the zoom out when model hits max base pairs per pixel. 
Minor detail that needs review before completion: what course of action is needed in the edge case that user resizes the window so small that even the smallest model cannot fit fully

title: Make connection tracks un-editable, add ability to copy to local tracks
body: This way if you want to edit a connection track, you have to make a copy of it first.

title: FileSelector state gets lost when the existing type gets toggled
body: change URL to file, the URL is lost

title: FileSelector toggle button buggy
body: Poke at the material-ui ToggleButton classes

body:
This fixes #667 

It uses flexbox layout instead of absolute positioning for the SV inspector

Also the drag handle height was undefined, leading to there being no drag handle, this simply restores that

title: Locstring box should support renamed reference
Locstring box crashes on string chr2:1000-
body: Note trailing dash

title: Add more filters for spreadsheet view, especially column filters
body: If the text filter search box had a simple syntax for doing these filters it would be pretty nice, e.g. ?chrom1==17 and then it picks that up as part of a specialized search filter

title: Allow launching a split viewer from a Alignment track SA tag or paired read
body: Paired reads and SA tags in BAM files can be used to create a simple split view. A right-click action or from feature details would be appropriate

title: Create user script for the product demo
body:
In addition to turning the product over for users to play with, it may be valuable to create a user script where we provide a pre-defined set of files for users to test out and investigate.

We may create a screencast that parallels the operations of our script, or just use our script verbatim in dictating a screencast

title: Track add wizard enhancements
body:
These are possible enhancements for the add track wizard that are separate from the multi-track import type enhancement


a) Infer track name from filename/url filename
b) Possibly auto-infer the dataset if there is simply one dataset on the screen
c) Consider removing "Enter data manually" (FromConfig JSON features) as this is very niche

My personal preference is auto-populating fields is a win because then you have painless track imports, more data can be imported, more fun, etc.

title: Paired read connections
body:
This creates a basic paired read connection overlay

Even though this is not fully implemented to take advantage of all the details of paired reads, I think this is basically a sound contribution that can provide a solid starting point

It does a basic search of "hasPairedReads" similar to the existing switch on "hasTranslocations" and then calls some paired code, which then only plots the "not paired correctly" reads using the connectors, which is always turned on for cross-chromosomal pairs and other types of discordancies, and therefore filters out all the other normal paired end connections

![Screenshot from 2019-11-21 05-38-12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/69330559-260c0f00-0c21-11ea-9a6e-04491ec3a938.png)

title: PhyloCSF bigwig with local autoscale produces bad domain
body:
Specific file if you want to avoid the track registry loading

http://data.broadinstitute.org/compbio1/PhyloCSFtracks/hg19/latest/PhyloCSFRaw-0.bw

There is a funny thing happening where
a) There is a summary feature being returned that does not have scoreMin or scoreMax set on it
b)  JSON.stringify({x:Infinity}) gives {x:null} causing spooky mysteries

title: Trackhub registry produces GRCh37 (hg38) as a synonym
Put menu items for 'Open new track' and 'Open new connection' on menu
body:
This adds a bare-bones "Open new track" and "Open new connection" icons to the menubar. I think that this improves some discoverability of the mechanism

It also adds a global "snackbar message" on the session, and it opens one of these when the "Open new track" function ends up not automatically adding a track to a view

title: Add ErrorBoundary component for top level fatal error handling
body:
This is a redo of #675 

I did not significantly break up the previous PR because it was a bit difficult to disentangle some of the error dialog contents, since the dialog refactoring was sort of a part of this PR

The ErrorBoundary presents a refresh button on both jbrowse-web and jbrowse-desktop and has a Factory reset dialog for desktop only.

Other refactorings included making the presentational logic in JBrowse.js across both components a bit more modular with a custom hook for each and modularizing a couple core/ui components

fixes #654 
fixes #321

title: Add basic electron mock unit testing
location search box should accept abc:123-456 locstrings
body: We should support both styles of locstrings, either with a `..` or `-` separator

title: Fix IconButton not showing disabled coloring
body: Thanks @peterkxie for noticing that disabled IconButtons were not getting grayed out. This fixes that by moving the coloring from Icon to IconButton.

title: Fix elided region click
body:
This is a template that could fix elided region click (#669 ) by manually finding in the views displayedRegions rather than the blocks which can be elided blocks

Note that this loses refName renaming

title: Refactor start screen dialog components to be separate
body:
This modularizes some components of the start screen. I think in general, if we see code like "DialogComponent= ..." it suggests that this should be a separate component

I suppose this is debateable refactoring but I just some think of these components with many conditions and sub functions as needing breaking up

title: Add integration testing of the electron app
body:
The electron app is currently not given a integration test

It would be useful to do one or both of

1) Making a spectron test
2) Making mocked jest tests of the electron code

Spectron tests do not get code coverage from what I can tell https://github.com/electron-userland/spectron/issues/40

We don't do real in browser tests though, so we could take the stance that we don't do the full spectron tests, or we could go ahead and do it

title: Add react-error-boundary with App level fatal error message
body:
This adds a basic ErrorSnackbar error boundary at the App level and a "FatalError" component if something happens above the App level

Note: Handling errors is tough, for example a mobx-state-tree ambiguous ID is very hard to catch properly as it errors out many components who try to read it's conf

Also note: this can give a stacktrace in dev, but in prod everything is minimized. This maybe is an interesting question of whether we should just ship a dev build to end users so they can more easily report us back stack traces




Addresses #321

title: Make new CanvasFeatureRenderer
body: Many features in a single track can slow down the react renderer and give poor performance on the whole app. SVG gene tracks, repeat track, etc are examples of this. CanvasFeatures may improve performance

title: Add vertical cursor bar to line up features
body: This is done in jbrowse during mouseovers on the scale bar or when holding the shift key

title: Add arc rendering of large VCF events
body: The TRA are rendered as cross-chromosome in the breakpoint split view. Other large events like DEL could be rendered as arcs, similar to splitthreader

title: Add icon and fix name in JB desktop
body: Add icon (including .desktop file on linux) and standardize on "JBrowse 2" app name.

title: reorder tracks in LGV
body: Users need to be able to drag to reorder their tracks in LGVs.

title: If a chord is going to an elided region, clicking on the chord crashes trying to open the breakpoint split view
body:
a) View the SV inspector in a zoomed out way such that there are connections to elided regions
b) Click on a chord

title: Create multi-file importer
body:
We would like to have an optimized experience for adding tracks, sometimes someone has a list of URL or shift-selects a bunch of hard drives tracks.


The JBrowse 1 track selector is a good model for this

In JBrowse 2 we would need to

a) Make this available from the main menu bar
b) Make this available from the hierarchical track selector (+) icon

One aspect is that each of these components should be able to request from a "service discovery" point of view, what menu options are available for it, returning ["Add connection", "Add tracks", etc]

Then, the details of the multi-file importer will need

a) All the track types
b) All the data adapter types
c) List of file extensions that maps to those track types and store types (this already kind of exists, but maybe needs to become a thing where plugins can register a file extension)
d) The choice of which dataset to add the tracks to
e) Add method to data adapters to validate their configuration "is this a valid configuration"
f) A new "file type driver" method for the data adapters that registers how its configuration is loaded, see e.g. jbrowse 1 CRAMDriver.js and similar

title: SV inspector creates side-to-side scrollbar due to uncertain width calculations
body: If possible, probably best to not try to "manually detect scrollbar presense/absense"...use some CSS flow?

title: Make the BreakpointSplitView have header icons instead of dropdown menu
app signing for JB desktop on Windows
body:
In the desktop automated build, sign the electron app on Windows so users don't get scary modal dialogs.

depends on #539

title: app signing for JB desktop on MacOS
body:
In the automated build system, sign the app using our Apple Developer account so that users don't have to poke the MacOS security settings to run the app.

depends on #539

title: Make special color for split read alignment squiggles that do not physically connect
body: The alignment squiggles will make a best effort to connect reads based on read name, and can even connect the "right ends together" in many cases. However, sometimes, if you have a read fragmented into many chunks, and not all chunks are on the screen, then chunks that are not end-to-end connected will be drawn as such. If possible, use a different color for these lines perhaps

title: Add blank space at bottom of all views that assists in using resize handle
body: When the bottom of the screen is right next to the bottom of the last view, it's difficult to use the resize handle

title: On-disk caching in desktop version
body: This is a random idea but it could be useful to do on-disk caching for large data files. This is somewhat debateable but if it is a win for users viewing large datasets, I might support it. Samtools caches the index file in the directory you run it in just for a comparison

title: spreadsheet view support for larger data
body:
It was noted that a bottleneck of the spreadsheet is just large amounts of data on the screen. Also if a spreadsheet view is open it noticeably slows down e.g. the loading progress bar for a track. Closing the spreadsheet/sv inspector view speeds it back up

Noticed with the bedpe file from skbr3 open

title: URL input in SV inspector cannot take typed input
body:
It seems to lose focus as soon as you type a character in it.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73749/68884652-725aca80-06c8-11ea-93fd-16483e280219.png)

title: Translocation overlay
body:
This adds `<TRA>` features to the split view overlay

The TRA are 'one sided' instead of breakend which are twosided so it handles it a bit differently, and just draws to the coordinate y=0 on the other side of the break

Some example screenshots


![Screenshot from 2019-11-13 21-10-38](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/68821529-97195880-065c-11ea-8b7e-149ae54e3e0e.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-11-13 21-27-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/68821530-97195880-065c-11ea-90d7-58425f2deaaa.png)

title: sanitize-html component removes the strings with brackets e.g. <TRA> from output in BaseFeatureDetails
Enhance variant feature in breakpoint split view
body:
We defined a "connection type" that draws green variant feet between BND features in the breakpoint split view. Other types that may need supporting

- TRA
- DEL
- INV


TRA is a one sided feature
DEL, INV, and others are generally features that have a start and end on a single chromosome, but need to be connected in the breakpoint split view

title: Allow creating side-by-side view in the breakpoint-split-view
body: Instead of top and bottom, leverage displayed regions to load them side by side

title: Initial loading spinner hard to see
body: Initial loading startup spinner is hard to see, maybe following latest theme changes

title: Untoggling a connection causes any tracks open from connection to crash whole app
body:
Turn on the COSMIC connection
Turn on a track
Turn off the COSMIC connection
app crashes

This may require deleting the track if a connection is closed or copying its config somewhere else

Furthermore, gotta reign in the crash the whole app errors that can appear for various reasons, need a friendlier crash

title: Integrate color palette and logos
body:
This doesn't implement every single aspect of the mockup, but I think it does all the ones we can do easily. Here are some screenshots:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/68733261-48ec5280-0593-11ea-9439-834cd19761e4.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/68733277-56094180-0593-11ea-84b7-0599d4f7a467.png)

Resolves #648

title: Ability to change URL/File from config editor should be limited?
body:
I think that the ability to change the underlying file on a track is sort of awkward and error prone.

For instance, touching the file/URL toggle in the config editor for a track that is a local file makes the track instantly lose it's filehandle and go away with a 404 error, and this is then it gets saved to the config file essentially making the handle become lost.




![changing_refseq](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/68730819-00856280-059c-11ea-8324-4b3c99fae30a.png)

Here is a screenshot of changing the refseq volvox.2bit file accidentally, and then the entire app becomes un-reloadable (that is sort of a separate issue of our error handling, but a case in point). I might, for this case, make "are you sure?" dialogs or undos...perhaps the config editors in general need more undo functions

title: add menubar items for "add track", "add connection"
body:
Adding a new track depends on discovering the (+) button inside the track list, which in turn depends on finding out how to open the track list (some of the time, the track list is not automatically opened...perhaps something to consider)

I think it is an issue that users could have trouble with.

To remedy, I think that we should have an "Add track" and "Add connection" thing in the global menu bar. We already ask what dataset to add a track to anyways, so there is not necessarily anything special about activating it from inside the linear genome view.

title: session-specific tracks
body:
Here is a scenario:
I want to create a "session" that represents some work that I'm doing on a specific dataset or, say, patient. Imagine demoing the cancer dataset.

This patients cancer data is not necessarily something I want in all my sessions.

So it seems to me that tracks should have the ability to be session specific?

title: integrate new color palette and logo into desktop app theme
body: We've got a new color palette and logo. The color palette is below, and the logo assets are in the team drive.

title: Circular view errors on "show only regions with data"
body:
**Describe the bug**
When you click on "show only regions with data", the circular view disappears, two warnings show up in devtools:
```
windowWorker.js:47 Warning: Failed prop type: The prop `radius` is marked as required in `StructuralVariantChords`, but its value is `undefined`.
    in StructuralVariantChords
windowWorker.js:47 Warning: Failed prop type: The prop `bezierRadius` is marked as required in `StructuralVariantChords`, but its value is `undefined`.
    in StructuralVariantChord
```

**To Reproduce**
Describe here the steps to reproduce the behavior, e.g.:
1. Open new human SV Inspector with the file "packages/sv-inspector/test_data/pe.pos_sorted.pesr.bedpe"
2. Click "show only regions with data"

**Expected behavior**
Should show a circular view with one displayed region (chr10)

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Version:**
Desktop

**Additional context**
N/A

title: Remove selected feature concept
body:
Selecting a feature currently causes a full re-render and can take over 1.5 seconds with two tracks on the screen, causing the window to feel slow

This avoids a re-render by just drawing to the overlay

This will feel much snappier on human data

title: Unify test_data folder across jbrowse-desktop and jbrowse-web
body:
This unifies test_data across jbrowse-desktop and jbrowse-web

It also makes it so volvox data is only loaded in development

Note that adding NODE_ENV=development is needed to make electron.js see this flag since it might not see the webpack'd version of that env variable.

title: Connection track loading problems
body:
**Describe the bug**
Sometimes when a connection is active, closing the session and opening it creates track loading errors.

**To Reproduce**
1. Open a volvox LGV
2. Turn on the volvox UCSC track hub in the track selector
3. Open the BAM track
4. Go back to the welcome page and re-open the session, or refresh
5. Error is something like

```
[mobx] Encountered an uncaught exception that was thrown by a reaction or observer component, in: 'Reaction[9S4v8Ite/volvox:ctgA:1-1000 rendering]' Error: [mobx-state-tree] Failed to resolve reference 'xfifTjXBb' to type 'AlignmentsTrackConfigurationSchema' (from node: /session/views/0/tracks/0/configuration)
```

**Expected behavior**
Track should still be open and not error

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Version:**
Desktop

**Additional context**
N/A

title: Fix and re-enable TrackHubRegistry connections
body:
This uses `openLocation` from core instead of `fetch` any time the connection setup code tries to access a file associated with a hub. The calls to The Track Hub Registry API still use `fetch`, but that's because they need to set headers, query params, etc., and we don't have to worry about CORS for the API.

This also updates the code a bit since it looks like the API returns track hub info in a bit different format now. Unfortunately, the API version number doesn't look like it was changed. Since we can't guarantee the stability, once we have a good way of separating core and non-core plugins this plugin should probably not be in core anymore.

With this change, 23 of the 26 GRCh37 hubs in The Track Hub Registry look to be usable on desktop. The ones that don't work now are e.g. 404 errors when trying to fetch.

Resolves #636

title: when a new top-level view is added, scroll to it
body: When a new view is added at the top-level, we should scroll the app so that it's visible.

title: Desktop improvements
body:
This has some bugfixes and improvements to desktop user and dev experience:

- Electron window worker logs now appear in the main window's devtools console
- Recent session card names show full name in a tooltip
- Session renaming bugfixes, and also now renaming the current session from the menu bar is supported in desktop
- When in development, most recent session automatically loads on first load or refresh, so you can essentially refresh to the same session when developing

title: SV inspector view
body: adds an SV inspector top-level view that ties a spreadsheet view to a circular view

title: Configuration dialog for a bigwig track can display wrong URL
body:
If I select the config dialog for an ENCODE track and then go to the config for the SKBR3 coverage track the URL does not appear to be updated

![Screenshot from 2019-11-08 17-35-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/68515274-66958100-024e-11ea-8385-70ff88a13c36.png)

title: hide devtools if inDevelopment is not true
body: Hide the dev tools bar in production builds.

title: disable track hub registry connection
body: It doesn't work right now, needs #636, so just disable for now to get the release out.

title: Don't use fetch in TrackHubRegistry connection
body: Use openLocation from core instead so it can take advantage of Electron stuff.

title: Create loading and error screens for loading tracks from a connection
Trackhub registry warning
body:

title: Sequence file 404 results in uncaught promise
body:
The linear genome view will be empty after this error without error indication
```
rpc-error 1 getRegions Error: HTTP 404 when fetching test_data/volvox.2bit.garbage bytes 0-65535
    at AggregatingFetcher.fetchBinaryRange [as fetchCallback] (rangeFetcher.ts:53)
flushLog @ rpc.worker.js:27
web-rpc.js:229 Uncaught (in promise) Error: Error: HTTP 404 when fetching test_data/volvox.2bit.garbage bytes 0-65535
    at WebWorkerHandle.reject (web-rpc.js:229)
    at WebWorkerHandle.handler (web-rpc.js:192)
```

title: Turn off webSecurity on the web worker for the purpose of disabling same origin policy
body:
Discussed with @garrettjstevens 

This allows easier fetching of resources that have CORS blocked without stepping into node-fetch territory and there is no nodeIntegration on these workers

title: FilterTrack feature clicks non-functional
Remove blockState as a extra prop, assume it comes from track model
body: This is a miscellaneous change but it looked like it was unnecessary to pass blockState manually to the tracks, as the track models contain this info

title: Allow interacting with the AlignmentSplines
body:
This adds a menu option to allow interacting with the overlay

This enables easily mouseover-ing the svg splines, or when disabled, clicking on the underlying features.

This is basically the only option I can see besides rearchitecting the code to not use an overlay, as I don't think doing manual hit testing is going to work well

The onClick for an alignment spline does nothing at the moment

title: Support ref-renaming for connections (particularly ones with stores that don't have store classes that can be easily renamed)
Determine if/how to do inter-package dependencies
body:
One specific example we have currently is that `@gmod/jbrowse-plugin-linear-genome-view` package exports `BaseTrack`, `blockBasedTrackModel`, `BlockBasedTrack`, `basicTrackConfigSchemaFactory`, and `basicTrackStateModelFactory`, which are imported by any package that has a track.

Easiest thing to do is to put those all in core and say no inter-package dependencies are allowed, but it also means if someone else developed some track primitives for their plugins, they'd have to include them separately in every plugin.

title: when LGV has no tracks, should display a prompt
body: If an LGV has no tracks, it just looks like a ruler. It would be helpful for new users if it prompted them to "click the track selector button to add tracks"

title: Stringify config.json with whitespace on desktop
body: This is a small PR to just make the config/session json have some whitespace

title: 584 "help" and "about" info
body:
This adds some basic info to the "About" and "Help" drawer widgets. It also makes sure any links with `target="_blank"` open in the default browser and not a new electron window. Regular links might still be a problem, but I don't think we have any in the code for now.

It also adds some GitHub issue templates so that people creating issues have some guidance on what we need to best help them. There are three templates for bugs, feature requests, and questions. When you go to the new issue page, you can select the template you want or open a blank issue. It should look something like this:

![image](https://help.github.com/assets/images/help/issues/new-issue-page-with-multiple-templates.png)

title: Add button to reload errored block
body:
This just adds a simple "reload" button to the block error message that reloads the block. I tested by disconnecting my network, getting the error, reconnecting, and then clicking "reload". It seemed to work.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/68346263-ed145c00-00b0-11ea-9b07-156e691b67e5.png)

Resolves #445

title: BAM feature detail not reporting all tags
body:
Looking at the skbr3 BAM file there is a read that has tags like this


`AS:i:1794>NM:i:286> XI:f:0.8489>XS:i:0> XE:i:1794>XR:i:1845>MD:bunchofstuffhere>SV:i:2> QS:i:8> QE:i:1853>CV:f:99.5683> ID:i:78190> KB:f:96.843>SB:f:96.843`

The tags before the MD appear to be parsed but tags after the MD with its verylongstring do not show in the feature details (> indicates tab)

Issue found looking at `samtools view https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/genomes/hg19/reads_lr_skbr3.fa_ngmlr-0.2.3_mapped.bam 1:2063250-2063300|grep m141225_224611_42137_c100744692550000001823165807071543_s1_p0/99361/0_1853 `

This shows two reads which are identical except for one tag difference that is not shown in the feature dialog

title: color reference sequences in the circular view
body: Make some kind of default coloring for chromosomes in the circular view. Just looks prettier.

title: Enable local file opening on desktop
body:
Adds a new file selector config slot editor and enables selection of local files on desktop.

Resolves #583

title: Bad file in structural variant view chord track results in getRefNames uncaught error
body: Steps: put a bad file path in the uri for the StructuralVariantChordTrack with VcfTabixAdapter

title: Electron release build
body:
This adds the ability to generate release ZIP files of the desktop build for Linux, Mac, and Windows.

Right now this packages the release ZIPs on Travis CI (since it runs `yarn build` for every package), but maybe it should just run the build step (i.e. the webpack step) and not the packaging step (i.e. the electron-builder step) for a normal CI run since packaging takes a lot of time and requires a lot more dependencies.

Resolves #592

title: Too many sessions opened up over time on desktop
body: General usage of the app may result in many sessions being created. We may want a compact session viewer (list of sessions) and bulk session deleter

title: Add BLAT sequence searching
body:
Navigating via sequence search can be very useful for users. We could remotely BLAT against UCSC or allow users to set it up locally.

Ex. https://software.broadinstitute.org/software/igv/BLAT

Having desktop allows us to ignore CORS constraints and such that would otherwise limit this application

title: Add mouseover shading
body:
This adds a generic mouseover with shading of the features for both svg and pileup tracks

The shading covers the whole area that the feature covers. 

It also makes the mouseover configurable

fixes #579 
fixes #580

title: hide empty tracksel categories when filtering
body: When you text filter in the track selector, if a category does not have any matching tracks in it, it should be hidden.

title: Update @gmod/bed and @gmod/bbi for bigbed fix, and add some clinvar tracks
body:
This adds clinvar and clinvar CNV for hg19 and hg38, and fixes a bug in @gmod/bbi and @gmod/bed that was stopping these from being loaded

Note that these contain some raw html in their feature detail panels, can do a safe rendering of this?

title: Enable development on Windows
body: In order to make sure the desktop version works well on Windows, I made some changes so our whole development toolchain can be done purely on Windows. Also now url encodes/decodes session file names on desktop so people can put whatever characters they want in their session name and the filesystem on any OS shouldn't complain.

title: Create global settings page
body: I think there could be global settings and it would be useful to have a menuitem and system for this

title: Perform stats estimation to avoid rendering too much data
body: If you are zoomed out most track types will still try to render even if it is way too much data to be done practically. The stats estimation is one option. Hardcoded limits like bpPerPx limits (done in sequence track) are another

title: Fix wig local autoscale with ref aliasing
body:
fixes #409 

 Also some miscellaneous eslint related things but wanted to keep the master branch clear for spreadsheet view

title: spreadsheet view
body:
fixes #474 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73749/68076005-b8309e00-fd6c-11e9-809a-6e9275d67d14.png)

title: Accessing authenticated resources
body: Need to make sure RemoteFile and various parts of the stack can allow this to happen, and possibly add UI for this

title: Create track menu
body: The concept of a "track menu" can be helpful to give special detailed menu options that are relevant for a track e.g. feature filters, toggle modes, etc. that are sort of related to config but more accessible

title: Show soft clipping option for BAM and CRAM alignments
body:
The softclipping can be rendered basically as all mismatches, but extend beyond the proper feature boundaries

My hackathon team lead at Houston used this feature for looking at CNV boundaries (the increased read depth will be associated with reads that dont really map well to the surrounding area so the clipping will be prominent in those)

title: Add SNPCoverage type track
body: Visualizing coverage from BAM files can be very useful for things like CNV/deletion detection, and would avoid the step of having to manually generate bigwigs for example

title: Add z-score scaling for wiggle tracks
body: This can be useful with many types of bigwigs, but maybe for example a coverage track for example where the deviations are the key indicator

title: Create general "highlight"/"marker" indicators
body:
The idea of a generic "highlight" that can span a region of the view would be useful to have, that could be similar to jbrowse 1 (interactive, draw a single region) or multiple (could come from a data store such as the peaks similar to https://github.com/cmdcolin/wigglehighlighter)

Could be track specific and/or view specific

The idea of a single bp "flag" to represent the breakpoints in the BreakpointSplitView was also discussed

title: Desktop version maximum number of clients error
body:
Several times I've seen the client close and then this error print in the console on the Linux electron desktop


Maximum number of clients reached[17066:1101/201357.804643:ERROR:shared_x_display.cc(37)] Unable to open display


If I get a reproducible example I will update. I know it's annoying to have a non-reproducible test case but this bug makes the client crash so it needs to be addressed somehow I think

title: Feature filters should re-trigger a layout
body:
Feature filters can be useful in a variety of circumstances, if there is a framework for creating them it would be useful for tracks to apply it.

Note that there is some question of "where" it goes. Maybe near the store is somewhere this could live. What I imagine is me trying to add some specific programmatic filter to the alignments track (filter out supplementary alignments for example)

This turns out to be fairly different from filtertrack

title: Color reads by haplotype
body:
This is a possibly nice kind of specific feature but would be a nice-to-have and a good example of what is needed to think about custom coloring features

Whatshap data could be used

title: Options for rendering mismatches when zoomed out
body: Long read data can be fairly noisy, and rendering all mismatches can look pretty noisy. It can be debateable whether they add any information at a certain point

title: Slow on loading a large nanopore BAM file
body: This is a pretty big stress test but the ultra-long nanopore file will be slow currently to browse around, where each new block load takes a long time (think minutes...). I think it's worth making this as fast as possible

title: Ref name aliasing for CRAM fails in seqFetch
JBrowse desktop manual build
body: Be able to build simple ZIP release files for Linux, MacOS, and Windows that we can send to alpha/preview users.

title: "Warning text content did not match" on VCF track and other errors
body:

title: Only first BND in ALT list is rendered by the StructuralVariantBreakendRenderer
body: This is a minor concern, but I wanted to have an issue for it in case it was something that needed addressing

title: Factor out some jbrowse-core-app modules to share jbrowse-web and jbrowse-desktop
body:
This is one possible todo to reduce redundancy between these modules

Other related problems

Config includes
Jettisoning jbrowse-web codebase to focus on jbrowse-desktop for now

title: Allow specifying a comma separated list of field names for label->name and label->description
body:
This is an observation that setting "labels->name": "my_custom_gff3_field" will instead of reading from my_custom_gff3_field for the feature name, will just make all feature names "my_custom_gff3_field"

This might involve a new config slot type, not sure..

title: Reduced representation of genes option
body: Sometimes viewing precise transcript structure is not the main goal, so displaying all transcript variants is too much. Collapsing the transcripts could be useful

title: difficult to click on SVG features
body: You have to click precisely on an exon. It is difficult if zoomed out. The entire feature rectangle, basically including the feature label should be included

title: Yarn upgrade causes errors on master after rescripts merge
Flesh out "help" and "about" in help menu
body: Probably need to have these say something meaningful before the public alpha. Right now they just have some placeholder text.

title: Add ability to add track from local file on desktop
body:
Currently "localFile" option is disabled when adding a new track.

Will need to send IPC message to main process, which will use electron's `dialog` to open the file selector dialog. Main process will send file path of selected file back to renderer process.

title: Fix block layout addressing #462
body:
This is a continuation of this attempted PR #514 but actually addresses the problem of #462 

The situation where every block used position:absolute meant that they were taken out of layout flow

Changing this to make TrackBlocks absolute (e.g. the entire set of blocks moves with the trackblocks container) is that min-height:100% for the Block.js actually works and it fills up the container with it's background: 'white' regardless of scroll pos

title: BEDPE store for StructuralVariantChordTrack
Create mouseover shading on hover
body: I am a fan of mouseover shading, but this is not available on svg or pileup views currently. Should be possible to do

title: Create configurable mouseover
Large BAI file is fully downloaded twice on track startup
body:
On small BAI files, there is a disk cache that saves the request for the BAI. On large BAI files, a new request is launched to download the file fully a second time. 

97mb BAI file https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/genomes/hg19/reads_lr_skbr3.fa_ngmlr-0.2.3_mapped.bam.bai
corresponding BAM https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/genomes/hg19/reads_lr_skbr3.fa_ngmlr-0.2.3_mapped.bam

title: Support TRA in VCF
body:
Breakend is a standardized way of representing variants but some variant callers, notably Sniffles, output it as `<TRA>`

If we want to support outputs by tools such as sniffles, they represent `<TRA>` as the ALT, then have in the INFO field `CHR2=` of the interchromosomal endpoint, and then also, somewhat weirdly, uses the END field in the INFO to indicate the start of the breakend on the CHR2

Example file https://s3.amazonaws.com/jbrowse.org/genomes/hg19/reads_lr_skbr3.fa_ngmlr-0.2.3_mapped.bam.sniffles1kb_auto_l8_s5_noalt.vcf.gz
Xref https://github.com/fritzsedlazeck/Sniffles/issues/121

title: Add optimizations for faster FPS
body:
* Use rAF for scrolling to prevent multiple scroll events per frame, this is a big fps win. You could see in performance traces multiple wheel events would fire per-frame and this would cause lots of excessive CPU burn (https://calendar.perfplanet.com/2013/the-runtime-performance-checklist/)

* Remove need for LinearGenomeView to re-render on each frame

* Switch from toLocaleString to a "mathPower" function in Ruler. This is faster and the Ruler re-rendering can cause a significant frame rate stutter if it is slow (https://jsperf.com/locale-number-formatting/16)

* Debounce the session updater

title: Preloaded datasets for the November release
body:
We are aiming to ship a human dataset with the November release of JBrowse2

config.json - datasets that will be loaded GRCh37/hg19 and GRCh38/hg38 (include the aliases) [remove or hide volvox sample data] (URL to bgzipped fasta indexed on s3)

config.json - will include hardcoded, maybe a single gene track [gencode/ensembl/mane] NCList or BigBed, probably just do NCList

config.json - includes connection to COSMIC as a jbrowse 1 data hub. COSMIC has both grch37 and grch38 datasets loaded

AWS s3 - will make a small jbrowse 1 hub just for this purpose for updating with custom tracks that we decide are needed

title: Allow specifying an alternative config file on the URL bar
Right click and moving mouse results in a view scroll
body: This is a minor weirdness but you can right click, bring up default browser context menu, move mouse, and then unselecting the mouse moves the view

title: Read detail view
body:
Viewing the details of a specific reads alignment versus the reference can be useful, this is an example from genomeribbon.com (has "synteny" and dotplot style views)

![genomeribbon com__perma=E_PacBio_SKBR3_TRA_chr16_to_chr19_(5MB) (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/67517238-29d36280-f670-11e9-8f75-aa7c0a890e29.png)

title: Fix refName labeling zIndex issue and unify implementation of refName labels
body: This gets rid of the idea of refName labels being part of both Ruler and ScaleBar in slightly different ways, making it all a part of ScaleBar, and also fixes #554 by making the zIndex of the label on the right bigger than the one on the left

title: Fix layout bug #553
body:
This fixes #553 by making sure to take into account this.rowState.offset in all cases (specifically, it seems that oRight was not re-initialized with right-this.rowState.offset after the block in question). If you console.log this.rowState.offset before and after the loop, it can change in some cases, and oRight was specifically not updated.

This also re-initializes this.rowState=initialize(left,right) as calling initialize(left,right) with no assignment would be void when the layout width is exceeded.

title: Use a rtree to find the relevant mouseover/clicked feature

This optimizes mouse clicks and eventually will optimize mouseovers on pileup renderings, currently applying to alignments tracks (eventually made more generic most likely)

This actually works, and is already faster than the current implementation, but it actually recomputes an rtree on every mousemove which is not great

I receive the console.log [mobx.trace] 'ObservableObject@517.rtree' is being read outside a reactive context. Doing a full recompute

I am not exactly sure what to do about that

This also does a slightly funky merger of layout y-coordinates and base pair x-coordinates but I was having trouble getting the layout (which is in pixel coordinates) to cooperate with the mouse (which is also in pixel coordinates, just a bit differently) so I just operate all in base pair coords

title: Add additional BamAdapter configs (like chunkSizeLimit)
body: Currently if you browse a deep BAM, it's possible to get to an error like: `Error: Too many BAM features. BAM chunk size 10893136 bytes exceeds chunkSizeLimit of 10000000`, which originates in bam-js. bam-js has an option for increasing chunkSizeLimit, but it's not exposed in JBrowse currently. Perhaps we should add chunksizeLimit (and maybe also fetchSizeLimit and cacheSize?) to the BamAdapter config schema so that people can increase them if they want. Probably need a warning in the description of each entry that raising the limits can impact performance.

title: Design proper behavior for drawing lines for the split read views
body:
In a split read view we have information such as this

r003 0 ref 9 30 5S6M * 0 0 GCCTAAGCTAA * SA:Z:ref,29,-,6H5M,17,0;
r003 2064 ref 29 17 6H5M * 0 0 TAGGC * SA:Z:ref,9,+,5S6M,30,1;


We know that r003 is the same QNAME for both reads, and the BAM flag 2048 indicates supplementary/chimeric alignment on the second read. The second read also has 16 (read reverse complemented) on it, so the sequence is actually reverseComplement(TAGGC)==GCCTA. You can see that the first read has the first 5 bases soft clipped, which are the bases in second read

In any case, with a supplementary alignment, the read could be fragmented into many small pieces, and the way the data is organized does not make it easy to reconstruct necessarily the "order" that the records came from in the original "read template".

The way to reconstruct this order would be to literally string find the sequence, or the reverse complemented sequence of any supplementary read inside the sequence of the primary read. So that means, any usage of supplementary reads reconstruction needs redispatching to get the primary alignment (which requires getting actually all of the alignments in the SA tag list, since it doesn't tell you which is primary) and then doing string match


One further complication is that, if our "split view" does not contain all the fragments of a supplementary alignment, then connecting the fragments "end-to-end" is a bit dubious, but maybe this could be indicated with modified lines perhaps

title: Electron build of JBrowse desktop
body:
This started out as a bit of a crazy idea, but now I kind of hope it works out. Basically this makes a new create-react-app (CRA) app for jbrowse-sv-inspector-desktop and builds it in electron. The development version works fine, and I'm working on getting it to build a production version.

As I was working on getting a new electron project going, I tried to start from scratch, but there were so many webpack, babel, etc. things to set up. There are some boilerplates out there, but none of them were great. Really, nothing as nice as what CRA put in place for us in jbrowse-web.

Then I found [this](https://www.codementor.io/randyfindley/how-to-build-an-electron-app-using-create-react-app-and-electron-builder-ss1k0sfer) article on creating an electron app using CRA. It's not exactly what we want, but has some good ideas and gave me a good starting point. Currently you can try out `yarn start` in jbrowse-sv-inspector-desktop and it runs basically a copy of jbrowse-web in an electron window.

Things still to see:

* Can we get good cross-platform builds out of this? (The article above uses electron-builder, which I'm experimenting with now)
* Can we integrate the electron-specific features we want (file system access, etc.) in a safe way using this?

This article above also uses something called [rescripts](https://github.com/harrysolovay/rescripts), which lets you hack your CRA setup without ejecting. I actually used it to un-eject jbrowse-web, so that both it and jbrowse-sv-inspector-desktop can take advantage of the latest CRA updates and we don't have to maintain the dev and build systems separately.

resolves #195
resolves #484 
resolves #512

title: Update granular rect layout extension to use original jbrowse 1 code
body:
The granular rect layout was producing two errors

1) Maximum stack size exceeded due to the spread being bad
2) Excessive layout being thrown away and re-initialized due to apparently the Math.max being used and being set to this.offset, which was way larger than the additionalLength that was proposed to be added

This reverts those changes to a jbrowse 1 style code (currLength - oLeft == this.offset - left + currLength  from jb1's granular rect layout)

title: Optimize trackblock rerendering
body:
This makes it so that blocks are not individually given a style: { left: px } attributes but instead the entire set of blocks has a offsetPx. This reduces some re-rendering

It also

- uses the normal onWheel instead of addEventListener('wheel')
- reduces instances of updateSavedSession

title: Optimize drawer rerendering
body:
This uses React.memo to optimize the re-rendering of the drawer widget

This is pretty helpful for performance, you can see in all our performance traces that the Drawer widget will get constantly re-rendered without this

title: Fix issue with some undefined features being found in layout due to granular rect resolution
body:
Fixes #486 

This bug was a bit tricky

This error actually wasn't occurring on master because the max height for SVG bugfix introduced a concept that hard-filters undefined features from the layout, however, there was a actual issue with serializeRegion where it was filtering out things that were getting missed due to the pitchX resolution apparently missing things

I added a pitchX adjustment of -1 and +1 on the left and right to avoid missing layout'd features that should actually be included

title: Fix horizontal flip on displayed regions
body:
This makes the concept of the displayedRegions being horizontallyFlipped into a view called effectiveRegions. I could have modified it so that "displayedRegions" itself was a view, but that would sort of change the "public API" of setting displayedRegions from config files for example, which seems to be something that might be worth keeping. Therefore I chose to make "effectiveRegions" the name of the view.


fixes #502

body:
This creates a mock for @testing-library/react in `packages/__mocks__/@testing-library/react.js` that wraps all calls to render() in the <StylesProvider> with a generateClassName function to removes the numerical suffix

Fixes #500

title: Horizontal flip does not perform properly when the set of displayedRegions is not tied to an assembly
body:
If you have displayedRegions as like ctgA:100..200 and ctgA:500..600, then horizontal flipping changes these both into displayedRegions of ctgA:0-100 basically

Relevant to stuff that was seen in #498 but exists as a bug on it's own

title: Make changing height from config editor work
body:
This fixes the problem where changing height in the config editor didn't update the layout, so features would just get taller and overlap each other. It has two parts: 1) Put the renderer config in the renderProps so that changing the height triggers a re-render 2) Update GranularRectLayout so that it doesn't use its cached rectangles during `addRect` if the cached rectangle has a different height.

This is a draft because while this solution works, I still don't like it. First of all, I don't like sticking the entire renderer config in the renderProps, since a re-render will be triggered on any config change, even where it's not needed (like updating the color). However, I don't want to only add the height config to the renderProps since a re-render should also be triggered on a change of fontSize, alignmentHeight, and possible=y other (maybe not implemented yet) configs.

The other thing I worry about is my solution for the GranularRectLayout. The order that rects get added with `addRect` matters, right? Right now this solution saves the order the rects were added (`this.rectangles` is a Map now instead of an object) so it can re-add them to the bitmap after the bitmap is cleared. The bitmap is cleared any time a height change in a rect is detected. It also only re-adds the rects before the changed rect since it assumes any later rects will have `addRect` called on them after (assuming order matters) and drops the rest of the cache after the changed. I think this works, but I also might be misunderstanding parts of GranularRectLayout. It's possible we could also just dump the GranularRectLayout and make a new one when a height is changed, but I'd have to figure out where in the code that would go.

fixes #107

body:
The usage of className in snapshots causes a lot of churn in tests

It would be useful to just remove them from snapshots

Possible mock where they override to just put the entire class style object in instead of the classname linked here:

https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/issues/14357

title: drawn content can overlap the border of a block
body:
When a block in a track in an LGV is on the right border of a displayedRegion, its drawn content overlaps the right border, because the block has the `rightBorder` class (which adds `    border-right: 2px solid #333`), and its box-sizing is border-box.

We maybe should just be putting padding blocks in here instead.

title: SPARQL adapter
body:
Still a draft since it needs tests and docs.

Based on [JBrowse1 SPARQL](http://jbrowse.org/docs/sparql.html).

SPARQL adapter will replace {start}, {end}, and {refName} in a SPARQL query string stored in `queryTemplate` in the config. Can also configure `additionalQueryParams` in case the query needs to include something like `format=JSON`.

To enable refName aliasing, provide a query in `refNamesQueryTemplate` that provides a ?refName column that has all of the refNames.

Also incorporates ideas from TogoGenome's custom JBrowse1 SPARQL implementation. Basically the problem they were solving is that it's often hard to write a query that has parent and subfeatures on different rows, so it's hard to use the parentUniqueID in JB1. More often each row will have the parent and subfeatures in the same line. This PR adds functionality so that any column that starts with ?sub_ will define a subfeature from that data (and ?sub_sub_ will define a subsubfeature, etc.). Any features that are duplicated across lines will get collapsed. A sample track is included that uses this pattern to make genes with subfeatures from the TogoGenome SPARQL endpont.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/64316811-e2761180-cff0-11e9-8e7d-d0320160ba7d.png)

```SPARQL
DEFINE sql:select-option "order"
PREFIX  rdf:  <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX  insdc: <http://ddbj.nig.ac.jp/ontologies/nucleotide/>
PREFIX  faldo: <http://biohackathon.org/resource/faldo#>
PREFIX  xsd:  <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
PREFIX  sio:  <http://semanticscience.org/resource/>
PREFIX  rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX  obo:  <http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/>

SELECT DISTINCT ?uniqueId ("gene" AS ?type) ?start ?end ?sub_uniqueId ("mRNA" AS ?sub_type) ?sub_start ?sub_end ?sub_sub_uniqueId ("CDS" AS ?sub_sub_type) ?sub_sub_start ?sub_sub_end ?faldo_type ?strand (?strand AS ?sub_strand) (?strand AS ?sub_sub_strand) ?name ?description ?sub_name ?sub_description ?sub_class
FROM <http://togogenome.org/graph/refseq>
FROM <http://togogenome.org/graph/so>
FROM <http://togogenome.org/graph/faldo>
WHERE
  { VALUES ?sub_class { obo:SO_0000316 obo:SO_0000253 obo:SO_0000252 }
    ?refseq_id  insdc:sequence_version  "{refName}" ;
              insdc:sequence        ?seq_id .
    ?uniqueId  obo:so_part_of        ?seq_id ;
              rdfs:subClassOf       obo:SO_0000704 ;
              faldo:location        ?loc .
    ?loc  faldo:begin          ?begin .
    ?begin    faldo:position        ?start_pos .
    ?loc faldo:end/faldo:position ?end_pos
      { BIND(faldo:ForwardStrandPosition AS ?faldo_type)
        BIND(1 AS ?strand)
        ?begin  rdf:type  faldo:ForwardStrandPosition
      }
    UNION
      { BIND(faldo:ReverseStrandPosition AS ?faldo_type)
        BIND(-1 AS ?strand)
        ?begin  rdf:type  faldo:ReverseStrandPosition
      }
    UNION
      { BIND(faldo:BothStrandPosition AS ?faldo_type)
        BIND(0 AS ?strand)
        ?begin  rdf:type  faldo:BothStrandPosition
      }
    FILTER ( ! ( ( ?start_pos > {end} ) || ( ?end_pos < {start} ) ) )
    ?sub_uniqueId  obo:so_part_of   ?uniqueId ;
              rdfs:subClassOf  ?sub_class ;
              faldo:location   ?sub_loc .
    ?sub_loc faldo:begin/faldo:position ?sub_start_pos .
    ?sub_loc faldo:end/faldo:position ?sub_end_pos .
    ?sub_uniqueId  obo:so_has_part  ?sub_sub_uri ;
              sio:SIO_000974   ?uuid .
    ?uuid     sio:SIO_000628   ?sub_sub_uri .
    ?sub_sub_uri  rdfs:subClassOf  obo:SO_0000147 ;
              faldo:location   ?sub_sub_loc .
    ?sub_sub_loc faldo:begin/faldo:position ?sub_sub_start_pos .
    ?sub_sub_loc faldo:end/faldo:position ?sub_sub_end_pos
    OPTIONAL
      { ?uniqueId  rdfs:label  ?name }
    OPTIONAL
      { ?uniqueId  insdc:product  ?product }
    OPTIONAL
      { ?uniqueId  insdc:note  ?note }
    OPTIONAL
      { ?sub_uniqueId  rdfs:label  ?sub_name }
    OPTIONAL
      { ?sub_uniqueId  insdc:product  ?sub_product }
    OPTIONAL
      { ?sub_uniqueId  insdc:note  ?sub_note }
    BIND(if(( ?faldo_type = faldo:ReverseStrandPosition ), ?sub_sub_end_pos, ?sub_sub_start_pos) AS ?sub_sub_start)
    BIND(if(( ?faldo_type = faldo:ReverseStrandPosition ), ?sub_sub_start_pos, ?sub_sub_end_pos) AS ?sub_sub_end)
    BIND(if(( ?faldo_type = faldo:ReverseStrandPosition ), ?end_pos, ?start_pos) AS ?start)
    BIND(if(( ?faldo_type = faldo:ReverseStrandPosition ), ?start_pos, ?end_pos) AS ?end)
    BIND(if(( ?faldo_type = faldo:ReverseStrandPosition ), ?sub_end_pos, ?sub_start_pos) AS ?sub_start)
    BIND(if(( ?faldo_type = faldo:ReverseStrandPosition ), ?sub_start_pos, ?sub_end_pos) AS ?sub_end)
    BIND(iri(concat(str(?sub_sub_uri), "-", str(?uuid))) AS ?sub_sub_uniqueId)
    BIND(coalesce(?product, ?note, "") AS ?description)
    BIND(coalesce(?sub_product, ?sub_note, "") AS ?sub_description)
  }
```

title: Multi-chromosome layout and multi-chromosome feature representations
body:
If we wanted to, in a single linear genome view, plot a "connection" between read pairs as a single row in a layout, then we need to define a multi-chromosome/displayed-region layout and a multi-chromosome feature representation

![untitled (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/64209959-ef1f2c00-ce6f-11e9-8dd1-f162715ee44c.png)




Note that there are alternatives to this including the split-view that we are targeting, which may not require this. In the split view, the features are connected "post-processing" of the layout's results which scans the layouts features and connects them afterwards


I am posting this issue with a "needs review" and it's entirely possibly we don't need this but I wanted to show that this is needed if we wanted this type of pairing to happen, relevant to #112

title: Create padding block for split view
body:
In order to display "split reads" it is helpful for each linear genome view to have "padding blocks" (here colored green)

Top and bottom are linear genome views
The green box is a "padding block" that spans the views
The two black boxes are a split read
The grey boxes are a paired read

With split reads, the padding blocks create a better visual representation because otherwise all the split reads are indicated by a vertical connection but with padding it can be extended diagonally

![untitled (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/64081279-b5fa8680-cccc-11e9-89d0-6ba95f1140b0.png)

title: Investigate whether the maxInsertSize concept is required
body:
A limit of jbrowse 1 paired read rendering was the idea of the max insert size

It solved problems with actual paired read rendering by not fetching the features beyond a certain TLEN/insert size distance.

Problems that maxInsertSize solved included

1) scrolling to the right causing pairs to appears on the left requires re-rendering the layout completely, so we will need a way to trigger a relayout/rerender if we are allowing arbitrary insert sizes
2) arbitrary insert sizes can end up downloading a lot of data, need to be careful with this
3) the arc track did not require any refetching of the pairs so it solved this elegantly, only the true paired read glyphs required full refetching using the viewAsPairs parameter to bam-js

Ref #112

title: spreadsheet view
body:
It's a nice react grid/sortable table.  NOT lazy loaded for now. Loads the whole thing into memory. We can do lazy loading later if there's demand.

Can view CSV, TSV, any delimited text data. Data can be gzipped, or not. This also encompasses VCF, STAR-fusion, gff, which are all actually TSV.

Can recognize locations in its columns and make them clickable links that open a LGV at that location. Will take some thought to design how to interpret the locations for each file type.

Exposes an MST view that is just an array of objects that contain the "final" data, that other code can use.

View has a fileLocation for the file, and a config schema, and the import settings are in the config schema. Re-imports the file when the import settings change.

If configured to do so, each row has a checkbox that can select that row. Also exposes an MST view of the set of rows that are selected. Might also have a onSelect/onDeselect config callback that gets called when a row is selected.

Has a simple text filter box at the top that just filters for rows that contain the typed text. Exposes an MST view of the rows that match the filter.

Also exposes an MST view of the rows that match the filter AND are selected. (i.e. set intersection of selected and filtered rows)

In the long run, we're going to need to have different filtering GUIs for different uses of this view (SV inspector, bookmark lists, a "quick view" of the underlying file for a track). So try to make the filtering functionality pluggable or configurable in some way.

title: modal dialogs + popup feature details
body:
make it so that:
* A session can have a volatile state that is the currently-shown popup
* The popup state is just a react component, and the props for that react component.
* The react component will be drawn (by logic in the root model/root react component probably ) inside a modal popup.
* The props should not be state tree nodes, because that would cause problems.

title: tabbed session switching
body:
Have a tab bar along the bottom of the main page that looks a lot like the sheet switcher in Google Sheets.

Each "tab" is a session, can rename sessions, create new session, etc, using this tab bar.

title: Various housekeeping
body:
Just a couple various housekeeping items I've been meaning to get around to:
- Replace `classnames` package with `clsx`. It's a drop-in replacement, and it is already being installed anyway since material-ui has it as a dep.
- Convert a bunch of `withStyles` HOCs to `makeStyles` hooks. Makes code a bit cleaner, and allows for IntelliSense when doing styling:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25592344/63784571-d7b6d080-c8bc-11e9-98e9-90f2d134bed0.png)
- Factor all the resize handles (LGV track, circular view, filtering track controls, drawer) into a common ResizeHandle component.
- Get rid of `mobx-react-lite`, since the latest version of `mobx-react` works for hook-based components.
- Import things from material-ui as e.g. `import Paper from '@material-ui/core/Paper'` instead of `import { Paper } from '@material-ui/core'`. This can help keep bundle size down (https://material-ui.com/guides/minimizing-bundle-size/), although it's perhaps defeated by importing all of `@materail-ui/core` in `ReExports.js`.

title: Remove blockState via postProcessSnapshot
Fix feature not found in precomputed layout error

body:
This is a sort of intricate stringing through of observer() that ends up reducing Ruler bar re-renderings

It also makes calculateStaticBlocks not return a new object if it is unchanged, which possibly could be done more intelligently, but it is effective in it's current state in reducing the re-renders

Addresses #434

body:
Users need to be able to add new glyph types via plugins.

Possible technical approach:
* Add a new glyph type to the pluginManager.
* Make it so people can register new SVG glyph types.
* Make the chooseGlyphComponent function configurable to find those new glyph types.

title: Session updates

The LongMenu component appears to re-render on all scrolls which is expensive

title: Make histogram density tracks for feature tracks
body:
Different track types need histograms generally because otherwise it incurs too much data downloading

- NCList
- BAM
- Tabix

If we don't have this or can't get valid estimated feature densities, we can display "Zoom in to see data" similar to the sequence track

This falls under a larger category of "semantic zooming" but it's primarily needed to avoid large amounts of data downloads.

title: Vertical scrolling within track reveals weirdness about block boundaries
body:
If a track is vertical scrolled, and the blocks have different heights, the TrackRenderingContainer component background of #333 becomes visible as staggered blocks due to different blocks having different heights. Note that the Track component background: #555 which is slightly different from the #333, and if you make the TrackRenderingContainer's background #fff you will see it stretches past the boundaries of all displayedRegions and doesn't look right either

Since this is just a temporary measure, I think it should be ok.

title: Create alignment viewer
body:
I think it would be very useful to create an "alignment viewer" that compares an alignment versus a reference which can show insertions /deletions/matches/mismatches

This can be seen as in some ways similar to synteny in some ways, as a genome-to-genome is basically a large scale alignment, but a large scale genome-to-genome will probably be broken up into multiple alignments that get chained together (small scale example of MT-human vs MT-orang in minimap2 docs is a single alignment and can output SAM)

title: Protein widget restore
body:
This restores functionality to the protein widget

It also performs a try/catch on some of the work in the serverSideRenderedBlock to catch if some error occurs

It also required copying the entire rpcMethods over from jbrowse-web into the protein widget

I am not sure if there is a better way. Otherwise I have to make a dependency on @gmod/jbrowse-web

Also I changed usages of seq_id to refName. I did not implement an automatic translation between the two. The NCListFeature adapts between seq_id and refName in it's specialized example but I just made all usages in the protein widget just pass refName instead of seq_id.

This did a lerna run -- yarn upgrade and that gives us react 16.9 and other goodies


- This does not change MST version as that is pinned in the package.json
- It gets fixes some typescript on the IRegion, which also involved removing the "get locstring()" view.
- It polyfills some window things for running react in the webworker (window.Date, rIC, rAF)
- Manually updated typedoc because it was making "yarn tsc" run and older version of typescript, now it should be latest.

We want to implement a central session repository that will host people's session data.

It also makes the width 100% for the circular view which causes it to naturally display the scrollbar because previously it is missing (the manual setting of the width makes it go behind the drawer widget)

If it is not supposed to be available to end users at all, then I would suggest removing it completely.

title: Setting horizontallyFlipped on the LinearGenomeView does not reverse the displayedRegions
body:
The draft PR in #442 implements a sample which turns on the horizontallyFlipped flag, but this does not result in all the displayedRegions being reversed. I think the ideal situation is that you have


chr1, chr2, chr3...

After flip

chr3, chr2, chr1...

But it just reverses each chr in place. 

We tried a simple approach like this but it wasn't picking up the horizontallyFlipped flag change

```
diff --git a/packages/jbrowse-web/src/sessionModelFactory.js b/packages/jbrowse-web/src/sessionModelFactory.js
index e71cb808..4f6860d7 100644
--- a/packages/jbrowse-web/src/sessionModelFactory.js
+++ b/packages/jbrowse-web/src/sessionModelFactory.js
@@ -106,10 +106,13 @@ export default pluginManager => {
               self.assemblyData.get(assemblyName).sequence
             ) {
               // eslint-disable-next-line no-await-in-loop
-              const displayedRegions = await self.getRegionsForAssembly(
+              let displayedRegions = await self.getRegionsForAssembly(
                 assemblyName,
                 self.assemblyData,
               )
+              if (view.horizontallyFlipped) {
+                displayedRegions = displayedRegions.reverse()
+              }
```

title: block errors on tracks should have some way to be cleared
body:
Right now, if you go to the human test data, turn on the high-coverage 1kG BAM track and poke around a bit, you will eventually hit a data size fetch limit on at least some of the blocks and they will be set into an error state, e.g. "data fetch size exceeded".  Even if you zoom out or in, that error sticks around until you zoom out or in far enough for that particular block structure to be destroyed.

We probably need to tweak the track error logic to make it easier to navigate around those fetch size errors.

title: Re-initialize the layout if any of the height's don't match for PileupRenderer
body:
This recreates the layout if we detect that the originalHeight doesn't match a new height being passed in

This fixes #107 in a way that works for the PileupRenderer, but it does not work for the SvgFeatureRenderer.

In the SvgFeatureRenderer case, the PrecomputedLayout is what ends up being called with modified height, and I couldn't really figure out how to wire it to the backend to properly re-render it again

wait/waitForElement several times.

title: LGV header
body:
This is a preview of what a header for the Linear genome view could possibly look like

It does these things

* restores ability to horizontally flip the view
* has a vertical ... menu format
* allows itself to show/hide the header
* has ability to view the entire set of displayed regions from a zoomed-out point of view

Some of my proposed features including locstring input and refseq name dropdown are in some sense very problematic with our arbitrary notion of displayed regions. Therefore, these features may have to be removed, or linked to only show when the displayedRegions are tied to the assembly.

![localhost_3000_ (3)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6511937/62497971-9d6d7e00-b7ab-11e9-87ec-449ed0355f72.png)
